loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 52 años de edad,habitante de la ciudad de Leon, casada, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulperia. madre de 4 hijos pero actualmente se hace cargo de sus nietos. Orgullosa y contenta encontramos a doña Mercedes quien nos muestra cuanto ha avanzado su negocio gracias al apoyo recibido de kiva con el primer  prestamo , pues ahora ofrece mas mercaderia ha ido edificando su casa poco a poco.Ahora solicita un segundo credito para abastecerse de granos basicos,jugos, gaseosas , sopas , productos enlatados, detergentes, jabones, cosmeticos, pues se acerca la temporada navideña y quiere aprovechar las buenas ventas que se dan durante esta epoca.Siempre esta en sus planes seguir haciendo mejoras su casa  y su  pulperia.
texts.en: Mercedes is 52 years old, resident of the city of Leon, and married.  She is a storekeeper, owner of a general store.  She has 4 children and currently is taking care of her grandchildren.  We find Doña Mercedes proud and happy as she shows us how far her business has come with the support from Kiva and her first loan.  She is now offering more merchandise and has been slowly building her house.  She is now requesting a second loan to stock up on basic grains, juices, sodas, soups, canned products. detergents, soaps, cosmetics, because the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to take advantage of the good sales that occur during this time.  Her plans always include making improvements to her home and her store.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soap, and cleaning products to supply her store with new and improved products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a single mother of one child, lives in Mombasa, Kenya where she has operated a boutique for two years, a business she started from her own savings. Cecilia's challenges are a lack of capital and customers not paying on time.

Having leaned of Milango from her friends, she joined the group in order to access capital and is now requesting a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase more clothes. Cecilia will use the additional income arising from this loan to start a fish-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Рачабхола - многодетная женщина на пенсии, живет в горном районе, где основным делом и бизнесом является животноводство. Вся семья - невестки,сыновья и внуки помогают присматривать за скотом. Муж на пенсии, подрабатывает на колхозе и немного поддерживает семейный бюджет. Кроме откорма скота женщины прядут пряжу из шерсти своих коз и вяжут носки и изделия на продажу. За период кредитования у нас увеличила свой скот, немного улучшила состояние дома. Женила сына и наш кредит ей очень помог, за что благодарна и планирует с нами работать и дальше. На запрашиваемый кредит собирается прикупить мелкий скот.
texts.en: Rajabhola is a retired woman, who has many children and lives in a mountainous district, where animal husbandry is the primary type of work and business.  The entire family - daughters-in-law, sons and grandsons - help to look after the livestock.  Rajab's husband is also a retiree.  He works part-time at a collective farm and supports the family budget somewhat.  Besides feeding livestock, the women spin yarn from their goats' wool and knit socks and other goods for sale.  Over the period of obtaining financing with us, Rajab increased her livestock headcount and somewhat improved her housing conditions.  She married off her son, and our loan helped her a lot, for which she is grateful and plans to continue working with us.  She plans to use this loan to purchase small livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres del Chaco se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras, ellas tienen el deseo de sobresalir por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación y su meta es poder llegar al nivel máximo del mismo.
Una de estas mujeres trabajadoras es la señora Denice, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas. Ella nos comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que ya ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compran de ella, lo cual le trae muy buen ingreso. Ella sueña con poder tener, algún día, una pequeña joyería donde ofrecer sus productos.
Ellas pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de joyas, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás tipos, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
These 11 women from Chaco joined together in order to help each other, and they all share the desire to succeed by working together. They are in the first cycle of the foundation's women entrepreneurs program, and their goal is to reach the highest level of the program.

One of these entrepreneurial women is Denice, who sells jewelry. She says that sales have been very good and she has formed a good base of customers who always buy her products, giving her a very good income. She dreams to someday own a small jewelry store where she can offer their products.

The women have asked for help from the foundation and Kiva so that they can purchase of jewelry, such as rings, chains, bracelets and other types, which will replenish their stock and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase rings, chains, bracelets and other types of jewelry.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Wilson de Jesús es un hombre que salió de su municipio en busca de una mejor alternativa de vida, pues hace algún tiempo se trasladó hacia el municipio de marinilla, al oriente del departamento de Antioquia, donde vio la agricultura como su posible fuente de ingresos; allí aprendió esta actividad y desde entonces esta ha sido su fuente de ingresos, donde sus principales productos son la siembra de fríjol y apio. Actualmente, con 39 años de edad y un hogar conformado por su esposa y sus 2 hijos, Wilson de Jesús busca poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y una manera de lograr esto, es aumentando la cantidad de productos que siembra, para la cual desea iniciar un nuevo cultivo de cilantro para el cual requiere de la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y materiales tales como madera y alambre para poder cercar su cultivo y así cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Wilson de Jesús is a man who emigrated from his town in search of a better life alternative.  Some time ago he had to leave his town to look for better economic stability in the town of Marinilla in the east of Antioquia Department where he saw farming as a possible source of income.  He learned farming in this town and since then it’s been his source of income through bean and celery farming.  Currently, at the age of 39 and with a home consisting of his wife and two children, Wilson de Jesús seeks to increase his income to improve the quality of life for his household members and a way of doing this is to increase the amount of products he farms. He would like to invest in a new crop of cilantro and for this reason he needs to purchase seeds, fertilizers, irrigation supplies, fertilizers, and wood and wire to be able to fence in his crop and in this way comply with his dream.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, irrigation supplies, and fertilizer to start his cilantro harvest

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is 42 years old and married with 3 children living in Masindi, Uganda.

For the last 1 and a half years he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business with his salary savings earned as a civil servant. His dream is to educate children and build a permanent house. He is challenged by customers not paying on time, inadequate capital and high taxes. Bruno wants a loan to buy sodas, water and beer to resell.

loans.use: to buy beer, water and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Floricelda Lorena

texts.es:
FLORICELDA LORENA  tiene 36 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

FLORICELDA LORENA Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito  podrá realizar las compras sin ninguún tipo de problemas.

El sueño es poder tener una casa y tener mas terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar y cocinar.
texts.en:
Floricelda, 36, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children, ages 15 and 8, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She's a member of Las Palmas Communal Bank, located in Recinto Campo Alegre in Bab Canton, where they farm.

Floricelda has worked for 10 years in farming, growing corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She's requesting the loan to plant corn and buy agricultural fertilizer.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to invest in agriculture and earn a profit.

Her dream is to be able to have a house.  She hasn't experienced any kind of problem.  In her free time she likes to visit her family.

loans.use: comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old married man from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for items for marriage. He wants to buy furniture and households items for his home. He hopes in the future to improve his family living standard.

loans.use: to pay for items for marriage

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith specializes in frying and selling fish. She personally goes to the river bank to buy her fish and fries it over there and later brings it home for sale in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has been educated through the end of middle school.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is in to farming. Judith has been working in this enterprise for 10 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock (gallon of oil, baskets full of various types of fish) levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fried fish business and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages and sell wholesale to other women especially food vendors.

loans.use: to increase her current stock (gallon of oil, baskets full of various types of fish) levels.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Olga Lidia is a married woman, she is 37 years old and has four children. She started this business, hoping to become self-sufficient and offer a better future to her children. This business is selling and processing of cleaning products. When she started, she only sold cleaning products but at this moment she is also processing them with the support of her suppliers. People from her neighborhood like and prefer her products.

The problem that she faces at this moment is the lack of working capital because she has three children in school. She had to make many payments before they're welcome to return to class. And for this reason she requires a loan by $375 USD to invest in the purchase of raw materials and merchandise. She is asking for a term to pay back in 4-8 months.

ESPAÑOL

Olga Lidia es una mujer casada, tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos, hace cinco años inicio su negocio pensando en contar con ingresos propios y poder brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de productos de limpieza, cuando inició su negocio solamente vendía productos, pero con el tiempo empezó a elaborarlos con el apoyo se sus proveedores, en este momento la gente de su colonia la conoce y acude a comprar sus productos.

El problema que enfrenta en este momento es la falta de capital de trabajo debido a que tiene tres hijos en la escuela y tuvo que realizar muchos gastos extra por el regreso a clases de sus hijos, es por ello que requiere de $375 USD para reinvertir en la compra de materias primas y mercancías, solicita un plazo para pagar de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Hamdulla

texts.en: Hamdulla A. owns a small clothing and perfume shop in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Hamdulla wants to increase her inventory with more varied items so that her customers will have more choices. She believes she will attract more customers and sell more to each individual customer with a more varied inventory.

loans.use: Increase and diversify inventory to attract more customers.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy has 19 years of experience selling meat. He learned this trade when he began working with his uncle when he was 12. With all of his experience he decided to use this meat selling business as a source of income to take care of his family. Eddy asked a friend who sold meat for a loan and 50 pounds of meat and meat products in order to open his business. Eddy sells his products from a cart going across the island to sell door to door. He sells from 8:30am-12pm and from 4pm-7pm. Eddy is asking for a loan in order to increase business due to greater demand. He also wants to fix his cart or buy a new one. Eddy, 31, is young and hard working. He puts a lot of effort into what he does. His wife helps him cleaning the meat so that they can be successful and provide a good life and education for their 3 children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Eddy tiene 19 años de experiencia en venta de carne. Oficio que lo aprendió porque trabajo con un tío a la edad de 12 años. Con esta experiencia Eddy decidió que este negocio de carne seria su fuente de ingreso y sustento para su familia. Eddy le solicito a un amigo expendedor de carnes que le diera crédito el mismo que accedió ayudarlo y le dio 50 libras de carnes y vísceras con lo que Eddy emprendió su negocio. Eddy expende su producto en un triciclo recorriendo el sector de la isla dando un servicio de venta de puerta a puerta. Inicia su recorrido en la mañana desde la 8:30AM a 12PM y en las tardes desde las 16PM a 19PM.

Eddy solicita préstamo para incrementar su negocio debido a que su demanda ha crecido y también quiere readecuar su triciclo o comprarse otro.

Eddy es un joven trabajador tiene 31 años y se esfuerza bastante junto con su esposa que lo ayuda mucho en la limpieza de las carnes para de esta manera salir adelante y poder darles mejor bienestar y educación a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: To buy meat and improve his selling cart

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a married mother of three children. She came to Kampala in 2000 when the insecurity in northern Uganda worsened. She first settled in Buyale in the Masindi district. Eventually, she resettled at Acholi quarters, Kireka in Kampala with her family.

Being a hard working lady, she joined the stone quarry to work as a means of survival. After a while, she joined the Life in Africa organization. She started learning how to make paper beads like the other ladies, to earn extra income. This brought a lot of changes to her life and she hopes to put up a permanent home for her family. She hopes to do this when peace comes back to northern Uganda.

As for now she wishes to resume a business of selling produce. She had such a business before moving to Kampala. She will be buying from Buyale and reselling in retail in Kampala. Therefore, she wishes to borrow 250,000 Ugandan shillings. This converts into USD150. Her budget is as below:

2 bags of beans, costing 100,000 shillings each. This will total 200,000 shillings;

transport costing 70,000 shillings;

and possible emergencies that would cost 30,000 shillings.

She has already saved 50,000 shillings. She expects a profit of 60,000 shillings every month from the 2 bags. She will therefore be grateful if she is given the loan.

loans.use: Buying Produce

loans.name: Adelet

texts.en:
A. Adelet is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in the small village of Varkhankend situated in the southern Azerbaijani region, Saatli. Adelet is married and has four children. He has seven years of experience in animal breeding. At first, he borrowed from his friends and purchased one calf. When it grew up to a milk cow, it brought him good income and he purchased another one.

Currently Adelet has four cows and two buffaloes. These animals bring him good income from selling dairy products such as milk, butter and yoghurt to the local and capital bazaar traders. Adelet and his wife do not work and keeping animals is the only source of revenue in their family. This income is just enough to cover family needs. But he still has no place to keep the cattle. Adelet decided to build himself a shed and for this purpose he saved some money and applied for 1200 USD to purchase building materials.

loans.use: Going to build a place for keeping cattle

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and married. He sells souvenirs in a marketplace. He started his business two years ago. He wants to increase the kind goods he sells. He has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan in the amount of $400 to do this.

loans.use: To expand souvenir selling business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: I am Rani B.. I am married with nine children, six girls and three boys. I live with my family in a small city called Arifwala, Pakistan. I do not work because my children are small and I have to take of them at home. My husband is the only breadwinner of the family and he operates a used clothes business. He is an honest and a hardworking entrepreneur. A year ago, he acquired a loan for his business which turned into better profits. Now he requires another loan of $350 to expand his business further and to help us give a better life to our children.

loans.use: Expand used clothes business

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en: My name is Nadia Z. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and have four children, two of whom are now old enough to go to school. My husband is a builder and needs money to buy a machine to polish tile floors. We are applying for this loan with two other members of my loan group. The first, Arshad A. B., needs a loan for her husband’s construction supply business, and the second, Arshad B., needs a loan for her husband's fruit business. All three of us work together and are committed to help each other pay off our loan and contribute to the success of our families.

loans.use: Buy various pieces of equipment for three family businesses

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a wife, a mother and an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling women’s clothing, jewelry, cosmetics and nail care products. She has a constant clientele of women buying her products and her business has grown significantly since it first opened 3 years ago.

She began the business with the help of some of her husband’s savings. The store has since grown into not just a clothing store for women, but also a small nail salon, and she now carries clothing for men and children as well.

Gladys has received many new orders and demand for men and children’s clothing. With the loan she will continue to invest in more clothing, perfume and cologne, along with products for her nail salon. By increasing the quantity, quality and variety of products she hopes it will bring new clientele.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, perfume and women’s clothing.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Bahrom M., 56, lives in Varzob district. He is married with 5 children and has a secondary school education. He works as a driver, but aside from that he also raises animals. He buys young, healthy calves at local markets, fattens them for 40-45 days, and then sells them back at the same markets. After selling these catlle, he then buys new ones, fattens them, and sells them again. Bahrom has been buying and selling cattle in this manner for about 30 years. This business brings additional income to his family, as well as supplying the local markets with fresh meat. He is applying for a loan to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Махмудов Бахром проживает в районе Варзоб. 56 лет. Женат ,имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Работает шофером. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Скупает на рынках молодых, здоровых бычков, откармливает около 40-45 дней, затем продает на тех же рынках. После продажи опять покупает бычков, откармливает и продает. Так по этой системе и работает клиент. опыт в данной сфере торговли бычками уже около 30 лет. Этот бизнес приносит дополнительный доход его семье, а так же помогает обеспечить рынки свежим мясом. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ab

texts.en:
Mrs. Ab S., age 27, is a mother of one small child and works selling souvenirs at the Bayon temple, earning around $5 in revenue a day. Her husband works making traditional musical instruments. Normally he earns about $7 a day in revenue. Their child is too young to attend school.
Mrs Ab S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase more souvenirs to sell at the Bayon temple. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Ab S. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs to sell at  the Bayon temple.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
As Adela´s family grew, she felt the need to have her own job as her husband´s income was insufficient to support the family.

She decided to rent a stall in the market near her home to begin selling clothes. The business only lasted four years as there was little demand for her products and a lot of competition. This downturn motivated her to think of another type of business. She closed her market stall, and opened a grocery store at home. Working at home made it easier for her as she was able to take care of her young children as well.

Adela currently has six children, more than enough reasons for her and her husband to coninue working harder and harder. Her plans are to finish constructing her store and to purchase more stock.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To complete the construction of her home and purchase more stock

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat is 57, married, and has three sons. Two sons are currently working in Russia, and their wives live with Sharofat. To keep her youngest son from being drafted into the army, she sent him and her husband to live in Kyrgystan.

Sharofat and her daughters-in-law have not had it easy. They have cows and used to sell milk and milk products, but now each daughter-in-law has small children who also need the milk. Raising and selling livestock is the only business in the town. Sharofat gradually sold the sheep she had, but it’s clear that selling them now means that later there will be nothing to live on. Her sons are little by little sending small amounts of money, always setting aside a certain amount to send to her son and husband in Kyrgystan to keep her son out of the army. Neighbors encouraged her to contact Microinvest and develop a livestock business. She and her daughters-in-law plan to use the remaining money to buy wool for knitting rugs to sell (they have prior experience with this). She plans to acquire more livestock, so that after 3 months she can sell at a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарофат 57 лет, она замужем имеет 3 сыновей. Сейчас двое сына находятся в России на заработке их жены живут с Шарофат. А младшего сына она с мужем отправила в Киргизистан, так как его могут забрать в армию.

Шарофат и ее невестам приходилось не легко, у них ест коровы , раньше они продавали молоко и молочные изделия, сейчас когда у каждой невестки есть маленькие дети, они тоже нуждаются в молоке. А откорм и продажа скота является единственным бизнесом в селе. Шарофат по немного продавала имеющиеся овец, но теперь она поняла, что если продаст, то дальше будет не на что жить. Сыновья по мало присылают не большую сумму, откладывая необходимую сумму денег отправляла в Киргизию сыну и мужу, что бы удержать сына от армии. Соседи посоветовали обратиться в Микроинвест, что бы развить бизнес скота, а на оставшийся деньги она и ее невесты планируют покупать шерсть, вязать ковры и продавать (они этим раньше занимались). Она планирует приобрести еще скот, что бы через 3 месяца продать подороже.

loans.use: Feeding and Selling Livestock

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora C. López operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Chimaltenando neighborhood market, which is about 18 km (11 miles) from where she lives.

She started her business 40 years ago: since she was a little girl she has sold fruits in the school where she studied. She has always enjoyed selling these products.

Teodora buys the fruits and vegetables in bulk and sells them in smaller quantities. She sells her fruits on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, which are the days of greatest sales in the market.

Teodora has had 12 children, some of whom no longer live with her. However, thanks to her business, Teodora has helped her children get ahead and provided for their education. She still supports some of her children and wants to help them get ahead, too.

Teodora’s husband also sells agricultural products during harvest times.

Teodora wants a loan to be able to sell more of the same products she sells now, in particular during harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Teodora C. López tiene su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, en el mercado del departamento de Chimaltenando, a 18 kilómetros de la localidad donde vive.

Este negocio lo inicio hace 40 años, desde muy niña se dedico a la venta de frutas en la escuela donde estudiaba, y siempre le gusto dedicarse a la venta de estos productos.

Ella compra las frutas y verduras por mayor, y las vende en unidades más pequeñas. Aprovecha a vender sus productos los días lunes, miércoles y viernes de cada semana, ya que son los días de principal venta en el mercado.

En total ha tenido 12 hijos, algunos ya no viven con ella, pero gracias a este negocio los ha sacado adelante y le ha dado la oportunidad de que tengan educación, todavía tiene hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, y los quiere sacar adelante.

Su esposo también se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas aprovechando las temporadas de cosecha.

Ella quiere el préstamo para vender más productos de los que actualmente vende, y aprovechar las épocas de temporada de cosechas.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and is married with five children. Among her children, three have completed their senior high school. Josephine is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard work brings increased livelihood to her family. Josephine supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing.

There is a very big market for used clothing in Ghana as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically poor. As such, there is a market for many women like Josephine who sell used clothing. Josephine wants a loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and would also allow her to rent a trading store. She is member of the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (It has shall come pass.) Members agree to guarantee loans for each other via social collateral and assist one another in repaying the loans.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing to increase inventory.

loans.name: Baye Ndiaye

texts.fr: mr baye ndiaye S. est un habitant du quarier keur serigne ablaye à thies né le 01/01/01971 .il est marié et père de deux enfants.il a un magasin près du marché de thiès et son activité consiste à faire des poses d'ongles artificiels pour les femmes .il fait ce métier depuis presque trois ans et y tire l'essentiel de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Baye Ndiaye S. is a resident of the Keur Serigne Ablaye neighborhood of Thiès. He was born on January 1, 1971. He is married and the father of two children. He has a store near the market in Thiès and his business consists of applying false nails to women. He has been doing this for almost three years and makes most of his income from it.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for applying false nails

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Mali Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng M., a group leader of four who all live in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province, is a cow breeder currently raising 20 cows. In order to improve her standard of living, she is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her household.

Seng is a 59-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a carpenter. The youngest is enrolled in the local school. Although Seng and her children have different livelihoods, they still live in an old house under poor conditions.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her household.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Teresa está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), tiene tres hijos: el mayor de 12 años estudia su quinto grado, la otra estudia tercer grado y  el niño menor de 4 añitos. Teresa con los créditos anteriores ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda,  además no solo se dedica a enseñar sino que tambien es una mujer que trabaja de la mano con su marido en la parcela cultivando diversos cultivos para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia;  cabe mencionar que ella es una mujer que inició dando clase de manera voluntaria en una comarca a 3 horas de camino montada a caballo y así fue como adquirio una plaza pagada por el estado, Teresa ha sido un ejemplo de mujer ya que ayudó a su comunidad llevando el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de su comarca
texts.en:
Teresa is requesting this loan in order to invest it in her home (construction of a room). She has three children: the oldest is 12 years old and is in the fifth grade, her daughter is in third grade, and the younger son is 4 years old. With her previous loans Teresa has been improving her home little by little. Besides being a teacher she is also a woman who works side by side with her husband on the property cultivating various crops so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. It deserves mentioning that she is a woman who began giving classes as a volunteer in a region three hours from her home by horseback and from there she was able to obtain a paid position (paid by the government). Teresa has been an example of a woman who has helped her community, bringing the gift of education to the rural children of her region.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Agé de 22 ans, D. Yao est un jeune homme très dévoué qui se bat beaucoup pour sa réussite. Ayant abandonné ses études faute de moyens financiers, il a embrassé le commerce d'outils champêtre notamment les houes, les dabas etc... qu’il exerce avec passion. Il sollicite ce crédit pour développer son activité et améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Yao D., age 22, is a very devoted young man who works hard towards success. Lacking financial means, he dropped out of school and started a business selling farming tools, most notably hoes. He's very passionate about this activity. He's seeking this loan to bolster his business and increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business of selling farming tools

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been in the farming business for 31 years.  It is through farming that he was able to provide the needs of his family and send his children to school even though they were not able to earn a college degree.  His wife Lilia is managing a sari-sari store (a community based store).  They have three children:  Janet – 29 years old, college undergraduate and currently working abroad as domestic helper; Jonel – 27 years old, a vocational course graduate and served as an army and Jonar – 22 years old, also a vocational course graduate and working as a security guard. They live in the hilly and peaceful place of San Vicente in Quirino, Isabela.  

He would like to request a loan of PHP10,000 which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like fertilizers since they are very expensive.  This amount is not enough to sustain the needs of his 1.5 hectare of rice field, 2 hectares of corn field and.5 hectare of tobacco.  He is very optimistic that this amount will somehow improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders.  

Nelson always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née le 18 Mars 1953, Mme Philomène S. est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle revendeuse de la farine de manioc « gari » et de tapioca. Cette femme dynamique mène cette activité depuis plus de treize (13) ans qui lui apporte suffisamment de revenus pour aider son mari à supporter les dépenses de leur famille. Aujourd’hui elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de faire face aux besoins de ses clients. Ce financement va doper son commerce et accroître ses recettes et bénéfices.
texts.en:
Born on 18 March 1953, Mrs. Philomène S. is married and has seven (07) children. She is a retailer of manioc flour (called 'gari') and tapioca. This dynamic woman has run her business for more than thirteen (13) years, and this business brings her enough income to help her husband in meeting the household expenses. Currently she is asking for a loan to supply herself with merchandise in order to meet the needs of her clients. This loan will boost her business and increase her revenue and profit.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell manioc flour and tapioca

loans.name: Mrs. Mean Cheas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of ten members is located in the Phnom Touch Village in the Kampong Cham Province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Mean C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Yin Yeap, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They face a problem with their plantation because their field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mean C. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crops more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the other, a monthly payment loan. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The system allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make the crops more productive

loans.name: Tawakal Kwa Mola Group

texts.en:
Maimuna has been a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maimuna is 23 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Munawar and Fatma. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ni Komang Wandi

texts.id:
Supaya dapat menambah penghasilan keluarga, Ni Komang Wandi mempunyai usaha beternak babi. Dia memelihara 1 ekor induk dan 3 ekor penggemukan. Dalam usahanya memelihara babi, Ni Komang Wandi bisa menghabiskan  ± 500.000,- dalam waktu 6 bulan untuk membeli pakan ternak babi. Namun dalam situasi ekonomi keluarganya yang masih minim, Ni Komang Wandi belum bisa memenuhi dana yang di butuhkan untuk ternak babinya tersebut. Karena suaminya I Nengah Winada hanya bekerja sebagai petani. Penghasilan suaminya hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya saja. Ni Komang Wandi mempunyai seorang anak laki – laki bernama I Gede Lingguarta. Ni Komang Wandi dan keluarganya tinggal di sebuah rumah sederhana yang tanahnya masih ikut menumpang dengah orang lain di Dusun Katulampa, Desa Manistutu.
Karena biaya sekolah sangat tinggi, Ni komang Wandi tidak dapat memenuhi biaya sekolah  anaknya. Sehingga kini anaknya putus sekolah. Ni Komang Wandi, sangat berharap anaknya bisa sekolah.
 Oleh karena itu Ni Komang Wandi sangat antusias untuk mengikuti program ternak babi yang ada di Dinari. Dimana program ini meminjamkan modal bagi peternak babi dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan dibayar diakhir periode. Dengan harapan setelah mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari, Ni Komang Wandi dapat membeli pakan untuk ternak babinya. Sehingga usaha ternak babinya dapat berkembang dan Ni Komang Wandi dapat menyekolahkan kembali anaknya.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Wandi owns a pig farm to supplement her family's income. She farms 1 breeder and 3 fattening pigs. Ni Komang Wandi can spend up to $40 every 6 months per pigs for feeds. However with her family's difficult economic situation, Ni Komang Wandi does not have sufficient funds to operate her pig farm to its full potential. Her husband, I Nengah Winada works as a farmer with barely sufficient income to pay for their family's expenses Ni komang Wandi has a son named I Gede Lingguarta. Ni Komang Wandi and her family owns a simple home, but it liens on someone else's land in Katulampa Village, Manistutu Regency. Ni Komang Wandi cannot pay for her son's schooling due to the high tuition cost. Therefore currently her son is not attending school anymore. Ni Komang Wandi really hopes she can send her son back to school. Therefore, Ni Komang Wandi is really enthusiastic to join DInari's pig farm program. This program provides 6 month loan and technical assistance. Ni Komang Wardi is hopeful with the loan she can purchase more feeds for the farm, so her pig farm can grow so she can afford tuition for her son again.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy feeds

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Kea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people living in Mkak village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Chantha K. is a 41 year old village bank president. She is a farmer wH. owns a 1 hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Thang Choeun, is a construction worker. Although they tR. to work hard they still earn less income than needed to support their family. They also do not have enough to build a lavatoR. to provide their family a clean life. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Chantha K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To build a lavatory to provide their family a clean life.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette dame a commencé depuis 2001 la vente de poissons fumés, ce commerce est très rentable pour elle. Le poisson fumé est utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer des sauces telles que l’adémé, la sauce gombo, la sauce tomate. Beaucoup de femmes viennent acheter chez elle, elle vend à crédit à ses plus fidèles clientes et récupère l’argent dans les 8 jours. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait se réapprovisionner alors elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 03 paniers de poissons fumés.
Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
In 2001, this lady started selling smoked fish, a business that is very profitable for her. Smoked fish is used in Togolese cuisine for making sauces with adémé (a leafy green vegetable), okra, or tomatoes. Many women come and buy from her. She sells on credit to her most loyal customers and collects the money in a week’s time. She’s coping with inventory shortages and would like resupply herself, so she’s asking WAGES for her first loan to buy three baskets of smoked fish.

She is married and the mother of seven. With what she earns from her business, she helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Abed El Karim

texts.en:
Abed El Karim is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abed El Karim has been selling clothing for a year and a half. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, to pay for some décor for his shop (because he just bought his shop) and to purchase clothing stands. This is the first time that Abed El Karim has requested a loan.

Abed El Karim is special in his work because he sells good quality clothes. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. Abed El Karim decided on doing his business because of his experience in selling clothes. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abed El Karim will use the loan to pay for some décor in his shop and to purchase clothing stands.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells clothes and sarongs. She is 34 years old and married with five children.

She is hoping to obtain a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lourdes Fany

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito. She is married, 39 years old and has two children.

Lourdes sells general groceries in different fairs in the region, and from the fairs she buys small animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Lourdes has a shop in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Lourdes needs a loan of 600 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and milk. Her dreams are to finish constructing her home and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Dembagnouma  (The Good Mother) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Darsalam 1 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité.
Elles exercent comme  activité principale: la vente  de condiments  et comme activité secondaire les légumes et les tubercules. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Dembagnouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  des condiments en gros au grand marché de Koutiala (oignon, tomate, sounbala, piment et épices) pour les revendre en   détail et au comptant au marché et à la maison. Quant aux légumes et tubercules (ignames, patates douces, maniocs etc.) elles sont périodique et s’achètent au fur et à mesure. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Dembagnouma are all married and average 35 years of age and five children, living in large traditional extended families in the Darsalam 1 district of Koutiala City (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and from practicing the same business: mainly selling condiments. Their secondary business involves vegetables and tubers. The women are in high demand in this business. In order to satisfy the ever-increasing customer needs, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members intend to use this loan to buy condiments wholesale (onions, tomatoes, sounbala, chili peppers, and spices) at the grand marketplace of Koutiala in order to resell them in retail cash transaction at the marketplace and at the house. As for the vegetables and tubers (yams, sweet potatoes, cassava, etc.), these are cyclical and are purchased over time. The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other revenue-generating work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, vegetables, and tubers

loans.name: Santa Cecilia 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa Cecilia II is a new communal bank with Kiva partner, ManueL. Ramos.  It was founded a year ago by member Victoria O. C., who named the bank after the patron saint of music.  She chose this name to honor her grandfather, who very much enjoyed music.  

Santa Cecilia II has 11 members who want to take out a loan during this cycle.  All are women who live in different parts of the city of Pucallpa.  The total amount of loans needed by Santa Cecilia is 5,700 soles.  Indivdual communal bank members are asking for loans ranging from 300 soles (about $100) to 1000 soles (about $333).  These loans will be paid back in four months.

The women of Santa Cecilia dedicate themselves to a variety of different businesses, including selling cooked food from their homes in the evenings, selling beauty products, sewing, making beaded sandals, and running small grocery shops.  The women will be using their loans to invest in necessary goods for their businesses.  

The women of Santa Cecilia II are pictured here with their loan officer, Iris Diana, in ManueL. Ramos's Pucallpa office.

loans.use: Food for restaurant businesses; various other products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sarann Yin Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann Y. is the village bank president of 16 people who all live in Tuol Trea village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to earn a living. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. With the rest of the loan, she will hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Chut Sarorn, is a construction worker and he also helps his wife in the rice field. Mrs. Sarann Y. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. All of them are presented in the picture but one is blocked by the members. 
Fourteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire M. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is a single mother of one infant. To make a living, Claire owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Claire has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claire is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Claire from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to autoM. the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Managing a store is the business of Arceli A.. She is thankful because she has been married to Magno who is a good husband. They manage a small farm lot in their rural villages of Osacriz Ramon, Isabela where they also peacefully live. According to her, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP4, 000 so that she could improve their way of living. The couple is blessed with four children namely Mark Vernie - 26 years old who just finished a vocational course, Gunoffria - 25 years old is a college graduate; Jomar - 22 years old, high school graduate and Jean - 19 years old is already a college freshman. Arceli would be glad if her request loan will be approved to further sustain their family needs in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov C., 36, is married with three school-aged children and resides in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of manufacturing soy milk in her village, earning an income of US $8 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. Her husband operates his motor-taxi at the market, earning US $4 per day. To make a better standard of living, C. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a new motorbike to improve her husband’s business and to attach the expected motorbike with a water container to transport water in order to sell it in the village.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok A., 47, is married with seven children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale, earning A. income of $8 per day in revenue. Her husband is also involved in the agriculture sector, growing rice and fruit trees and earning A. income of $4 per day. This couple is asking for a loA. of $800 to purchase feed so that the pigs grow efficiently. Sok A. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plA. of investment in her pigs is successful.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle hopes to improve her business in order to provide the needs of her children in terms of education. She is engaged in the retailing business, selling fish, vegetables and meat. She wanted to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to 6,000 Pjilippine pesos. She is also hoping that her loan request will be granted.  

She is from the village of Matusalem, San Manuel, Isabela. She is 44 years old and has four children. Anabelle is married to Roberto, 47.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is married to Elly who is tricycle operator. They are blessed with four loving children namely: Mark Alvin - 18 years old, a college student; Mark Jim Narel - 13 years old, a high school student; Angelica Mae - 11 years old, an elementary pupil; and Glydee Hann - 3 years old. Elizabeth’s family lives happily in the village of Quezon, San Isidro.

Elizabeth manages a general store and at the same time she is vending vegetables and fruits in their village. She is thankful because she is able to improve her store.

Elizabeth would like to buy more vegetables, fruit and merchandise for her store so that she is able to generate more income for the educational needs of their children. In this regard, she would like to obtain a loan as additional capital for improving her business. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000. She would be very thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto C. is 39 years old and has been married to Marina Acevedo for more than 16 years. They have three children, the eldest of whom is 21 and in college; they also have a 12-year-old in middle school, and a 6-year-old in primary school.

Luis started his business 15 years ago, working as a peddlar selling traditionally-woven bedspreads and hammocks. He marketed his products at low prices and built up a loyal clientele with his high quality.

With the profits, Luis has bought two motorcycles to transport his products and sell them across the city. Luis will use his loan to purchase more goods, such as bedspreads and linens to sell at a higher profit.

loans.use: more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing O. is 27 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports the home. Blessing sells groceries and drinks to make a living. She has been in this business for five years. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. 

Blessing's challenge in her business is inadequate funds. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more groceries to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

Blessing is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
49-year-old Nena has been married to her husband, Felix, for twenty-seven years. They are blessed with four children. The oldest among their children is twenty-four years old. Nena is involved in rice farming. The farm was inherited from her parents. She works hard to maintain it and keep it productive so she can earn more. She said that her farm is now being prepared for the next planting.

She joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to gain access to its financial services. She applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP. This loan will help increase Nena’s working capital. She will now be able to fund her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is currently in the business of selling charcaol from home, and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.  Esther is 40 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has seven children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house she can rent out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel Sánchez desde hace 9 años tiene una venta de ropa usada en un lugar muy concurrido por la gente. Ella vende ropa, zapatos y artículos para el hogar a buen precio. Ella es una mujer sola que saco a sus hijos adelante y ya son hombres adultos que tienen su propia familia. La señora Maribel trabaja de esta manera para obtener ingresos, pero como ella quiere prepararse para el cambio de temporada de calor quiere comprar mercancía nueva para no estas desprevenida y tener todo para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. Ella recurre a esta institución pidiendo el apoyo para poder surtir su negocio de ropa para así obtener mas ingresos y ganancias.
texts.en:
Maribel Sánchez has sold used clothing for the past 9 years in a very busy location. She sells clothes, shoes and household articles at fair prices. She is a woman who has raised her children by herself; they are all grown men now with their own families. Maribel works this way in order to produce earnings. She now wants to be prepared for the change of seasons; she wants to buy clothes appropriate for the warmer weather so that she will have in stock everything her customers may want. She calls upon this institution asking for help to stock her clothing sales business in order to have higher income and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: On

texts.en: Mrs. On T. is a villager from Pouthi Reamea village in Kandal province. She is 32 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in the local public school. She and her husband, Mr. Kreng Kea (pictured right), are fruit sellers. However hard they work in their business, they still do not earn sufficient income because they have little capital to support the business. Therefore, in order to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. On T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes for resale

loans.name: Klara Group

texts.en:
The group name is 'Klara'; it is made up of three ladies who are living in the region of the Aley, Mount Lebanon. 

-Ihssan is a 40-year-old married woman who has five children. Ihssan has been producing handicrafts for twenty years. She also does embroidery. This is the first time that Ihssan has requested a loan. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies such as thread and some accessories. 

Ihssan is special in her work because of her experience and of her good taste in her work. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties except making herself known by the public and offering original products. She decided on doing her business because she has good networking, thanks to her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her work. 

-Yassmien is a 26-year-old single woman. Yassmien has been working as a seamstress for fifteen years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials like thread and accessories for her work. This is the first time that Yassmien has requested a loan. 
 
She is special in her work because she likes it and does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Yassmien decided on doing her work because of her need to provide for herself. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Rwaydah is a 25-year-old married woman who has one child. Rwaydah has been selling scarves from her home for five years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new scarves like pashminas and thinner scarves for the spring season. This is the first time that Rwaydah has requested a loan. 

Rwaydah is special in her work because of her good quality of products. Her customers can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rwaydah decided on doing her work to raise her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase goods needed for their businesses

loans.name: Verioska

texts.es:
Verioska, es soltera, tiene 22 años, ella es una joven estudiosa,  responsable y trabajadora pues estudio enfermería en la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco y esta por graduarse, ella para solventar sus estudios tiene que trabajar como profesora en el colegio “Abraham Lincoln”, ella enseña el curso de ciencias biología. Verioska usará el crédito para apoyar a su mamá con el negocio de venta de comida y también para pagar los trámites documentarios para obtener su titulo profesional. El sueño de Verioska es graduarse y cuando trabaje desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes para su mamá.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Verioska is 22 and single. She is a studious, responsible, and hard-working young woman. She studied nursing at Andina University, a private university in Cusco. She is going to graduate. In order to complete her studies, she has to work as a teacher in the Abraham Lincoln School. She teaches a course in biological science. Verioska will use the loan to help her mother in her business of selling food. She will also pay to process the documents to get her professional title. Verioska’s dream is to graduate, and when she works she wishes to open a grocery store for her mother. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help her mother with her business of selling food and pay for processing the documents to get her professional title

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay II.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Olga viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados. 
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Olga sueña con comprar una casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay II”. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Olga travels to different fairs in the region to sell fruit. While at the fairs, she buys grain to sell at the markets.

Olga needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of grain. She dreams of buying a house and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Saponyo Ole

texts.en: Saponyo started planting wheat in 2004 and the venture so far has been profitable. He is 60 years old and he and his wife, Margaret, have three children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash from the loan to buy fertiliser and hire a tractor to prepare his farm for wheat planting. Saponyo plans to start training area residents about farming and its benefits based on his own personal experience.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and hire a tractor to prepare his farm for wheat planting.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: A. Salamatou est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GOUNDJE Georges, Salamatou est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Yénawa, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs douze ans que Salamatou vit dans ce quartier. Salamatou  vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges du foyer, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Salamatou  n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis huit ans environs, Salamatou vend des chaussures au marché de Yénawa à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Salamatou  vend également des sous-vêtements. Salamatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Salamatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts, qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Salamatou désire rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
A. Salamatou was born in 1976 in  Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to GOUNDJE Georges, she is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  The family lives in Yénawa, a district of Cotonou. Salamatou has been living in this district for about a dozen years.  She helps out her husband and, with him, ensures that the different household expenses are covered, thanks to the revenues her business brings in.  Salamatou never attended school.  For eight years, she has sold shoes at the Yénawa market in Cotonou.  Along with this work, she also sells undergarments.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo.  She is a previous ALIDé client having already had four loans, which she has repaid.  She would like to raise her business level to cope with the demands of her customers and to make more income.  This is what brings her to request a fifth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes to sell

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mr. Sophat B., 38, lives in Banteay village in Takeo province. Apart from farming, which is his main activity, Sophat also owns a small electronics shop where he sells VCDs, DVDs, VCD players, televisions etc. The secondary business earns Sophat a small revenue to support his family. For his electronics shop, Mr. Sophat B. is requesting a loan to purchase more televisions, DVDs, VCDs and VCD players to expand his business activities. With this loan, he hopes to increase his income and improve the lifestyle of his family. His wife, Mrs. Mom May, is a green grass seller. The couple has three children who are students in the local school and also support their parents' businesses. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To purchase more TVs, DVDs, VCDs and VCD players

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira C. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Elmira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elmira owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport like "habal-habal" services. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elmira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Elmira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her farming land

loans.name: Olivia Margot

texts.es:
Olivia Margot C. R. tiene 33 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 niños de 12, 9, 7, y 6 años.

Olivia es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Olivia se dedica a la agricultura y a la sembra de maíz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao y en San Jose de Tambo para cacao cada 15 dias y 2 cosechas para maíz.  

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y tener el agua, semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes. El crédito le permitirá comprar todo al mismo tiempo para sembrar el maíz. Su sueño es poder estudiar y tener buena profesión. Ha tenido problemas con los animales en el maíz, eso presenta un desafío a su negocio. 

Le gusta jugar pelota y aprender.
texts.en:
Olivia Margot C. R. is 33. She is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 4 children ages 12, 9, 7 and 6. Olivia is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Olivia is a farmer who grows corn, rice and cocoa. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao and in San Jose de Tambo, every 15 days for cocoa and every 2 harvests for corn. She is requesting this loan to sow corn and have the water, seeds, manure and fertilizer. The loan will allow her to buy all of this at the same time to sow the corn. Her dream is to be able to study and have a good profession. She has had problems with the animals and the corn which have presented challenges to her business. She enjoys playing ball and learning.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of manure to sow corn

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is a married woman aged 33 years with two children, who are 6 and 9 years old.  Both of her children go to school. Patricie’s husband is a driver.

Patricie owns a shop that deals in selling a variety of items, such as sugar, matches, salt, etc. Patricie has been in this business profession for seven years now. 

She intends to use this loan to increase her initial capital by buying more household items for her store. She intends to use the profits to construct a commercial premise and become a wholesaler. This will put her in position to sell large quantities of goods to her customers.

loans.use: Buying household items for her store

loans.name: Gbemako François

texts.fr: H. Gbemako François est née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. François est marié à LOKOSSOU et est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. François habite le quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou avec sa famille, depuis trois ans. François assure les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. François a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, François mène comme activité la vente de liqueurs et des produits de SOBEBRA, de même que des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans sa boutique à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. François s’approvisionne aussi à Dantokpa. François exerce cette activité depuis une douzaine d’année. En vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, François sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. François a bien remboursé son premier prêt.
texts.en:
Gbemako François H. was born in 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. François is married to Lokossou, and is the father of three children, all of whom attend school. François has lived in the district of Ayélawadjè in Cotonou with his family for three years. François is able to meet family responsibilities with the money he makes from his work. He stopped attending school at the high school level. To meet his needs, François is in the business of selling alcoholic beverages and Sobebra products, as well as rechargeable telephone cards in his shop in Dantokpa, at the international market of Bénin. He also gets his supplies in Dantokpa. François has been doing this type of work for about 12 years. In order to build up his business and to increase his clientele, François is requesting a second loan through ALIDé. François has fully repaid his first loan.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic beverages, SOBEBRA products. and rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. is married to a driver and has five dependents. She has no educational background.

Maame sells provisions and soft drinks at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the general welfare of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Georgina Aurea

texts.es:
Georgina es casada y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores, Georgina se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria con la ayuda de un triciclo. Además Georgina hace canchas de arroz que luego embolsa  y vende en las diferentes tiendas.
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas y solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de bolsas y golosinas.
Georgina sueña con tener su capital propio para ya no solicitar prestamos.
texts.en:
Georgina is married and has six grown children.

Georgina sells sweets and drinks at the door to a school.  She does this everyday in an itinerant manner with the help of a tricycle.  Also, Georgina makes toasted corn.  She then puts the corn in bags and sells it to different stores.

Georgina is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas Communal Bank.  She is requesting a loan for 1,050 soles to buy bags and sweets.

Georgina dreams of having her own capital so that she does not need to request loans.

loans.use: To buy bags and sweets

loans.name: Boanerge Campo

texts.es:
Boanerge de 45 años, elabora panes en su casa para venderlos en un triciclo en las calles del suburbio. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Aprendió a ser panes desde muy pequeño, cuando se caso necesitaba tener ingresos para su familia el comenzó su negocio de venta de pan hace 10 años. Desde ese tiempo ha venido trabajando haciendo panes y vendiéndolos en su casa y recorriendo las calles del suburbio, trabaja desde las 06h00am en su casa y en la tarde desde las 14h00pm recorre las calles del suburbio vendiendo panes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla para hacer mas panes y tener así mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y comprar un horno para tener mas capacidad de elaborar panes.
texts.en:
Boanerge is 45 years old and makes bread in his home to sell from his tricycle in the streets of the suburb. He lives in an urban zone called a suburb and it is known for having most of its residents work independently in sales.

He learned to make bread when he was very young. When he got married he needed a source of income for his family and he began his business selling bread 10 years ago. Since then he has worked making bread at home and then selling it in the streets. He starts working at 6:00 am at home and then sells bread on the streets in the afternoon starting at 2:00 pm.

He wants to use the loan to buy flour and butter to make more bread and have a higher income. In the future he wants to expand his business and buy an oven to be able to make more bread.

loans.use: Flour, butter

loans.name: Miguel Orlando

texts.es:
Miguel Orlando G. Y. tiene 29 años. Vive en unión libre vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Miguel pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.
Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es comprar  terrenos y dar trabajo.

Le gusta hacer deporte y celebrar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Miguel Orlando G. Y. is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. He has four children.

Miguel is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Miguel is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. He purchases his supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in his community. Segundo is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of his family. His dreams include buying land and providing work for others.

Miguel enjoys playing sports and celebrating the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil  casada y tiene 04 hijos, la señora  llegó a estudiar educación primaria incompleto.
