Celestina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de artesanías.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar lanas para tejer medias, escarpines y chompas.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad de préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Communal Bank.  It is in the Azaángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  Celestina is 53 years old, married, and has four children.  She did not complete elementary school.

Celestina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She used the money to increase the capital in her business of selling handicrafts.

She is now requesting a new loan for 2,000 soles.  She will use the money to buy wool in order to weave tights, socks, and sweaters.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to have her children go to school.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of the loan, the punctuality, and the responsibility.

loans.use: To buy wool to weave tights, socks, and sweaters

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nueva Renacer Group

texts.es:
Miguelina es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres del Nuevo renacer 2, localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economía depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del República Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azúcar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Su negocio es la venta de productos y medicina naturales, y otros articulos miscelaneos de limpieza y uso personal. Miguelina es casada, y su familia esta compuesta por ella y su esposo, y un 1 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es salir adelante, con la ayuda de Dios y estos prestamos podra lograrlo. Disfruta mucho asistir a la iglesia y alabar al Señor.

Miguelina está muy emocionada de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber recibido la invitación de algunas vecinas para formar parte de un prestamo que la iba a ayudar a mejorar su negocio. Está planificando invertir este préstamo en la compra varios productos y medicinas para la salud, pero naturales. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Su sueño es tener una farmacia de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Miguelina is one of the members of the “Mujeres del Nuevo Renacer 2” (Women of the New Rebirth 2) communal bank located in the city of Puerto Plata whose economy is based on rum, tourism and real estate.  It was the Dominican Republic’s first tourist destination and one of the cities with the highest sugar production.  Like many other places it has shortages of drinking water and electricity and its population is a combination of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants.

Her business is the sale of natural products and medicines as well as other miscellaneous cleaning and personal use products.  Miguelina is married and her family includes her husband and a son.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to succeed but, with help from God and these loans, she will be able to do so.  She very much enjoys attending church and praising the Lord.

Miguelina is very excited to be getting her third loan from Esperanza Internacional after having been invited by several neighbors to be part of a loan that would help improve her business.  She is planning to use the fund to buy several health products and medicines, but all natural ones.  She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help meet household expenses.  Her dream is to own a natural products pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim C. is a rural villager of 24 years old, who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Here, she makes a living raising pigs in a pig stall located near her house on her land. She raises pigs in order to raise their offspring and for selling. Since the beginning of 2008 until the present, she has raised pigs. Her husband is a fisherman in their community. 

Presently, Lim C. faces difficulties with her traveling needs because her existing motorcycle is broken down. Therefore, she would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to repair her broken motorbike and purchase fishing gear for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To repair her broken motorbike and purchase fishing gear for  her husband

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg T. is 37 years old.  She lives with her husband and three daughters in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest two daughters are in kindergarten.  Her husband operates a coal trading business in town.  

Oyunchimeg currently operates a food cafe called "Hatan Buuz"  (meaning "Queen Dumpling").  She started in business in 2000 by operating a second-hand shoes trading business in a rented stall at the local market. In 2007, she moved to Darhan city where she opened a cafe in a rented space. In 2008, she moved back to her current city and purchased the premise where now runs her cafe. 

In the future, she hopes to expand by adding more branches to her cafe business. She is a hardworking and modest. For the future, she is planning to open a big restaurant. She is requesting a loan for  1,500,000 MNT to improve the tools and equipment for her cafe, and to purchase more coal and firewood to sell.

loans.use: To improve tools and equipment for cafe

loans.name: Las Orquideas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS ORQUIDEAS DE SAN BARTOLO
Doña Maria como la llaman sus clientes es una socia que se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de frutas y flores  ella nos comenta que tiene su propio vivero en su casa y que ella sabe en qué tiempo le da cosecha cada una de sus flores, actualmente se dedica a la venta de orquídeas,  que es un proyecto que llego a su comunidad y que eso la ha ayudado mucho para dar a conocer más su producto y lo que más le alegra es que es un producto que es mejor pagado,  también nos comenta que le gusta mucho el negocio porque eso la ha ayudado  a sacar adelante a sus hijos y que lo que ella mas anhela es que sus hijos logren cerrar sus carreras con ayuda de su esposo,Solicita el credito para compra de flores,  doña Estela Hernández también se dedica a la venta de frutas de su comunidad, donde con ayuda de su hija mayor atienden a sus clientes  ella nos comenta que gracias a la ayuda de Fape a logrado surtir mas su negocio y su anhelo es también seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos Solicita el credito para la compra de frutas
texts.en:
“Duo Las Orquideas de San Bartolo” (The Orchid Duo from San Bartolo)

Maria, as her customers call her, is a member who has devoted herself to the business of fruits and flowers for several years.  She tells us that she has her own nursery at her house.  She knows when to gather each one of her flowers.  She currently sells orchids.  This is a project that came to her community, and it has helped her a great deal to better know her product.  What pleases her the most is that it is a product that pays better.  

She also tells us that she likes her business a lot because it has helped her get her children ahead.  Her greatest desire is, with help from her husband, to ensure that her children have careers.  She is requesting the loan to buy flowers. 

Estela Hernández also sells fruit in her community.  Her oldest daughter helps her wait on her customers.  She tells us that, thanks to help from Fape, she has managed to stock her business more.  Her wish is also to continue giving her children an education.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruit.

loans.use: To buy flowers and fruit to sell

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito D. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. He is 45 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Joselito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food, biscuits & toothpaste in the local community. He also sells electronic loads of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. Joselito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joselito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joselito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Joselito is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Joselito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, charcoal, etc. at wholesale to add to current inventory

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Annie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver to local community members. Anne is buying and selling used colthing and has been engaged in this business for over 1 year. She earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Annie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle service

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Chinchero, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Asunta; La socia tiene 63 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos (todos independientes), la socia tiene un kiosko dentro del colegio, la socia venD. en su stand todo tipo D. golosinas, también venD. gaseosas, mates, cafés, leche, jugos, sándwich, hamburguesas, la socia prepara para el segundo recreo segundos caseros, como ají D. gallina, papa rellena, lomo saltado, salchipapas, pollo frito con arroz y ensalada, los segundos le compran los profesores del colegio y también ella tiene un pequeño estante en el cual exhibe cuadernos, lapiceros, y otros útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para implementar el kiosko escolar ahora que comienza la época del colegio.  

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Asunta is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Victoria – Chinchero” which is located in the District of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 63 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are independent. Asunta has a kiosk next to a school where she sells all types of candy, but also sodas, tea, coffee, milk, juice, sandwiches, and hamburgers. For the second lunch period, she prepares food for another set of customers such as chicken with chili peppers, stuffed potatoes, salted steak, sausages and fried potatoes, fried chicken with rice, and salads. The customers who buy these meals are school teachers. Asunta also has a small cabinet from which she displays notebooks, pens, and other school supplies. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her kiosk since the school year has started.

Asunta is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and merchandise for her food kiosk.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a forty-five-year-old married woman living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is the mother of eight children and her desire is to educate them. She has been farming for ten years and the proceeds have enabled her to provide the basics for the family. She has a challenge of limited funds and her desire is to become a commercial farmer. Mariam intends to use the loan to grow maize.

loans.use: to grow maize.

loans.name: Margaret Wangui

texts.en:
Margaret Wangui K. is married to Peter, and together they have three children. Margaret operates a hotel and a general store from which she earns an income of 18,000 KES per month. The businesses have been in operation for nine years. Margaret describes herself as hardworking and focused.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients. Currently she is servicing her ninth loan after successfully paying off her previous loans. She plans to use this loan amount to purchase more stocks of sugar and flour, and tables and seats for her hotel.

Margaret intends to use her anticipated profits to educate her children and save. She plans to grow and expand her businesses so as to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sugar and flour, and tables and seats for her hotel

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Congo Town. She has three children between the ages of 2-11, two of whom attend school. Ruth runs a beauty salon where she styles hair in her community. Ruth says it’s fun working in this business since there are more young women in her area and she raises a lot of money. Ruth is requesting a loan to buy more wigs, shampoo, conditioner, etc. to grow her business. In the future she hopes to have an international salon and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more wigs, shampoo, conditioner, etc. for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase carpet thread to be able to weave modern Afghani carpets.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La señora María Dolores es madre de tres pequeños, su esposo no se encuentra en la ciudad y de ella depende la familia. Desde hace unos 4 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social que necesita realizar algunas reparaciones en las paredes como lo es pintar y también quiere hacerle algunos cambios para que se vea presentable y con una mejor vista. Trabaja en maquiladora para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Dolores is the mother of three young children.  Her husband is not in town and the family depends on her.  Four years ago, she received a house through a government subsidy program and now she needs to make some repairs to the walls such as painting.  She would also like to make some changes so that her home looks better and more presentable.  María Dolores works in a cross-border assembly plant so that she can cover her household expenses and offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to paint and remodel her home

loans.name: Elijah Wanyoike

texts.en:
Elija Wanyoike is 25 years old and married to Judy, who owns a salon and contributes to the family income. He has been a dairy farmer for a period of about three years, with an income of approximately KES 12,000 per month.

This is his third loan with  KADET LTD, after paying the previous one successfully. He wants to use the loan to buy farm necessities and to expand the salon for his wife. 

He hopes to own a big farm which will support the family income and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to expand the salon for his wife

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is married and has two children. His family lives in Bilasuvar, an Internally Displaced Settlement. 

Mubariz has a grocery store and sells food items. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and quality customer service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. Mubariz works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. 

He started with working capital of 200 USD which he borrowed from AqroInvest CU, and another two loans also helped to reach goals and bring him to his current success. Mubariz  is requesting a loan of 1300 AZN to reconstruct and modernize his grocery store to increase turnover and purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale. Mubariz is planning to use the generated profit to remodel his old house. 

Mubariz is a conscientious and focused manager of his resources and always plans his time and finances. In all his business dealings, he is guided by a sense of trust and goodwill towards others, especially toward AqroInvet CU. We believe these qualities will help him repay his loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Dalinq

texts.en:
Dalinq, 23 years old, is married and has one child who is two years old. Every month she has to spend $80 on food.

Dalinq is a garment factory worker, and her husband is a construction worker. Together their income is $5.60 per day.

Dalinq would like to request a loan of $200 from Credit MFI to buy construction materials to repair her house. Because her house is not in good condition, she needs zinc to repair the walls.

In the future she hopes her husband will become a construction chief and make more money than he is now.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Fomu

texts.en:
Fomu is a widowed woman with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a café business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation because of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es casada tiene hijos por quien luchar, vende los días domingos, jueves y martes ella alquila el local donde tiene sus ventas; para poder vender su mercaderia, vende aguas gaseosas   y en los días que no abre su negocio se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas por mayor (pepsi,  mirinda, sprite, etc,) y unos cerdos,  frijol por quintal y su sueño es agrandar su negocio  o colocar otro.
texts.en:
Juana is married and strives to support her children.  She sells in front of the Number 2 Market, called Master Club, on Sundays, Thursdays, and Tuesdays.  Juana rents the location where she makes her sales.  She sells water and sodas at her business or from a warehouse called “Edwin”.  On the days when her business is not open, Juana devotes her time to raising pigs.  

She is requesting a loan to buy sodas in bulk (Pepsi, Mirinda, Sprite, and other brands), a few pigs, and beans by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg).  Her dream is to either expand her business or establish another one.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beans, and a few pigs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking and hopeful 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. For the last eight months, he has been selling omena (small dried fish) so as to make ends meet. He makes extra shillings by selling firewood and cereals. Previously, he was employed. He wants, in the next five years, to have expanded his business and employ other people. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator to store omena (small dried fish).

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been operating her general shop for the last 10 years in Oloitoktok town. She is 51 years old and married to Francis. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

In future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business and be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Na'eema

texts.en:
Na'eema is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She lives in Rafah city in Gaza located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a modest salary. 

Na'eema has her own project, that is, sewing clothes. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine instead of the old one to improve the quality of clothes she tailors and so increase the family income. The amount of money Na'eema has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.

When Na'eema gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase a new sewing machine and be able to improve the quality of clothes she tailors. That will increase her income and lead to improving her family's life. Na'eema is photographed working at her project, next to the sewing machine she wants to replace with a new one.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to improve the quality of clothes she tailors.

loans.name: Yaneth Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONA”; Situado a 10 minutos del mismo poblado de Urubamba, perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet; tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, La socia se dedica  a la  crianza de animales menores, para  la venta la socia cría gallinas y pollos, ella en especial cría pollos al por mayor, la socia los lleva  a vender los sábados y domingos en el mercado en Urubamba, la socia tiene 200 pollos los cuales ya tiene un comprador y ella requiere el crédito para comprar comida, la socia también les comprar vitaminas, una ves que ella entregue le pagaran en dos partes, por lo cual ella requiere el préstamo y también para comprar 200 pollos mas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento y vitaminas para los pollos y comprar 200 pollos.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera disciplinada el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yanet, 23, is a member of the “Las Flores de Yanacona” communal bank located ten minutes from the town of Urubamba belonging to Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children who are 6 and 3 years of age.  She raises small farm animals to sell.  She raises chickens and chicks.  She specializes in raising chickens at wholesale.  She takes them to sell at the Urubamba market on Saturdays and Sundays.  She has 200 chicks that she already has a buyer for and she needs the loan to buy feed; she also wants to buy vitamins.  Once she delivers them, she’ll be paid in two parts so she needs the loan to also buy 200 more chicks.  She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of feed and vitamins for the chicks and to buy 200 chicks.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted and commits to continue to make her monthly installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the chickens and to buy 200 chicks.

loans.name: Benetha

texts.en:
Benetha is 32 years old, lives in the airport community, and is married to a businessman. They have five children between 1 and 15 years old. 

For the past six years she has been selling plastic dishes. She has many customers and makes a lot of profit since she has a very good location for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic dishes for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and three children. He is an experienced construction worker, working for almost 23 years. He is especially talented at completing woodwork. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his business. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 27-year -old married woman with three children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been milling cassava for five years. She started with capital of 500,000 UGX from the sale of cotton and now has 3,000,000 UGX. 

Her hardships are debtors and bad weather conditions. Her vision is to have capital of 10,000,000 UGX plus to educate her children.

Rachael needs the loan to buy cassava to resell.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Marietta owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for five years. 

Each month she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials. 

Marietta has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Marietta wants to build a house and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Irma sigue dedicándose a la venta de carne. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Irma paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho. 

Irma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Irma continues to participate in the "Ricchary Runa" communal bank, of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco. Currently, Irma continues to sell meat. She has worked in this business for several years now, and it's going very well. 

Irma pays her instalments on time, and had no problem with the previous loan; on the contrary, it went very well.  Irma needs the loan to buy pork. Irma is thankful for the opportunity she has been provided in this way, and is committed to paying her scheduled instalments on time.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 38 años convive con Auron de 37 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Victoria, es una mujer a quien le gusta trabajar arduamente, ella  junto a su pareja se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillo, quienes desde muy temprano se levantan para poder empezar con su trabajo de labrar tierra y producir ladrillo. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que lo hacen con mucho esfuerzo y alegría, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera difícil estar de pie labrando y horneando los ladrillos. Con el tiempo desean comprar tierras para poder hacer más ladrillos y así vender y entregar conforme a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.  Este será su préstamo número 12 con MFP y se siente contenta ya que puede concretar con su trabajo, por otro lado esta dispuesta a seguir pagando puntualmente con sus cuotas. En su banco comunal se siente tranquila de trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más tierras para poder realizar sus ladrillos ya que es la manera de sustentar a su familia.
texts.en: Victoria, 38, lives with Auron, 37. They live in their own house along with their four children to whom they wish to provide a better quality of life. Victoria is a woman who likes to work hard. She, along with her partner, are dedicated to making bricks. They get  up very early in order to be able to begin their work tilling land and making bricks. What she likes most about her work is that they do it with a lot of effort and happiness. She has ten years experience with this activity and she considers it difficult to be standing working and baking the bricks. With time, they wish to buy land to be able to make more bricks and sell and deliver the orders that their customers make. This will be the 12th loan with MFP and she feels happy since she can arrange her work. On the other hand she is willing to continue paying her payments on time. In her community bank, she feels at ease to work with responsible people. With the 1,000 soles, she will buy more land to be able to make her bricks since it is the way she supports her family.

loans.use: to purchase more land especially for making bricks.

loans.name: Manini B Group

texts.en:
Alfayo is the facilitator of the Manini B group. Alfayo and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alfayo takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alfayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfayo was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Alfayo will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Manini B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alfayo with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Awaggwa Eku Kirinya Development Group

texts.en:
"Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand." ~George Eliot (Silas Marner)

Well, this statement sums up the expectations 35-year-old Harriet has for the future expansion of her tailoring business.
The only secret to success based on this mother-of-one's estimation is unwavering diligence and a sense of purpose. She says all bets are off on the growth and expansion of her business.
Thus far, her business enjoys sales returns to the tune of UGX 160,000 monthly.
She says this Kiva loan will help her with the purchase of more textiles for clothes making.

loans.use: to purchase more textiles for clothes making

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto es casado, tiene tres hijos pequeños, que aun van a la escuela, ellos viven en la ciudad de Caacupé.
Alberto comenta que tiene una hamburguesería en su domicilio, cuenta con muy buena clientela, ya que el es una persona muy amable con los clientes, y es por ello que le va muy bien. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia todo lo mejor, pues no quiere que ellos tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que el tuvo que atravesar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, huevos, panificados, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios para hacer las hamburguesas que vende. El está muy contento por la oportunidad que le dan la fundación y kiva, por que este apoyo es muy importante para el.
texts.en:
Sr. Alberto is married and has three young children who are in school. They live in the city of Caacupé.

Alberto says that he has a hamburger stand set up in his home and has many good customers. He is a very friendly person when it comes to serving his customers. For this reason, he has done very well. He says that all of his efforts are geared toward providing the best for his family since he does not want them to experience the same hardships that he had to endure.

Alberto is requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, bread, vegetables, and other necessary supplies for making the hamburgers that he sells. He is very pleased with the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have given him. This support is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, bread, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Santos Azucena

texts.es:
La sra. Santos Azucena tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el barrio el porvenir de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, cuando termina la produccion reparte sus tortillas en zonas cercanas a su casa de habitacion, tambien tiene pedidos por encargo.
Santos Azucena es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad.
Santos Azucena tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.  
El credito lo invertira en compra de maiz, cal, agua y leña.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
su meta es graduar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Azucena, age 40, lives in the Porvenir neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells corn tortillas.  She has been doing this type of work for several years.  She gets up at four in the morning every day in order to start her production.  When she finishes her production she delivers her tortillas in the zones that are close to her house.  She also has orders to fill.

Santos Azucena has three children.  They go to school at their community educational center.

Santos Azucena also raises chickens and pigs.

She will use the loan to buy corn, lime powder, water, and firewood.  She needs the income to get her family ahead.

Her goal is for her children to graduate.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, water, and firewood.

loans.name: Polland

texts.en:
Polland is a 48-year-old married man. He has four children, ranging in age from 12 to 25 years old. He describes himself as tolerant. 

Polland operates a bicycle business, with which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the varying fares charged to customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase two bicycles. His business goal is to own a van to provide transportation within five years.

loans.use: To buy two bicycles.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is 63 years old. She has four children whom are all adult. She raises pigs and poultry. She has done this job for 21 years and gained from it 4,000,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her farm of pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her farm of pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
After successfully paying back her first loan on time, Carmen R. would like to step up to the next level and apply for a second loan. The story of this widowed mother is a testament to the power of microcredit, and Mifex thanks her for her continued efforts. Not only has she built economic value for her family but Carmen has given a sense of pride and motivation to them as well. As the head of the household, Ms. R. constantly works to feed her children and continue running the business. With the increased profits she realized from her first loan, she was able to buy a rotisserie oven for chicken, allowing her to manage the time better. In the morning Carmen purchases and prepares the food, and in the afternoon she can focus on selling it in her newly refurbished market and even doing deliveries. Carmen also makes tasty food called “chifles,” which are fried plantains. She makes these especially for the high school and college students who love to eat at her restaurant/market.

Carmen has been able hire a few hired hands to sell her products, helping to distribute the “chifles” to people around the busy market areas. Ms. R. lives in a marginalized sector of Guayaquil, Ecuador with her three children. Her goal over the past six months has been to attract new clients to her store, and Mifex has seen firsthand the change even in that period of time. With more than 13 years experience in this particular line of business, Carmen is a veteran, and her continued involvement in the Kiva microcredit program has brought more growth than ever before. She hopes continued access to credit will help to pay for food, clothing, medicine, and education for her family. Her second loan will go toward buying display cases and other marketing materials to promote the products which have gained somewhat of brand loyalty of her side of town.

loans.use: Purchase display case, more inventory, and other marketing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh and her husband have 4 children between 17 and 8 years of age. They do not have any land for cultivation. She raises pigs at a hut. Her husband is a hired laborer. She is supporting 4 children going to school. She has repaid three loans. Their income increased by $2/person/month. Average income is low at $8 person/month. Now she asks to borrow $100 for raising pigs.

loans.use: raises pigs at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. is 50 years old, and a widow with two children. She has been selling provisions, foodstuffs and drinks since 2002; this is a trade that she learned from her uncle.

She has been with LAPO for the past four years. She intends to use the loan of US$350 to buy more kerosene, provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: I am Nazia B.. I am married and the mother of two children. My children are small and do not attend school at present. When they are old enough, I wish to enroll them in a good school. My husband is a scrap dealer. He travels to various nearby villages and collects different used items including spare parts, which he then sells in his own city. My husband does not have a proper conveyance to travel to nearby villages. He feels that his work can become very efficient if he buys a motorcycle for his business. Please lend him $200 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Mr. Julio Eduardo T. Centurion is 47 years old, married, owns a house, and has 2 children, 18 and 14 years old. His wife has a beauty salon in the same place, the only one in the neighborhood.

Since 2005, Julio has a business in which he produces tiles and floors of all sizes and for all purposes. He employs two helpers. He has all the tools necessary to do this activity, like a manual press, molds of different sizes, among other things. He has gathered a clientele because he is responsible and offers his products at good prices.

The loan will be to buy materials to produce tiles, such as cement and granite. This is because he has a very large order for a building project, for which he has to make 400 square meters (approx. 4,300 sq. feet) of granite floor.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julio Eduardo T. Centurión, tiene 47 años, es casado vive en casa propia y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 14 años respectivamente. Su esposa posee en el mismo lugar una peluquería que es la única del barrio.

Desde el 2.005, Julio, posee una baldosería en donde fabrica baldosas y pisos de todos los tamaños, para todo tipo de obras, cuenta con 2 ayudantes. Posee todos los implementos necesarios para desarrollar esta actividad, como ser prensa manual, moldes para diferentes medidas, galpón entre otros, cuenta con clientela formada debido a su responsabilidad y buen precio.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de materiales para la construcción de baldosas como ser cemento y granito, esto es debido a que tomo un pedido muy grande para una obra, para la cual tiene que fabricar unos 400 metros cuadrados de piso granito.

loans.use: Buying cement and granite (compra de cemento y granito)

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: Samit is currently 38 years old. He is married, and has four children. He lives with his family in the Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. Samit has 10 years of experience within the farming business, and would like a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of land to improve his income and business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
I am Farida M., a mother of four children, three of whom attend school and one who is mentally challenged. I have lived with my family in the mid-sized city Faisalabad, Pakistan, for the last 13 years. I am also a health worker in a clinic. I am borrowing for the first time from the microfinance institute Asasah to buy medicines for my clinic. The other women who would like to borrow in my group are: Nasreen A., who will use the loan to expand her husband’s crockery store where he sells tea pots; Safdari B., whose son sells chicken meat; Razia M., who will pay off the remaining installments of a loan on their rickshaw; Asiah B., who will invest her share of the loan to expand their furniture store; and Tahira R., who is borrowing for her husband’s grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for a clinic

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Mrs. Vong S. is a 45-year-old grocer and rice farmer who lives with her husband and 8 children in Sala Komrou Village, Pursat Province. One of their children is still in school, while the others have completed their studies. S. earns $5 per day and her husband Sim Cheoun also makes $5 per day as a construction foreman. She requests a $500 loan to increase her grocery stock, as well as to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crop.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock, as well as to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crop

loans.name: Pram

texts.en: Pram S. is 44 years old. She makes her living making and selling Khmer style noodles to be used in soups and served with various traditional dishes. Since 2003, she has been running this business from a store in front of her home. Her husband also has a unique trade. Roth Mon Hean is 46 years old and runs a business selling palm sugar from house to house. Palm sugar is derived from a special breed of palm tree specific to Cambodia known as the sugar palm. The raw sap is used to produce both palm sugar and, when fermented, is made into palm wine. Together, their combined income is 9 US$ per day. Two of their four children also contribute to the family income by working at a golf course at a nearby resort. Pram S. would like to invest in her husband’s business by buying palm sugar in bulk for him to sell.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en: Jamila is 51 years and just three years younger than her husband, A. A.. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. She resides in Kasur, Pakistan, in a two room brick house. She is requesting a loan of $675 to help expand her husband’s fruit business.  Jamila has been joined in her loan group by two more members: Nagina wants a loan to expand her curtain business; Nazia wants a loan to expand her scrap business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota T. O. belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. She sells candy.

Her economic circumstances motivated her to look for business alternatives and she opted for selling candy, she visits high traffic areas, like the local schools, the main square, bus stops, etc. and it has given her good results.

With the $350 USD (S/.1,000) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy boxes of cookies of different brands, boxes of chocolates, lollipops, bags of gum, and candies of different flavors to keep her inventory levels high.

Carlota is 48 years old, she is a persevering and responsible woman, wishing to get ahead and support her husband with the home expenses and the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carlota T. O., socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria.

La necesidad económica por lo que estaba atravesando, la motivo a buscar alternativas de negocio y ella opto por la venta de golosinas, ella vende de manera ambulatoria recorriendo los lugares donde hay mayor concentración de personas como los colegios de la localidad, plaza de armas, paradero y ve que le esta dando buenos resultados.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagarlo en 6 meses, comprará galletas en cajas de distintas marcas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines, chicles en bolsas y caramelos de diversos sabores para tener bien surtido su bazar.

Carlota tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su casa y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale candy.

loans.name: Nefija

texts.en:
Nefija is a 34 year old woman from the town of Lukavac. She is a widow and raising her two children on her own. Nefija receives some government assistance for her kids and some money from her husband’s pension, but this comes to only $320 a month and it is not enough to support them all.

To supplement their income, Nefjia sells clothing at the local market. She wants to use her first loan from Žene za Žene to invest in increased inventory for her store. Nefija believes that if she can offer more items to her customers, she can increase her overall earnings. Nefija hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her business and will help her to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel started her business when someone brought her packages of used toys from the United States that she offered for sale. It went well, and so she started buying and selling toys out of her home 2 years ago. Now, she also sells her wares in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for $250, that she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel inició el negocio ya que una persona que trae pacas de juguetes usados de estados unidos le ofreció para vender y le pareció bien, así comenzó hace 2 años, compro una paca de juguetes, y los vendía afuera de su casa, ahora va a los tianguis a vender también.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es:
Toribia, D. 53 años D. edad, se dedica desD. hace mucho tiempo a la venta D. comida. 

Ella se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para preparar los desayunos, que luego 
sale a vender a las calles. Algunas veces sus vecinas van a su casa a comprar las cosas 
que ella prepara, como por ejemplo los tamales; otras veces ella recorre las casas ofreciendo
 los desayunos a precios muy económicos. 

Los préstamos que anteriormente ha recibido Toribia le ayudaron a poder comprar insumos
para preparar la comida que ella venD..

A ella le gustaría tener más facilidades para poder adquirir en mayor cantidad los insumos que 
ella requiere para preparar los desayunos que venD., y así poder ahorrar algo D. dinero.
texts.en:
Toriba is 53 years old. For a long time she has worked selling food. She gets up very early in the mornings in order to prepare breakfasts that later she heads out to sell in the streets. Some times her neighbors come by her house to buy the things that she makes, for example her tamales; other times she walks from house to house offering the breakfast at very economical prices. The loans that she has received before have helped her be able to buy ingredients in order to prepare the food that she sells. She would like to have more facilities in order to be able to get ingredients she needs to prepare breakfasts in larger quantities, and so be able to save some money.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos para continuar y ampliar su negocio de venta de comida.

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Upendo M. from Mbeya. She is single with two children, aged 5 and 10. Upendo has been running a crop business since 2005. Her business is to purchase crops from farmers and sell them in the market. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her sister. Upendo currently earns about $300USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400USD in order to purchase additional stock of crops. In the future, she plans to expand business. Upendo thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Upendo would like to purchase additional stock of crops.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Mamissi, Madame Akoélé A. habite actuellement Ahoulogoè avec sa famille. Depuis 16 ans, elle exerce le commerce de l’huile de palme qu’elle produit elle-même. C’est une dame très active mais faute de moyens suffisants n’arrive pas sortir de la misère. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Mamissi, Ms. Akoélé A. currently lives in Ahoulogoè with her family. For sixteen years, she has been doing commerce in palm oil, which she produces herself. She is a woman who is very active but, due to a lack of sufficient funds, isn't managing to escape poverty. She is requesting this loan to develop her business and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make palm oil

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano P. resides in Barangay Rizal in Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Adelaida and they are blessed with seven children. Most of the children are high school graduates. Some of the children were able to reach college, but never graduated because they didn't haven enough money to complete their studies.

Victoriano makes a living planting vegetables and rice. In addition to farming vegetables and rice, he also maintains mango plants, which are around their house. This provides extra income for their family, especially during summer.

Since Victoriano lacks financial resources, he is hoping to borrow PHP 18,000.00 so he can purchase additional farm inputs to cultivate his farm and plant rice. Some of his loan will be used to pay for laborers who will help him plant the crops. The loan will also help to pay for food and snacks to sustain him and his laborers during their work.

Victoriano wants to sustain his farming business and hopefully grow it so he eventually has a hectare of farmland to provide for the future of his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, vive con su único hijo quien cursa estudios universitarios. Se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos, hamburguesas y refrescos, en las afueras de un centro de salud muy cercano a su casa. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año atrás y le va muy bien, ya que por ser un lugar público son varias las personas que al salir o entrar del establecimiento se detienen a comer al paso en el pequeño puesto de Estela, además ella procura que todos los alimento estén bien conservados y limpios, por lo que sus clientes confían en ella. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP y en el transcurso de todo este tiempo y los préstamos anteriores, ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su pequeño kiosco, comprar sillas y mesas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is 40 years old, a single mother, and she lives with her only son who studies at the university. She sells food, juices, hamburgers, and refreshments outside a health center very near her home. She has been in this business for a year and it is going very well, as being a public place there are many people that come and go in this establishment so they stop to eat something from Estela’s small stand. In addition she makes sure all the food is prepared well and her stand is clean, so her customers trust her. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has been punctual with her payments in her previous loans. With the money she wants to expand her small kiosk, buy chairs and tables in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her kiosc and buy furniture

loans.name: Rustamchon

texts.ru: Рустамчон парень в возрасте 25 лет , женат имеет одну маленькую дочку, жена занимается уходом за ребёнком.Сам Рустамчон уже 7 лет как занимается купля продажей фруктов по сезону.На данный момент он продаёт яблоки и мандарины.Для увеличения своего бизнеса он решил взять кредит.Для этого он обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Rustamchon, 25, married, and has a daughter. His wife takes care of the child. For 7 years, Rustamchon has been selling fruits. At present, he sells apples and mandarins. Rustamchon applied for this loan to finance expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana O. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through senior high. Juliana sells fabric, babies' wear and cosmetics at Twifo Praso Near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. Juliana uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Juliana will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more fabric, babies' wear and cosmetics to increase her sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to save towards a house she wants to put up for the child and herself.

loans.use: Juliana will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more fabric, babies' wear and cosmetics to increase the sale to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
R. is 46 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is the father of two children: both of them are still young. He is married to Sinan, 40, who runs a business selling cooked food. R. is a local construction foreman and he has been in this business for more than two years. He is well-known because his experience inspires confidence and because of his knowledge of what's stylish.

R. recently wants to have a small shop for his wife's business. So R. is taking a loan of US$ 300 to build a small shop and to buy some cooked ingredients for his wife's business. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. R. was not available for the photograph so his wife, Sinan, is photographed instead.

loans.use: To build a small shop and to buy some cooked ingredients for his wife's business

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame  Rokia  K. est âgée de 29 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 3 enfants dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Titulaire d’un certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en comptabilité, elle s’est initiée au commerce auprès à sa mère qui fut jadis une commerçante et une grande restauratrice à Ségou. Depuis élève elle aidait cette dernière tenir sa comptabilité et distribuer ses articles. Riche de cette expérience, elle  décida d’évoluer en solo pour exercer les activités d’achat et de vente d’habits et de chaussures depuis 9 ans .Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété à Ségou.
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande  de sa clientèle, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation  depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter 30 complets de bazins moins  riches et 5 complets de bazins riches. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Madame Rokia   K. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de faire face à certains événements sociaux. son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokia K. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in the Médine area of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Holder of an official certification in accounting, she was initiated into the business world through her mother, who was formerly a shopkeeper and significant caterer in Ségou. Since her student days, she helped her mother manage her accounts and distribute her goods. Enriched by this experience, she decided nine years ago to develop her own business buying and selling clothing and shoes. She enjoys an excellent reputation and fame in Ségou. To increase her working capital in order to meet the demands of her clientele, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has been working for 36 months. After 4 solidarity (group) loans and 1 individual loan, all repaid properly, she is seeking her second individual loan, which will be used to buy 30 outfits of medium-quality damask and 5 outfits of rich damask. She gets her raw materials in Bamako (the capital of Mali). Mrs. Rokia K. sells her goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will allow her to provide for various traditional social events. Her ambition is to open a boutique selling clothes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell clothing

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Since 2004 Stella C. has worked as a trader at Kissi, near Elmina, selling foodstuffs such as maize and kenkey. She is married with 5 dependents and received an education through elementary school. While Stella works as a trader, her husband makes his living as a taxi driver. Stella is responsible for providing money to her family in order to keep the house running properly.

Her loan will be used to purchase additional maize in bags (some for making kenkey and some for immediate resale), and also to buy gari which she will then resell. Stella hopes to use the new profits from her business to build her own house.

At the time the picture was taken, she was arranging the kenkey into the cooking pot to be boiled.

loans.use: Ingredients for the foods kenkey and gari

loans.name: Nourietou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des pagnes, elle exerce cette activité au marché local d’atsanvé et le fait de façon ambulante les jours où le marché n’est pas animé. Elle vend ses pagnes à crédit à ses fidèles client et récupère son argent dans les huit ou dix jours. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Son stock actuel de pagnes étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour renouveler son stock avec 20 pièces
texts.en:
As a revenue-generating activity, this woman runs a business selling pagnes (brightly coloured West African cloth). She runs this business at the local market in Atsanvé and door-to-door on days when the market is not active. She sells her pagnes on credit to her loyal customers and collects her money in eight to ten days. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. Her current stock of pagnes being depleted, she is seeking (through WAGES) a loan to renew her stock with 20 sets of pagnes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes (a type of brightly coloured West African cloth)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46-year-old restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with seven children. With the income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school. In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like rice balls, fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Rose says that the price of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, rice, vegetables and firewood. Rose is a member of a group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is a 55-year-old farmer with seven children. For the last 25 years, Alicia has grown rice. She helps her husband, Joel A., by tilling the rice field so that they have a family income. Their harvest is the only thing that sustains them as a family. The family earns 71,000 PHP every time they harvest their farm.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help increase the family income so that they can pay their daily household expenses.

About CEVI
CEVI helps its clients to grow their businesses even more. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Victoria Jenny

texts.es: La señora jenny se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia de su credito individual dentro de la institucion, paralelamente la señora se encuentra trabajando en el Banco de Emprendimiento "El Condor" en el cual esta en su tercera secuencia durate todo el tiempo que a trabajado junto a la institucion siempre a demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de comida en un pequeño local ubicado en la Plaza El Condor en la Calle Jose Maria Camacho No 1760.  Ella vive conjuntamente con el esposo y sus dos hijos, don Frenando Arias el esposo cuenta con un trabajo fijo con el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares.  La sañora Jenny invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio es decir arroz, fideo y algunos otros alimentos que se pudieran comprar por cantidad para si poder aminorar costos y generar mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny is now in the fourth sequence of her individual loan with the institution, at the same time she can be found working at the entrepreneurial bank "El Condor" which is in its third sequence. Throughout the entire time she has been working together with the institution she has always proved to be a hardworking person who is eager to excel. The economic activity that she carries out is the sale of food in a small place located in the Plaza El Condor on Jose Maria Camacho Street. She lives with her husband and two sons; her husband, Mr. Frenando Arias has a steady job which helps with the household expenses. Mrs. Jenny will invest the loan in the purchase of basic goods for her business, such as rice, noodles and other foods that can be purchased in bulk to reduce the costs and generate greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of goods for the restaurant

loans.name: Shahnaz Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji has been a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is married to A. D. who is involved in a fertilizer-selling business. He provides fertilizer to the farmers and takes orders from the shops. He earns good income from this business. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to grow her husband’s business. 

This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Siani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.
 
Farida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business. 

Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shahnaz baji is standing in the middle of the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Гузалай

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
      Гузалай - 39 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Гузалай вместе со своим мужем занимаются бизнесом продуктов питания. У них есть магазин "Азиз" в своем микрорайоне. Муж Гузалай поставляет товар в магазин, а Гузалай сидит в магазине и продает. Муж почти через день приезжает в город Худжанд, на рынок Панчшанбе за продуктами, потому, что продукты питания быстро портящиеся. Муж Гузалой покупает только свежие продукты. В летние каникулы  Гузалай и мужу помогают дети. За новый запрашиваемый займ они хотят расширить ассортимент товара, завезти арбузы и дыню.

loans.use: Продукты питания

loans.name: The Key Group

texts.en:
Florence started her trading business in the community market close to where she lives. She is a petty trader who sells food items like tubers of yam, fresh tomatoes, fish, onions, peppers, etc. on a table in the community market.

Florence is now 38 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She has been stuck for funds to make business progress due to the economic crisis in the country. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted foodstuffs to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She would be grateful for your assistance. 

Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called “The Key”. She is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of assorted foodstuffs

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita S. is from the village of San Carlos in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old. Conchita is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Conchita raises and sells pigs.Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi

loans.use: Reparacion de infraestructura en el molino

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr: A. Zénabou est née vers 1957 à Bassila au Nord au Bénin. Mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Zénabou habite le quartier Vodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Zénabou  est revendeuse de divers articles de grande consommation (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, lait, piles, savons, igname etc.). Zénabou achète ses divers articles à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin, et au Nord du Bénin.  Zénabou revend l’igname en gros ou en détail à des clients à Cotonou. Zénabou a déjà reçu trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité et faire face à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Zénabou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Zénabou envisage plus tard construire une maison qu'elle mettrait en location.
texts.en:
Zénabou A. was born around 1957 in Bassila in northern Benin. She is married with three children currently in school and she lives in the Vodjè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Zénabou sells various consumer goods (canned goods, pastas, milk, batteries, soap, yams, etc.). She buys these goods at Dantokpa, an international market in Benin, as well as in northern Benin. Zénabou sells yams wholesale or retail to customers in Cotonou. She has already received three loans with Alidé that were repaid in full. Zénabou is requesting a fourth loan so she can make her business more profitable and meet her customers' demands. Zénabou hopes to eventually build a house that she will rent out.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sacks of yams

loans.name: Daniel Gitau

texts.en:
Daniel is married to Alice and they have three children: Samuel, age 11; Kevin, age 9; and Maryanne, age 4. Daniel was introduced to the Kiva partner, Kadet, through an existing Kadet client. He is applying for his first loan with Kadet. 

Daniel has been operating a computer internet cafe business for the past six years. He wants to purchase additional electronics, because they are in demand. He also farms as another source of income.

He hopes to expand his current business and open another branch somewhere else with the extra profit generated from his current business. His dream is to provide others with employment and to improve the living conditions of his family. Daniel describes himself as a focused man and a very ambitious businessman.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock for his computer internet cafe business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch T. lives in Prey Sbat village in Takeo province. She is a seller. Her husband, Mr. Chin Ra, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Touch T. decided to request for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to use for plowing.

Mrs. Touch T. is 33 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to use for plowing

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Helena Henriques B. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincial de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de 29, 27, 21, 17,15 e 5 anos de idade, 3 destes continuam a estudar. Fez somente 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação e não continuou por falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta também a sua mãe, enviando alguns géneros alimentícios.

Nunca saiu da cidade, juntou se ao seu marido quando tinha 17 anos e iniciou uma actividade comercial há 3 anos como forma de aumentar a renda da família. Tem feito uma viagem por semana para africa do sul ou Suazilândia, onde compra os seus produtos. Gere um negocio com volume de 20.500,00mt. vende mais batata Reno e cebola e rende cerca de 10.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve empréstimos com algumas associações de crédito, tendo de seguida decidido mudar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha e este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (batata, cebola, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 4.500.00mt, 5.000.00mt e 7.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Helena Henriques B. was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo. She is 44; a widow; and the mother of 6 children who are 29, 27, 21, 17, 15, and 5. Three of her children are in school. She only studied through the 4th grade of the old educational system and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her mother by sending her food. She never moved from her city. She married her husband when she was 17 and started her business 3 years ago as a way of increasing her family's income. She makes a trip every week to South Africa or Swaziland, where she buys her products. She has a sales volume of 20,500 meticais and sells potatoes, white wine, and onions. She earns around 10,000 meticais per month and applies it to her home's expenses and saves some through a traditional rotating savings system known as Xitique. She has had loans with other credit institutions but decided to switch for various reason. She became familiar with Hluvuku through a neighbor. This is her third loan, and it is for 10,000 meticais. She will use it to buy products (potatoes, onions, grapes, etc) to increase her quantity of merchandise. Her previous loans were for 4,500, 5,000, and 7,500 meticais and were all used for the same activity. In the future, she hopes to request more loans to finish her home and to strenghthen her business further.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products (potatoes, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira J., age 38, owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Ocidental; she is married and has two school-aged children.

Earlier this year, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.
