Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and seedlings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elvira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Descripción: Doña María es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos mayores y cuenta con el apoyo de todos ellos, con sus 44 años ella sigue con espíritu jovial y emprendedor, trabaja desde tempranas horas; ella se dedica en la compra de mercaderías del Brasil y la Argentina y las comercializa en su salón comercial ubicado en el mercado de Ciudad del Este. 
Doña María tiene casa propia, pues, la construyo con el sudor de su frente y necesita de un apoyo crediticio constante por que la única manera de obtener mayor ingreso es mejorando los precios de las compras, el cual puede conseguir adquiriendo los productos que comercializa al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ms. María is a single mother, she has 4 grown children and she can count on the support of each of them. At her 44 years she still has a cheerful and enterprising spirit. She works from early in the morning at purchasing merchandise from Brasil and Argentina and she commercializes it in her store, located in the market in Ciudad del Este.

Ms. María owns her own home, which she built by the sweat of her brow, and she needs a financial support because the only way to increase revenue is by getting better prices in her purchases, which she can achieve by buying the products she sells by bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, sugar, flour, noodles, rice, bread products, dairy products and others

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El Sr.  Ismael es casado con la señora Lucia tienen un hijo, el cliente nació en Santa Cruz en Vallegrande  el 12 de diciembre en 1985 y aproximadamente 6 años que tienen su propia parcela en la comunidad de Santo Corazón trabajando en la agricultura el solo mantiene los gastos del hogar ya que su esposa es ama de casa, el cliente tiene su propio vehiculo donde su segunda actividad es el servicio de trasporte publico y esto le ayuda tambien en la agricultura ya que con su vehiculo transporta sus productos a los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.

Este crédito será utilizado en la compra de semilla, para el cultivo de Soya. El señor esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza depositada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ismael is married to Sra. Lucia. They have one child. Ismael was born in Santa Cruz –Vallegrande on December 12, 1985. He is engaged in agriculture and has a parcel of land in the community of Santo Corazón that he has owned for approximately six years. Ismael also owns a vehicle that he uses for his second business of providing transportation services. This loan will be used to purchase seeds for soybean cultivation. Sr. Ismael is grateful for the confidence being entrusted in him by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
TeofiL. es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
TeofiL. es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, TeofiL. se dedica a L. compra y venta D. animales, los compra en las ferias y los comercializa en su distrito D. Acosvinchos, además TeofiL. venD. bebidas, galletas en su casa.
TeofiL. necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. animales menores.
TeofiL. sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
TeofiL. is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. TeofiL. is married, 40 years old and has 4 children. TeofiL. makes her living buying and selling animals. She purchases them at market and sells them in her district, Acosvinchos. In addition, TeofiL. sells drinks and cookies from her house. TeofiL. needs a loan of 600 (PEN), which is money that will be invested in the purchase of small animals. TeofiL. dreams of improving her business and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of small animals.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa A. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Narcisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Narcisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dunia Mayela

texts.es: Doña Dunia es una mujer emprendedora, de 41 años de edad, se dedica al negocio de  venta de ropa, muebles y comida desde hace varios años, el cual inicio con dinero que su esposo dio, producto de su trabajo en mecánica automotriz. Juntos  han construido su casa toda de concreto y con las ganancias de sus ventas también ayuda con los gastos básicos de agua,  luz y gastos de estudios de sus dos hijos. Pero a un le hace falta construir la cocina es por eso la necesidad de este préstamo para comenzar ante del invierno el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, madera y zinc para comenzar la obra, y poder estar en mejores condiciones de trabajo. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para lograr mejores márgenes de ganancias, como mejor equilibrio en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Dunia is a hard working woman who is 41 years old. She has sold clothes, furniture and food for many years. She started this activity with money her husband gave her, product of his work as a mechanic. Together they have constructed a house made entirely of concrete. The profits from their sales help with costs like water, electricity and school fees for their two children. Still they have yet to construct a kitchen and it is for this that they need a loan to begin before winter. They will buy constuction materials like stone, sand, cement, wrought iron, wood, and metal roofing to begin the work which can be in better conditions. Their plans are to continue investing in their business to obtain better profit margins, to balance their sales.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, wrought iron and metal roofing to begin to construct a kitchen

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah N. S. is 30 years old, widowed with one child who attends school.   She has been practicing farming for five years. She gets her income by selling milk. She has one employee who assists her in the business. She is also employed as a social worker in her community.  Peninah has previously taken a loan of kes 20,000 to boost her business and she successfully repaid it. She has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sheep. Peninah hopes to expand her business and improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Deicy

texts.es: Deicy tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, convive con Emilse de 42 años, quien es mecánico y sus hijos Johana de 8 años, Susan de 7 años y Diego de 2 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de Cerveza desde hace un año, negocio que le ha sido rentable puesto que ella vende por pedido, siendo muy conocida en la zona en la que vive por el difícil acceso que hay para ir al mercado de su localidad, es por ello que tiene muy buenas ventas. Deyci se siente contenta porque también genera ingresos extras, ayudando de esta manera a su esposo, quien trabaja en un taller de mecánica. Es así que ambos salen adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, a quienes desean que ellos fuesen unos profesionales. Ella trabaja muy duro pues debe lidiar con los contratos de las distribuidora que le proporcionan las bebidas, además los fines de semana es mucho mayor las ventas, ya que se presentan eventos deportivos y fiestas, por lo que tiene mayor demanda sus productos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad en todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza, además desea ayudar a su esposo en la compra de algunos materiales para su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Deicy is 40 years old. She is a hard working woman. She lives with Emilse, who is a 42 year old mechanic, and their children Johana, 8, Susan, 7, and Diego, 2. They all live together in their own home. She has been selling beer for a year. This business has been profitable since she sells by filling orders. She is very well known in the area where she lives. It is difficult to access the market there and because of this, she has very good sales. Deyci is happy because she also generates extra income, and in this way helps her husband who works as a mechanic. In this way they both get ahead for the wellbeing of their children, who they hope will become professionals. She works very hard; she must deal with the contracts of the distributor who supplies the beverages. On weekends, the sales are much higher since there are sporting events and parties and her products are in higher demand. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she has always shown herself to be very responsible with all of her payments. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of cases of beer, as well as help her husband to buy some materials for his mechanic's workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cases of beer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and she is a tailor. She also sells sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for long. She is 32 years old. She is a hard working lady. Evelyn lives in Edo state, Nigeria.

	She needs the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Iván Alfredo

texts.es:
Iván Alfredo U. Lazo tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su mujer e hija de casi  3 años, Evelyn. 
Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.  Iván es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 

Iván se dedica al transporte de personal, es un chofer profesional, por mediodía y la otro parte del día es agricultor, criando porcinos. El compra sus productos en centros agrícolas, tiendas y mercados, en los mismos lugares donde compra lo que los porcinos necesitan.

Iván solicita el crédito para dar mejor mantenimiento a su negocio y ser mejor. Su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida, tener un futuro mejor y competir con los demás. Sus desafíos son la lucha constante para bien vivir y la competencia que existe hoy en esta crisis. 

Iván quería dar gracias a la Cooperativa San Jose para darle la oportunidad de encontrar crédito. 
A Iván le gusta hacer deportes.
texts.en:
Iván Alfredo U. Lazo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter Evelyn, who is almost 3 years old. They live in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. Iván is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, located 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 15 group members, most of whom have their own small businesses. Iván works in passenger transport as a professional driver half the day, and the other half of the day he tends to the pigs on his farm. He buys his products in agricultural centers, stores and markets, in the same areas where he buys what his pigs need. Iván is requesting this loan to improve and maintain his business by buying products for his pigs. His dream is to improve his quality of life, improve his future and compete with others in the same line of work. The main challenges he faces are the constant struggle to live well and the high level of competition that exists during the current economic crisis. Iván wanted to thank Cooperativa San José for giving him the opportunity to take out this loan. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy products for his pigs

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn P. is 50 years old and is a villager who lives in Krouch village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Dos Nheb, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Sorn P. decided to ask for a loan to pay out for a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Dos Nheb is also a bike repairer in the local village who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker and the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Marianel

texts.en:
Marianel B. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Marianel is widowed and has one infant child. To make a living, Marianel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Marianel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marianel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marianel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marianel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to expand the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El Señor Nicanor A. M.  es de la ciudad de Santani, el cuenta con casa propia,  tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Raquel Carolina Vera de 26 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos.
Tiene un colectivo que trabaja con la Empresa San Vicente, desde hace 8 años, en varios tramos de ciudad, ademas del transporte el también tiene animales vacunos y se dedica a la agricultura.
 
           

Este crédito utilizó para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su colectivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicanor A. M. lives in the city of Santani. He lives in his own home and he is 28 years old. He is married with Mrs. Raquel Carolina Vera, 26 years old, and they have two children together. He drives a bus with the San Vicente company and he has being doing so for the past 8 years. He covers various sectors of the city. In addition to public transportation he also raises livestock and invests his time in agriculture. This loan will be used to purchase new seat covers for the his bus.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new car seat covers for his bus.

loans.name: Ramona Castilla

texts.es:
Ramona Castilla L. C. tiene 46 años.  Vive soltera en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 niños de 4 a 20 anos.

Ramona es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ramona se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un pequeño terreno con maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 cosechas al ano con maíz y arroz.   

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar cacao que necesita semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes químicos con la esperanza de trabajar mas y sacar mas dinero. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminan sus estudios y que sean bien preparados para la vida. La preocupación de sobrevivir se le enfrenta. 

En su tiempo libre se encarga de sus muchachos.
texts.en:
Ramona Castilla L. C. is 46 years old and single. She lives in the Chillanes Canton in the Bolívar province. She has eight children from 4 to 20 years old. Ramona is a member of the El Placer (The Delight) Communal Bank. It is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in all, and most of them grow corn and cacao. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San José. Ramona devotes herself to farming. She has a small piece of land with corn and rice. She makes her purchases and her sales in Mata de Cacoa. There are two harvests a year with corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to plant cacao, and she needs seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers. She hopes to work more and make more money. Her dream is that her children finish their education and that they are well prepared for life. The worry that she faces is survival. In her free time she takes care of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant cacao

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah P. is 37 years old, and she sells second hand clothes and tailoring services in Shanzu Mombasa. Married to Burton Francis who helps support their family income, they have four children aged between six and fifteen years.

Deborah is borrowing her second loan from KADET which she hopes to use to purchase additional second hand clothes and a sewing machine for her busines. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Most of her clients are passersby and the area residents of Shanzu.
In future Deborah P. hopes to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase additional second hand clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Julian Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr.Julian tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, cuentan con casa propia de material noble  de un piso, ubicado en  pasaje Orongo  mza B, lte 14 del  Distrito de Parcona. El Sr. Julian se dedica como cerrajero  no cuenta con taller propio, realiza sus trabajo en los mismos domicilios, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 11 años se inicio como ayudante de cerrajeria, actualmente tiene un contrato verbal para realizar la elaboracion de puertas, ventanas y pasamano de escaleras. El Sr. Julian tiene el sueño de poder tener su vivienda ya terminada. Con el dinero que solicita comprara una moto carga de segunda.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian is 35 years old. He lives with his partner and has a son who is two years old. He has his own one-story house of good quality materials, located in the Orongo lane, block B, lot 14 in the Parcona district. Sr. Julian works as a locksmith. He does not have his own workshop; he carries out his work in the residences where he is employed. He has been doing this work for 11 years. He began as an assistant in a locksmith's shop. Now he has a verbal contract to complete the construction of doors, windows, and the hand rail for a stairway. Sr. Julian's dream is to be able to complete his house. With the money that he is applying for, he will buy a secondhand cargo motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cargo motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Richard

texts.es:
Juan de 19 años, el tiene un taller de lubricadora para vehículos, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Inicio trabajando como lubricador en un taller de carros pero por la falta de oportunidades el decidió implementar un negocio de lubricación de automóviles ya que le gusto esta profesión. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su clientela y tener dinero para mantener a su hija, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lubricantes y aceites para carro y así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener una empresa de servicios automovilísticos.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 19 years old, has an automobile lube workshop. He lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids). It got it name because when it was discovered, there where many orchids there. He began working as a lube technician in an auto repair workshop, but for a lack of opportunities there he decided to open his own lube shop, since he enjoys that profession. Little by little, and with a good deal of effort, he has been able to build up a clientele and earn enough money to support his daughter. He now works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. With the loan, he wants to purchase automobile lubricants and oils to be able to give better service to his customers. In the future, he wants to have an automobile service company.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lubricants, oils

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Delia’s fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
El señor Cristian A. de 28 años de edad, está soltero.
   Don Cristian se dedica a la venta de repuestos y servicios técnicos para motos hace más de 10 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.000; el comenzó trabajando con su padre en el negocio, se recibió de técnico en la especialidad industrial,  área mecánica,  en la actualidad tiene 2 personas que están trabajando para él, y una gran clientela formada en su comunidad. 
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías, (pistones, bobinas, bujías, juntas, cubiertas, cabos, aros, etc.).
texts.en: Cristian A. is 28 years old and he is single. Cristian has been involved in motorcycle repair, sales and services for the past 10 years; since approximately the year 2000. He started out working with his father until he graduated as an industrial technician and mechanic. He has 2 people employed in the business and he has a large client base in his community. He will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as pistons, bobbins, spark plugs, nuts, and bolts, etc.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo P. es un señor ya grande de edad pero a pesar de esto el sigue trabajado para ofrecer a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene la construyo con ahorros propios, solo que ahora el solicita un crédito para remodelar el baño de su casa para que se vea mas presentable.
texts.en: Despite being an older gentleman, Sr. Pablo P. continues to work in order to provide his wife with a better quality of life.   His house was built using his own savings, but now he is requesting a loan to use for remodeling the bathroom so that it will look more presentable.

loans.use: Remodel his bathroom

loans.name: Gurmencinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Gurmencinda; tiene 47 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquileres de habitaciones de su casa,ella trabaja en un hotel ya hace cuatro años, por medio de este negocio de alquileres saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar las habitaciones para alquilar. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y terminar de construir su casa.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Union de Ollantaytambo" community bank. The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, belonging to the Urubamba province in the Cuzco department.

The member is Gurmencinda. She is 47 years old and is married and has five children. The member alternates her daily activities with renting rooms in her home. She has worked in a hotel for four years. Through the business renting rooms, she's able to help her children get ahead. She wants to improve the rented rooms. She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials and finish building her house.

She is thankful for the requested loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: The member requests a loan to buy construction materials and finish building her house.

loans.name: Mehmoodan's Group

texts.en:
Mehmoodan lives in a 2 roomed brick house with her family in Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She settled here after her marriage more than 20 years ago. She is a widow who lost her husband as a result of a sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her as, after the death of her husband, all the responsibilities came down on her shoulders. She recovered her senses for her children and raised them very well. Now both sons have their own business. Both of her sons operate a Punjabi food resturant. They offer a variety of food such as Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Biryani (made with rice, chicken and served with yogurt and salad) and tea to their clients. They are very good people and have good business knowledge. They have an ability to attract customers with their good customer dealings and the quality of their food. 

Mehmoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons business. With the loan, they will buy required items such as chickpeas, spices, cooking oil, rice & chicken in bulk quantities that will help them providing better quality services and food to their customers. 

Mehmoodan is hopeful that an investment will make her sons business more profitable and will also expand their business on larger scale. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mehmoodan.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa N. lives in the Kasubi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother and his daughter). 

Hasifa has a farm produce sales business. She has been in this business for two years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Hasifa sells her products at the market, retail.  Hasifa has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of beans and groundnuts.  

The main business challenges for Hasifa include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. Hasifa lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda E. is from the city of Bacolod Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Leonarda is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonarda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonarda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Primitiva; ella tiene 45 años de edad, viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de chicharroneria, la socia tiene su local donde vende este tipo de plato hecho a base de chancho, la socia abre desde las 09:00amhasta las 04:00pm, ella trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos que le ayudan cuando ella lo necesita ,la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de Salir adelante siendo esta la forma que tiene para sacar a sus hijos adelante . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como carne de chancho, papas,aceite, entre otros más. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Primitiva belongs to the "MAMA SIMONA" communal bank, which is situated in the Poroy district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. 

Primitiva is a 45-year-old widow, with four children. In addition to her daily chores, she runs a business selling "chicharrones" (deep-fried pork). She has a shop, where she sells this type of pork-based dish from 09:00am to 04:00pm. She works in conjunction with her children, who help her when she needs it. She is a very hardworking person and is determined to succeed in this business, which enables her to provide for her children. 

Primitiva has requested this loan, in order to purchase more produce, such as pork, potatoes, and oil. 

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como carne de chancho, papas,aceite, entre otros más.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: Suhbaatar, 31, is married and lives with his wife and 2 children in the Arhangai province, in central Mongolia. His son goes to a local elementary school, and the daughter hasn't yet reached school age. His wife is a photographer, but she helps her husband's business. They have been residing at their permanent place for 4 years. Suhbaatar has been operating his family-based vegetable trading business since 2006. His starting capital was 300,000 MNT and his working capital is about 3,000,000 MNT today. He always pays attention on his business and buys the vegetables to replace the varieties that he runs out of. His family members support and make contributions to his business as much as they can. The members of this family are all in good physical condition and able to run the business further. As a result of their business and endless effort, they were able to buy a car. Suhbaatar, who is a hardworking and sociable vegetable trader, says that his current  business is the source of their family income and wants to expand it in order to provide his children with a good education. Suhbaatar is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT to buy more vegetables to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Katim Ole

texts.en:
Katim Ole S.  is 27 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last six years.

Katim learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.

Katim's hope and dream is to excel in farming and to construct more rental houses. He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great things.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia runs a general store in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her general store

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Marleny; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos (11,5,3,1 año y medio) años de edad, la socia es artesana de profesión ella ha heredado el arte de sus ancestros, la socia es originaria del pueblo de Chinchero, la socia desde muy niña siempre estuvo ligada a la artesanía sin ellos saber que este era un arte, hicieron de ella parte de sus vidas diarias, aprendió a hilas, y teñir las diferentes lanas con óxidos naturales provenientes de las zonas más altas del ande, con mucho ingenio aprendieron a tejer a mano con la ayuda de precarias herramientas de tejido, entretejían las lanas y se iban formando los diferentes dibujos, generalmente estos diseños muestran la iconografía andina la viva diaria, los paisajes, los animales, la siembra y cosecha, el agua y el sol; La socia fue creciendo con todo esto a su entorno, mientras su padre Forferio pintaba la naturaleza en sus cuadros, ellos fueron descubiertos y ayudaron a escribir su historia, la historia de un pueblo lleno de bellos paisajes y que a pesar de los siglos aún conservaron la pureza del legado inka en muchas de sus costumbres entre ellas el arte. La socia ha sido protagonista en documentales a nivel internacional, y siguió dando a conocer al mundo a su pueblo y a sus trabajos finamente acabados, hoy en día Marleny exporta sus trabajos a Estados Unidos; Ella tiene el sueño de instalar en su comunidad hospedajes para recibir a los diferentes turistas que llegan de todo el mundo y que se queden unos días para participar de sus costumbres y tener más contacto con ellos y también nos indica que desearían enseñarles a tejer. La socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital y comprar sus materiales para continuar con sus trabajos y enviarlos a sus proveedores en Estados Unidos.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "NEW VICTORIA - CHINCHERO."   This bank is located in the district of Chinchero, province of Urubamba, Cusco.  Her name is Marleny, and she is 35 years old and married with four children (11, 5, 3, and 1 1/2 years old).

Marleny is a professional artisan who inherited her skills from her ancestors.  She is originally from the town of Chinchero.  From the time she was very young, she was involved with artisanal crafts without knowing that they were an art form; she made them part of her daily life.  She learned to spin and to tint the various wools with natural dyes from the higher areas of the Andes.  With great facility she learned to knit by hand using rustic knitting implements.  She wove using wool to create different designs.  Generally, the patterns are symbolic representations of Andean daily life: the landscapes, the animals, planting and harvesting, the sun and the water.

Marleny grew up surrounded by all these things and with her father Forferio painting scenes of nature all the while.  The paintings were discovered and helped to establish a history of a town full of beautiful landscapes and that for centuries has preserved the purity of the Inca legacy through its customs and particularly its art.

Marleny has been featured in international documentaries and continues to contribute fine artwork to her town and to the world.  Today she exports pieces to the United States.  She dreams of installing accomodations for the various tourists who come from all over the world to stay a few days in order to participate in local customs.  She wants to have more contact with these visitors and wants to teach them to knit.  

Marleny is requesting this loan to buy more materials so that she can continue creating artwork to ship to her U.S. suppliers.  She is happy to be provided this opportunity and promises to comply with timely repayments.

loans.use: to buy more materials in order to create artwork to ship to U.S. suppliers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Esther is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Esther runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and beverages in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Esther is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is 46 years old, married and has four children.  She operates a curio shop to earn her living. She has eight years of experience in the business.  She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy necklaces and African designed fabric.

loans.use: To buy necklaces and African design fabric.

loans.name: Nida'

texts.en:
Nida' D. is a young woman from Hebron. Nida' has a small tailoring workshop in her house where she makes women's clothes. Nida' is known for her good work and punctuality. 

Nida' wants to expand her business and purchase a sewing machine, fabric and sewing kit as summer is around the corner and she expects a high demand due to the season of weddings and parties.

Nida's mother and brother appear in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and tailoring kit

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice I. is married and has four children, three of whom attend school.  She a resident of Kitale area in Western Kenya and has been farming for three years producing eggs and selling to the local market. She employs three farmhands.  Alice is requesting her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES, which she will use to expand her poultry business. Her first loan for 30,000 KES helped her establish her farm. She says she has a target of rearing up to 3,000 birds and this second loan will help her achieve that goal. She adds that her family solely relies on the farming income for their upkeep. Alice notes that poultry diseases are a great challenge but is optimistic that they are manageable.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es: Cayo, de 28 años de edad, convive con su pareja Ruth y fruto de esa relación tienen 01 hijo llamado José de 02 años y juntos residen en su propia casa donde reina la comprensión. Cayo aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, pero hace 05 años cuenta con su propia parcela de 02 hectáreas cultivados con plantas de cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos, su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del cacao, por la calidad del y es gracias a los buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, de esa manera pueda avanzar con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de sus frutos. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, y por ende mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el crédito. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas y sacar la mala hierba de sus campos.
texts.en: Cayo is 28 years old and he lives with his partner, Ruth. Their son, Jose, is 2 years old and he is the fruit of their relationship. They live together in a house which they own and where mutual understanding reigns. As an adolescent, Cayo worked in his parents' fields. But for the past 5 years he has had his own 2-hectare parcel of land where he cultivates cocoa and coffee. The key to his success lies on his creativity and his eagerness to work. His plants are cared for in a technically sound manner, especially because he has received training from the Agricultural Engineers. His product which is in highest demand is the cocoa grains for its quality and it is yields the best economic returns. He usually works alone but during the harvest season he hires laborers to help him advance faster in the extraction and selection of the products. His plan for the future is to keep expanding his agricultural production in order to keep his clients satisfied, and therefore improve his quality of life. His is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that his support will be very useful in the progression of his work. He is thankful to the organization for granting him this loan. With his loan he plans on hiring laborers to help with the harvest and to help him with the weeds in his fields.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 34 years old, married and has 3 children.   Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a ari-sari store in the Philippines for the past 3 years.  She also earns extra income from food vending. 

Vilma has requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as bread, groceries products, etc.   She has  successfully repaid 1 previous loan from NWTF before this loan.   Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 44-year-old housewife and a mother of five. Her husband sells car parts.

Sanaa started 10 years ago buying blankets and cloth from the wholesale market and selling the items as her retail business at home. People prefer to buy from her because of the product quality that she provides, and her reasonable prices.

Now Sanaa is applying for a loan to buy a larger quantity of blankets and cloth in order to open her own store in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of blankets and cloth.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, a 26-year-old married mother of two children aged five and three, is a farmer, an occupation she shares with her husband. Michelle helps him grow rice crops and makes sure the farm is free of weeds and pests. Her current monthly income is 4000 PHP.

Michelle does her best to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, hoping for their farm to expand and for their children to someday finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, a 45-year-old resident of Cloocan City, Philippines. She is a widowed mother of six children, three of whom are working and have their own families, while the other three are still studying. By the grace of God, Elvira has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her other three children to college.

Elvira operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store retailing groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. She also uses a small area of her house for videoke machine rental where people can hang out and sing. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. She also earns income from renting out the machines for special occasions, her regular customers being her neighbors and the local community. Elvira earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her videoke machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Del Bosque Group

texts.es: El señor Eddy quien pertenece al alcom La Nueva Esperanza del Bosque, tiene 31 años y vive en las Lomas D. Carabayllo, es conviviente y recientemente a tenido a su primogenito, se dedica a la compra y venta D. materiales D. construccion,trabaja en Transportes R., empezo junto con sus hermanos, al inicio adquirieron un vehiculo y en la actualidad ya cuentan con tres vehiculos. Hasta el momento el señor Eddy ha logrado estabilidad economica, su negocio cubre todas las deudas D. su hogar. Su deseo es poder sacar adelante a su familia y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Eddy is a member of the Communal Bank “La Nueva Esperanza del Bosque” (The New Hope of the Forest). He is 31 years old and lives in Las Lomas D. Carabayllo. Eddy is in a common-law relationship and his first child was recently born. He buys and sells construction materials. Eddy works in a business called “Transportes R.”, which he started with his siblings. He started out with one vehicle, but now he has three of them.

Sr. Eddy has reached the point where has achieved financial stability. His business allows him to cover all of his household obligations. He hopes to move his family forward and continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos es empleado en el Hospital La Merced de la ciudad de La Paz encargado de cotizaciones. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá mucho para acceder a información médica a través del Internet en su casa. Juan Carlos vive en  alquiler en una casa  la misma que queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Juan Carlos es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009 y nunca ha fallado en sus pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is employed at La Merced Hospital in the city of La Paz. He is in charge of pricing. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a computer, which will help greatly with accessing medical information over the Internet at home. Juan Carlos lives in a rental home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Juan Carlos has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and has never failed in submitting his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy a computer so that he can work from home.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 45, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Rosindo, they have one daughter who is now studying. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Merlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams to be able to give her daughter a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née à Bamako il y’a 27 ans, Rokia est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Rokia s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années  à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année.
Après un premier prêt remboursé sans aucune difficulté, elle sollicite un deuxième pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 30 paquets de boisson NBB, 70 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 50 cartons d’eau minérale, 20 cartons de lait Candia, 60 cartons de boisson canette différentes (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 20 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, 15 cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes, etc.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Bamako and 27-years-old, Rokia is married and the mother of a son. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended area of Médine Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having carried on many businesses without success, Rokia started about ten years ago in the business of buying and selling grocery store items. She conducts her business outside her home in Médine Sikasso where she is sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

In order to satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. After repaying her first loan without much difficulty, she seeks a second in order to buy from the suppliers of SIkasso and also from Bamako, 30 packets of NBB beverages, 70 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 50 cartons of mineral water, 20 cartons of Candia milk, 60 boxes of different canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc.), 20 packages of mineral water in pouches, 15 cartons of different types of biscuits, etc.

With the second loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 300,000 FCFA which will essentially be used to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: El Sr. Evaristo es cliente de la institución que desde muy joven, radica en Santa Cruz, es oriundo de la ciudad de La Paz, se vino ha trabajar a Santa Cruz buscando un futuro mejor y mejores condiciones de vida, empezó comercializando bolsas de plásticos, seguidamente comercializo abarrotes. Fundo una asociación  en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, donde comercializa ropa interior desde hace 18 años. El cliente menciona que se encuentra satisfecho por los logros obtenidos.  La familia la componen 4 hijos y su esposa, los hijos actualmente estudian. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería, ropa interior por mayor, es una persona muy amable y cordial con sus clientes, se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Evaristo has been a client of Emprender since he moved to Santa Cruz as a young man.  He is originally from the city of La Paz, but came to work in Santa Cruz so that he could find a better life and improved living conditions.  Evaristo started out selling plastic bags and then transitioned to selling groceries.  He started an association at one of the most popular markets in Santa Cruz, where he has been selling undergarments for 18 years.  Evaristo says that he is satisfied with what he has achieved.  His family consists of his wife and four children who are currently in school.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise, particularly undergarments in bulk.  He is a person who is friendly and cordial with his customers.  Evaristo is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments in bulk.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa cuenta con 51 años de edad es casada tienes dos hijos los cuales ya no estudian pero aun dependen de ella su esposo se llama silvestre él se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio de pescadería ella vende pescado y también chicharrones en su colonia ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de pescados y chicharrones ella espera que le beneficie y le ayude con sus negocio, a ella le gustaría hacer crecer su negocio.

La Sra. Teresa pertenece al grupo Las Marías el cual está integrado por dos hombres y once mujeres que a continuación son mencionadas:

La Sra. Paula cuenta con 52 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio tiene un puesto de refrescos y va invertir su préstamo en surtir refrescos de varios sabores y jugos.
La Sra. Venancia cuenta 30 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende verduras e invirtiera su préstamo en la compra de mas verduras como son: chile, jitomate, zanahoria, lechuga, etc.
La Srta. Marisol cuenta con solo 19 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende refrescos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas refrescos y jugos.
La Sra. Rosa Ícela cuenta con 21 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende refrescos lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de refrescos.
El Sr. Antonio cuenta con 20 años de edad, el se dedica al comercio de dulces lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de más dulces.
La Srta. Yadira cuenta 21 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende refrescos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas refrescos.
La Srta. Silvia cuenta con 19 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende perfumes lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de perfumes y cremas, etc.
La Sra. Isabel cuenta 49 años de edad, ella  se dedica al comercio vende verduras lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: chile, jitomate, papa, etc.
El Sr. Leonardo cuenta con 40 años de edad, el se dedica al comercio cuenta con pequeño negocio de refrescos lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas refrescos de varios sabores y tamaños.
La Sra. Alixandra cuenta con 30 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende tacos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: chile, aceite, jitomate, etc.
La Sra. Rosa dalia cuenta con 37 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende pollos lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas pollos para vender.
La Sra. Alberta cuenta con 55 años de edad, se dedica al comercio vende tortillas lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para hacer las tortillas como son: maíz, masa maseca, etc.
texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old, married, and has two children who don’t go to school but are dependent on her. Her husband is Silvestre, and he works in the fields.  She works in the fish market. She sells fish and pork rinds  in her neighborhood. She will invest her loan in the purchase of fish and pork rinds. She hopes it will benefit and help her business. She would like to grow her business. 

Teresa belongs to the group Las Marías which is comprised of two men and eleven women who are listed below: Paula is 52 years old. She has a refreshments stall, and she will invest her loan in stocking various types of refreshments and juices. Venancia is 30 years old. She sells vegetables. She will invest her loan into the purchase of more vegetables like: chiles, tomatoes, carrots, lettuce, etc. Marisol is only 19 years old. She sells refreshments. She will invest her loan into the purchase of more refreshments and juices. Rosa Ícela is 21 years old. She sells refreshments and will invest her loan into the purchase of refreshments. Antonio is 20 years old. He sells sweets and will invest his loan into the purchase of more sweets. Yadira is 21 years old. She sells refreshments and will invest her loan into the purchase of more refreshments. Silvia is 19 years old. She sells perfumes and will inest her loan into the purchase of perfumes, creams, etc. Isabel is 49 years old. She will vegetables and will invest her loan into the purchase of vegetables like: chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. Leonardo is 40 years old. He has a little refreshments business and will invest his loan into the purchase of more refreshments of various flavors and sizes. Alixandra is 30 years old. She sells tacos and will invest her loan into the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make food like: chiles, oil, tomatoes, etc. Rosa dalia is 37 years old. She will chickens and will invest her loan into the purchase of more chickens to sell. Alberta is 55 years old. He sells tortillas and will invest his loan into the purchase of ingredients that he uses to make tortillas like: corn, cornmeal, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fish and pork rinds

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en: Aliyah is a 52-year-old widowed woman living with her children in Lebanon. In 1997, she opened a mini-market in her town. With her requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will be able to increase her store’s inventory of food products and provisions. It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. In the future, and because of her older age, Aliyah plans to concede her business to her children.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of food products and provisions.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old and married with seven adult children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years. Francisca sells sugar, vinegar, canned goods and other various products. She earns about 8000 PHP per month with her business.

Francisca has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo and also rice. Francisca hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo and also rice.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 62 years old and a single mother of one child who is 32 years old.  To earn a living, she practices poultry farming.  She has been in the business for three years.  She is also employed elsewhere hence she has employed one person to run her business in her absence.

Zipporah hopes to expand her business in five years.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Sinoko Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinoko Group in Western Kenya! 

Eunice takes care of 14 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Eunice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Eunice is the facilitator of the Sinoko Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sinoko Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La socia Fortunata; continua con su negocio D. atencion D. su tienda D. abarrotes y D. la compra y venta D. lechón en el mercado mayor D. su barrio, a la socia la contartan para bautizos, matrimonios, bodas D. plata, D. oro, D. papel y otros eventos sociales y ella prepara el lechón con tamal acompañados y venD. a los clientes, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir su credito en la compra D. chanchos ya que en la ciudad las costumbres son D. comer cerdo el primero D. enero para que todo el año se tenga abundancia. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra D. chanchos para año nuevo.
texts.en:
The member, Fortunata, continues with her grocery store business and her business buying and selling pork in the major market of her neighborhood.  She is hired for baptisms; weddings; first, silver, and golden anniversaries; and other social events.  She prepares pork with tamales and sells it to the customers.

Now she wants to invest her loan in buying pigs, since in the city the tradition is to eat pork on January first to have abundance throughout the year.  She wants the loan to invest in buying pigs for New Year.

loans.use: to buy pigs for the new year holiday.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
So runs the tale that adversity invariably borrows its sharpest sting from our impatience. 
39 year old Bernard says he has borne witness to the unraveling of a friend's business, principally brought to pass by a hasty desire for profits in the short term. 
8 years ago as Bernard set forth, he decided he would steer clear of the mistakes most of his contemporaries had made, especially those bearing a hand in similar business ventures, namely the arts.
This happily married father of 5 specializes in graphic arts, which are drawing, engraving, painting and print making. He also makes traditional beads and stamps.
He says this business generates him monthly sales profits equivalent to 300,000 UGX.
Farming is his auxiliary business.
He is hoping he can be in a position to expand, once he puts this loan to better use.
He plans on purchasing better equipment and stationery that he reckons will enhance his graphic art pieces.

loans.use: to purchase better equipment and stationery that he reckons will enhance his graphic art pieces.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 30 años de edad casado con prudencio de 37 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Lidia es una madre, que se dedica a las labores domesticas pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la agricultura. Esta labor lo realiza junto a su querido esposo, que cultivan cacao y maíz desde ya hace más de 12 años. Ella cuenta que el producto que más rentabilidad le genera es el cacao, mientras que el maíz es una ayuda porque es una planta estacionaria, solo se cultiva los meses de enero y  febrero para venderlos en los meses de junio y julio mientras que el cacao se cosecha cada 15 días, pero cuando la producción es baja se cosecha cada dos meses, por supuesto que también el volumen de producción es minima.
Lidia está contenta con esta labor que realiza, ya que gracias a sus productos logró construir su vivienda.
En un futuro próximo desea dedicarse a realizar un negocio en la venta de prendas de vestir. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones y comprar sacos de abono.
texts.en:
30-year old Lidia is married to 37-year old Prudencio and they have four children. They live in the highly populated centre of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. As well as being a mother with daily chores to perform, Lidia also works on her farm. She and her beloved husband have grown cocoa and corn for more than twelve years. The cocoa crop brings in the most money, while the corn brings in less as it is a seasonal crop and can only be planted in January and February and sold in June and July. Cocoa, on the other hand, is harvested every two weeks--unless production is low and then it is harvested every two months. 

Lidia is happy with this work; with the income she has managed to build her own house. In the near future she wants to start a business selling clothing. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually. With the S/.1,000 loan she will hire labourers to work on the farm and also buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire labourers and buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a single woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 14 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be honest and obedient.  Previously, she was employed at a salon. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as blow drying and plaiting, and she sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of hair oil. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase hair oil and cosmetics. Nancy's business goal is to run several similar outlets within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo tiene 50 años de edad vive en la población del municipio de Chimoré provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el convive con la señora María junto a sus hijos, él tiene el oficio de albañil y también ayuda a su esposa  María en el puesto de venta del Kínder. Por desgracia como muchos Hugo cayo en el vicio de la bebida y fue despojándose de sus cosas e incluso haciendo a un lado a su familia, pero el tiempo y la responsabilidad de mantener su familia hizo que Hugo siente cabeza y se preocupe por el bienestar de los suyos, siendo que empezó a trabajar solo y fue ganando méritos con los conocidos de su esposa quienes lo requerían mucho por sus obras, en un tiempo alcanzo a dirigir equipos de construcción lo que fue su mayor distracción y así se olvidó poco a poco del del vicio en el que cayo, ahora tiene buena reputación en su trabajo y consigue contratos que le hacen alcanzar mayores ingresos y mejores situaciones para vivir junto a su familia. Ahora solicita un crédito con el que hará operar a su esposa de la vejiga ya que ella está un poco pasada de peso, quien tuvo molestias de la vejiga desde hace tiempo y por falta de dinero no pudo hacerse un chequeo y control médico, la señora aporta mucho en su familia ya que con la venta en el kínder mantiene apaliados muchos gastos y ahí es donde tiene los contactos para los contratos para Hugo. María esta consiente que fue un descuido por su parte, ahora ella y su esposo solicitan un crédito para mejorar su salud y hacerse intervenir en una operación no muy complicada y así poder seguir atendiendo su venta y mantener su familia sin perjuicios en sus quehaceres, de tal forma que  para Hugo lo primero es la salud y sin contar con un seguro de salud él se decidió a pagar la operación de su esposa y pagar en cuotas el crédito lo más antes posible.
Hugo anhela que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor que el que tuvo que peregrinar, sacar a sus hijos del bachillerato y luego encaminarlos en estudios superiores serán su próxima meta y trabajara muy duro y hará lo posible para que esta situación se haga realidad y vea sus hijos en lo futuro con sus vidas más plenas y mejoradas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 50 years old. He lives in the municipality of Chimoré, province of Carrasco, in the city of Cochabamba. He lives together with María Magdalena and their children. He works as a mason, and he also helps his wife María in her sales stand at a kindergarten. Unfortunately, like many men, Hugo fell into the vice of drinking, and he was neglecting his affairs and even putting his family aside. But time and the responsibility for maintaining his family led Hugo to come to his senses and concern himself more with the well-being of his loved ones. Thus he began working alone, without friends, and he built up a good reputation with his wife's acquaintances, who needed him often for their projects. Over time he advanced to managing construction teams, which was his best distraction, and thus he forgot little by little the problem that lede him to neglect his own situation and that of his family. Now he has a good reputation in his work, and he obtains contracts that give him a better income and let him provide better living conditions for his family. Now he is requesting a loan which he will use to pay for a bladder operation for his wife, since she is a bit overweight and she has been having trouble with her bladder for some time, but the lack of money prevented her from getting medical checkups. She contributes greatly to the family, since with the sales stand at the kindergarten she covers a lot of expenses, and this is also where she finds the contacts for Hugo's work contracts. María realizes that this was negligence on her part, but now she and her husband are requesting a loan to improve her health; she will undergo an operation that is not very complicated, and then she will be able to continue operating her sales stand and maintaining her family without hindrances to her daily activities. For Hugo, health comes first, and without having health insurance, he decided to pay for his wife's operation and pay off the loan in installments as quickly as possible. 

Hugo's desire is that his children will have a future that is better than the path he had to travel. He wants to help them finish an advanced high school degree, and his next goal will be to set them on their path with higher education. He will work very hard and do everything possible to make this a reality, so he can see his children in the future with lives that are full and improved.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's bladder operation.

loans.name: Emako Group

texts.en:
Mary is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Emako Group members. The 20 of them, 14 women and 6 men, are farmers in Butere District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize and sorghum.

Mary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, to access the best input prices, to rest assured of reliable input delivery, to grow enough food for the family and to use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, repairing her home, saving for the future and perhaps investing in another business.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Casido

texts.en:
