Casido is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Casido is 46 years old and one of her children is in school.

Casido has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Casido requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

Casido has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Evelyn O., I have made and sold tortillas for 4 years and my clientel are loyal, they are my neighbors and people with orders of more than 100 tortillas, which my children help to pack and distribute. The earnings help cover family expenses. My goal is to increase production and by which increase profits to use for the education of my children and to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, water, lime, firewood, lights.

Mi nombre es Evelyn O., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que hago hace 4 años y mi clientela es muy buena, son mis vecinos y personas que hacen encargos por cantidades mayores de 100 tortillas. en mi negocio me ayudan mis hijos a empacar y repartir el producto, los ingresos que me genera son para cubrir gastos de nuestra familia. Mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y asi obtener una mayor ganancia la cual la utilizaria para la educacion de mis hijos y sustentar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, agua, cal, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Aitu

texts.en: Aitu, 35, is married with three children. She joined the microcredit program in 2005. She used her first loan to establish a taro farm. Her husband does most of the farm work while she goes to the market three times a week to sell their taro. Their small farm is expanding and now she needs more capital to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides.  She is contemplating starting another business but she thinks she has to concentrate first on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en: Zahide H. owns a small herd of sheep in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. She raises sheep for wool, cheese and slaughter. Zahide has applied for funding so that she can afford to increase the size of her herd, thereby increasing her and her family’s monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Mrs. Ham T. is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their two children. She works as a farmer and food seller, earning $3/day while her husband earns $3/day as an electrician. Mrs. Ham T. has a working arrangement with a local plantation owner from whom she buys bananas in bulk for a very good price.

She plans to use this loan to purchase bananas from the plantation and resell them at the local market for a profit. She is very excited about this opportunity and hopes one day to have her own plantation so that she does not have to buy her stock from another person.

loans.use: To purchase bananas wholesale from a plantation to resell at various markets.

loans.name: Vanthorn

texts.en:
Vanthorn has been married for 35 years and has 2 children, 1 son and 1 daughter. She started a little grocery store out of her home in 2004. When free from school, her son assists her in selling the groceries. Her husband is a government official.

Vanthorn has borrowed and repaid a loan from MAXIMA already. She will use the loan of US$ 300 she is presently requesting to purchase more grocery items for her inventory. Vanthorn is capable of managing her loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory

loans.name: Enige

texts.en:
Enige S. is very active and enterprising woman. She is married to Mr. S.. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drugs and drinks to people living in her community.

Enige S. is requesting a loan of $400, and she plans to repay it in 8 months. She has three years of experience in the business; she has been a LAPO member for two years.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and drinks

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is a 43-year-old farmer who raises livestock in the small village in the Saatli region. He is married and has three children. He has two years of experience in raising livestock. He started his small business in 1999 when he purchased a cow, and during those many years was selling milk and yogurt to the local people and bazaar traders. But life changed and became difficult, especially in villages. Tahir wanted to improve his life and the conditions of his family, so he started to raise calves and sell them for meat production. During the last two years it has been the only financial source for his family. For a large family of 5 members, it is very hard just to sell only one or two calves every two or three months. So Tahir would like to enlarge his business and purchase more calves for raising and breeding. For this purpose he applied for 700 USD. He will spend this loan purchasing two calves for an estimated price of 300 USD, and then buy fodder for 100 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es:
Mr. Gonzalez started his business when he was employed at a printing press in Chinandega and he saw the need to improve his quality of life. He then decided to have his own printing press in his home.

He started this business 4 years ago, when he bought cheap machines which he paid for little by little because he bought them on credit. In this way, he has been able to grow his business until he has managed to improve his quality of life.

Ceprodel has offered him a hand, financially speaking, for 2 years now, with authorized loans which have been paid back on time. The impact of these loans has been improving his quality of life by helping him buy the tools necessary for his work, and increasing his financial resources with larger sales and thus larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio del señor G. inicia siendo él empleado en una imprenta en Chinandega y al ver la necesidad de mejorar su nivel de vida decide implementar su propia imprenta pero en su hogar.

Inicia su trabajo hace 4 años con la adquisición de maquinarias baratas que poco a poco las fue pagando por haberlas comprado al crédito. De esta manera ha ido creciendo su negocio hasta mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace dos año con créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es mejorando su nivel de vida ayudándole a comprar sus herramientas de trabajo y aumentando sus recurso económicos con mayores ventas y mayores utilidades.

loans.use: Investing in working materials/tools (Inversión en materiales de trabajo)

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru:
Mehrubon O. is 21 years old, has a high school education and is married. Mehrubon raises and sells livestock. She will use her loan to purchase several pieces of livestock. After fattening them she will sell them and will use her revenues to purchase young calves over a 12 month period. Her husband helps her in her business. Mehrubon will pay back the loan during a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Олимова Мехрубон, возраст – 21 год, образование среднее, замужем, детей не имеет. Мехрубон занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. После их откормки она будет продавать их и на вырученные деньги приобретать молодых бычков и так в течение 12 месяцев. В этом ей помогает её муж. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Livestock

loans.name: Ndi

texts.en:
Ndi E. was born in 1982, is single and a mother of two children. Due to poverty, she dropped out of school. Motivated by these circumstance she became a member of GHAPE in 2005, after being trained in business and management skills and with a loan of $40 she started her off-license where she can now boost of a daily income to take care of her self and children.

She plans to add more drinks in her store, educate her children and take care of their needs with the profit of this loan.

She plans to repay the loan in 18months. Repayment will start in the fourth month after disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks

loans.name: Semuti Development Group

texts.en: Ever since Annet lost her husband some years ago, life has really changed. Being the sole bread winner for her 7 children and now 2 grandchildren, Annet believes working hard is the only solution, and she is not regretting the effort. She has a 12-year-old hardware shop in Semuti, Mityana, has 7 cows at home that provide milk both for sale and home consumption, and has had a piggery for 9 years. She is grateful for the loans she has received, since she started from nowhere and now she is somewhere. Annet is 60 years old and a member of the Semuti Development Group. In all her businesses, she works with her children, who will take over while she is away.

loans.use: Annet has planned to expand her hardware shop by buying cement, barbed wire, lime, and iron sheets for the shop.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 3 and 2 years old. Mwajuma sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 2 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es:
The association called “Pacajes” has been part of the family of “Pro-Mujer” for three years and they have successfully repaid seven loans. The association is part of the Juan Pablo II Center located in the Ferropetol Zone in El Alto City. They are 16 female members, which have proven to be very organized on their activities and responsible with their payments.

They are different businesses within the association for example; there is a meat market; one that makes and sells tents for cars; but the main activity is handcrafting metals. They make their art in shops located on their own homes, unfortunately they sell only on demand because they don’t have a place to show them to the public. This year they have their hopes set on showing their creations on the “Annual Craft and Micro-Entrepreneur Fair in La Paz” (FIPAZ), where they will be able to meet local and international customers.

They request a loan to be able to have capital to purchase new raw material and complete higher quality crafts. This would increase their income and they could improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación denominada “Pacajes” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya tres años cumpliendo con su séptimo ciclo de crédito. La mencionada asociación pertenece al centro focal de Juan Pablo II ubicada en la zona Ferropetrol de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 16 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de carne vacuna, confección y venta de carpas para automóviles y otros, pero la actividad principal es Hojalatería (artesanía en hojalata ), obras que la realizan es sus talleres ubicados en sus propias casas y los venden únicamente a pedido, ya que no cuentan con un lugar para exponerlos, Este año tienen la esperanza de poder exhibir sus trabajos en la Feria anual de Artesanía Y Microempresa de la Ciudad de La Paz (FIPAZ) donde podrían encontrar mayores contactos de venta, incluso a nivel internacional.

Por eso solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de reforzar su capital para realizar obras de mejor calidad, con esto mejorarían sus ingresos, con el unico de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.

loans.use:
They need a loan to support their capital, purchase materials and export their creations.

Necesitan mayores creditos para reforzar su capital , comprar materia prima y exportar sus obras.

loans.name: Chheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheam R. sells groceries from her house in Or Ambil Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. She can earn around $5 per day, which currently covers the family’s expenses. With expenses growing from day to day, she has to work hard to overcome local competition. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who can earn $3.50 per day to help to support the family’s expenses. Because her husband's motorcycle is old, he cannot attract many customers. He has noticed that lately his income has declined, as well.

R. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to replace the old one. The loan will allow her husband to attract more customers and thereby increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to replace the old one

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El Grupo San Valentín es un antiguo grupo cliente de Emprender, Ha sufrido en el transcurso del tiempo, diversas modificaciones en sus integrantes por diversas razones. La última conformación del grupo San Valentín, conformado por 4 personas, lleva con nosotros algo más de un año, demostrando mucha eficiencia en sus labores.

Desde sus inicios este grupo se ha caracterizado, porque sus integrantes tienen actividades parecidas o relacionadas entre sí, lo cual ha fortalecido el lazo de amistad que los ha unido en este grupo.

La jefe de grupo es la señora Julia L., que se dedica a la comercialización de lubricantes para automotores, labor que le permite ser ecónomicamente activa en la manutención de su hogar, quien junto a su marido atienden cariñosamente a sus hijos procurando que no les falte nada. Además administra con mucha eficiencia los desembolsos y pago de las cuotas de su grupo, por este motivo todos en el grupo San Valentín la consideran jefe de grupo, y la tratan con mucho respeto.

El señor Eugenio B. es cerrajero, fue fundador del grupo, pero por motivos personales decidió retirarse del grupo hace dos años, sin embargo, la oportunidad de ser beneficiado por el financiamiento de Kiva lo motivó a retornar al grupo en esta oprtunidad.

El Señor Antonio C., es mecánico, su trabajo relacionado a la reparación de automotores, en especial, dedicados al transporte público, lo relacionó con el grupo, y forma parte de este desde hace un año. Es un padre responsable y ama mucho su trabajo.

El señor Roberto C. es transportista, se dedica a la conducción de vehículo de transporte público, trabajo que realiza con mucho esmero, es un cliente tambien fundador del grupo y se destaca por su responsabilidad.

La relación del grupo es de amistad la señora julia, el señor Eugenio y el señor Antonio tienen sus negocios frente a frente y el señor Roberto, es muchas veces cliente de ellos.
texts.en:
The San Valentin Group is an old client of Emprender. Over time there have been changes in the group members for various reasons. The most recent group configuration of the San Valentin Group has existed for a bit over a year and they have proven their efficiency in their tasks.

From its beginnings this group has been formed by members with very similar activities or activities which are related. This has strengthened the links between the group members. The group leader is Mrs. Julia L., she sells automotive lubricants. Her job has allowed her to be an active collaborator in the family finances. Together with her husband they lovingly take care of their children to ensure they have all their needs met.

She also efficiently manages the microloan repayment for her group, which is why all members of the San Valentín group consider her the group leader and treat her with a lot of respect.

Mr. Eugenio B. is a locksmith and was the founder of the group. For personal reasons he decided to leave the group two years ago. However, the opportunity to benefit from Kiva´s financing motivated him to return to the group to seize this opportunity.

Mr. Antonio C. is a car mechanic and specializes in vehicles destined to public transport. He has been with the group for a year and is a responsible father who really loves his work.

Mr. Roberto C. is a bus driver and he puts a lot of care into his job. He is also a founding member of the group and stands out for his responsible attitude.

There is a friendly atmosphere within the group. Mrs.Julia, Mr.Eugenio and Mr.Antonio have their businesses facing each other in the same street and Mr.Roberto often utilizes their services.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investments

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is 34 years old. She is divorced, with three kids. She lives with her kids at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She works hard to support her children in school. Victoria has been selling bread at a bus stop for thirteen years. She obtains her supply from bakers at wholesale prices, and sells at retail prices for a profit. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth.  She believes that with the loan she will be able to purchase more loaves of bread and increase sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to save enough money to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more loaves of bread.

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en: Vesna I. ević, born in 1971, lives with her husband and two daughters in Gračanica, known as a very enterprising city. Her husband works on a poultry farm, a job that has given Vesna an idea to start her own business raising hens, as there is a good market for eggs. She is therefore requesting a loan of $750 for the purchase of hens. Vesna believes that her business will succeed, aided by her husband and his experience with poultry.

loans.use: To buy hens

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es:
Jackelin es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua. Jackelin es soltera y tiene 20 años, Jackelin estudia Construcción Civil en un instituto publico y vive con sus padres. Jackelin en su tiempo libre por las tardes vende cosméticos por catálogos de dos líneas diferentes, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y sus ventas en mayor parte son al crédito y cobra diariamente.

Jackelin necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos, colonias, desodorantes. Los sueños de Jackelin son mejorar su negocio, terminar su carrera y ser una profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Jackelin is a member of the "Ccori Ayllu" Communal Bank which means "Family of Gold" in Quechua. She is single and 20 years old. Jackelin studies civil construction at a public school and lives with her parents. In her free time in the afternoon she sells two different lines of cosmetics from catalogs. She offers her products to friends and family. The majority of her sales are on credit and she collects daily.

Jackelin needs a loan for 2,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes and deodorants. Her dreams are to improve her business, complete her education and to be a successful professional.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, perfumes and deodorants

loans.name: Esinat E.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Esinat M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, aged between 10 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because their parents died of HIV.

Esinat has been running a crops selling business since 1993. Her business is buying crops from farmers and selling them in town at higher prices. She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her daughter. Currently she earns about $180 from her business.

She is requesting a loan of $750 in order to purchase additional stocks of crops such as rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Esinat thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops such as rice, maize, and beans

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank, is 45 years old and married with three children, two in college and one still in high school. Gladys sells basic grocery items and spices in the Nazarena Market in the city of Ayacucho, working at her stand from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. each day, assisted by her children when they are not in school.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more eggs, milk, and sacks of sugar. She says that she has more clients when she offers more varied merchandise. Her goal is to continue to improve her business and buy a wider variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more eggs, milk and sacks of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun K. is a villager in Trapaing Lompeak village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Sak Sim, is a furniture maker who makes cabinets, tables, chairs, and so on. Mrs. Aun K. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school, while the younger is one year old.

Mr. Sak Sim's business is going well and he wants to expand it. So his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more equipment to make more furniture to sell. They are both shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more cabinetry equipment.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. is 43 years old, married, and lives at Obay, Polanco Zamboanga del Norte. She has 2 children and both are in school. A mother always dreams for a better future of her children so she works diligently to earn an income. She is a bookkeeper of their barangay and her husband is a mason.
 
Emma has been a member of  Paglaum MPC since May 17, 2006. She used her first loan to be a RTW dealer. She buys stock, and sells to her nearest neighbors. Her profit is very helpful for her family's daily needs, as well as school fees. Now, she requests a $325 loan because she wants to have additional capital for her to buy new stocks of RTW’s. She hopes to create a better and more comfortable life with the help of Paglaum and the profit she earns from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of RTW for sale

loans.name: Grecu's Group

texts.en:
Ostrovan R. is the leader of this group of people who want to all have their own business. R. before had borrowed a loan from MicroInvest and he repaid the money in full. This group is very united and all are very good friends between them. R. has shown MicroInvest the real correlatI. between these people. The main activity of this group is agriculture; all of them have a part of land near one another in their village, so the loan they borrowed is namely 4000 lei per each person of the group. With this money they want first of all to increase working capital and also to buy necessary seeds for vegetable growing. 

We want to thank Kiva lenders for helping this group of people.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn S., 32, and her husband , Mr. Savoeun Un, 36, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 12 years and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter is in grade two.

Sokhorn has been a silk weaver for nine years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Savoeun Un has been a construction worker for fifteen years. Sokhorn is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to build a bathroom for her family.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to build a bathroom

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband. Hala has been doing embroidery for six years. Hala requested a loan of 500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Hala is speciA. in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, Hala plans on improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Shomuhammad

texts.ru: Раджабов Шомухаммд житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года . женат , но детей не имеет.Живет с родителями и семьей брата. Семья очень большая. Клиенту приходится много работать для того, чтобы прокормить семью. Работает в сфере животноводства. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.А разводит он мелко рогатый скот. Разводит овец и коз. После откормки он продает их на рынке.
texts.en:
Shomuhammad R. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 23 years old, is married, but does not have children. He lives with his parents and his brother’s family. The family is very big. The client needs to work a lot in order to feed the family. He works in the livestock sphere. He plans to get credit in order to increase his livestock count. He raises small livestock. He raises sheep and goats. After fattening them he sells them at the market.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Graça Matilde

texts.pt:
Graça Matilde L. é natural de Maxixe na província de Inhambane, tem 46 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.
Graça concluiu o 4º ano em licenciatura na área de  PAGE pela universidade pedagógica.

Graça a 4 anos que é gestora de um negocio em regime temporário da que só faz quando volta do serviço, diz ela por que ainda não conseguiu alguém que possa confiar e o mesmo ainda é de pequena escala, futuramente ao ampliar comeste financiamento vai empregar alguém para exercer a tempo inteiro. Neste momento tem um rendimento por este negócio 4500,00mt semanal e consegue poupar algum.

Graça solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, já teve vários empréstimos no Socremo outra instituição micro financeira, com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o estoque da sua banca.
texts.en:
Graça Matilde L. was born in Maxixe, province of Inhambane, Mozambique. She is 46 years old, divorced, and the mother of five children, whom she works full-time to support. Graça has completed the fourth year of her teacher's training program, at the Pedagogical University of Mozambique. When she is not at her regular job, she runs a small general store from home. She hasn't found a trusty person to manage the business for her yet, plus the business still operates at a small scale, but with the help of credit, she hopes to be able to grow it and to hire a full-time employee. The store currently brings in 4500,00 mt a week, an amount which allows her to save some money regularly. This is Graça's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She has worked with other microfinance institutions, such as Socremo, in the past. She will use her current loan to buy more merchandise to sell at her general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell at her general store

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, etc. He is 58 years old and married with seven children. Two of his children are still in school. 
He wants to use this loan to buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, and milk etc. to expand his business. He believes that with increased working capital he will have the capacity to purchase more good quality groceries to serve his customers. He will raise more income to finance his children’s education and provide them with more opportunities in life than what he had. 
He belongs to the community group called Hosaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To restock grocery store

loans.name: Eupemia

texts.en:
Eupemia P. is from the village of Corales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Eupemia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Eupemia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Eupemia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eupemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eupemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Eupemia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Eupemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Convenient Group

texts.en: Varney is single and has a daughter about 2 years old. He’s been involved in the sale kerosene for about 3 years now. He sells around town and sometimes at his home. He said, “I attract my customers to buy by means of friendship and having good talks”. His goal is to increase the sale by drums, gallons, tins, etc. and he also hopes build his house from the sales or revenue generated.

loans.use: To buy kerosene for resale

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia B. is from the village of Magting, MamB., Camiguin. She is 51 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Celia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products including fruit in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Celia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ragub

texts.en:
Ragub was born in 1979. He is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Baku city.

This young man has been in his clothing sales business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more clothes to improve his clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian F. is from the village of Pan-ay,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Lilian is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn N. was born in 1980. She lives in Prey Chhoer Teal Village in Takeo Province. She sells baskets. Her husband, Mr. Minh Sokha, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows rice and vegetables. He is also a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from his home, he usually pays a lot of money for motor taxi transport to work. Thus, Mrs. Oeurn N. has requested a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work. This couple has four children, two of whom attend the local school. The others are too young to work or study. Her husband appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
47-year-old Rolinda P. is a rice farmer from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, in Mindanao. Her entire life has been spent on the farm. She said that tilling the farm and growing the rice plants are not hard subjects to learn.

Rolinda would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm by buying farming necessities to grow her harvest. She is hoping that she will be able to have a good return on investment from her CEVI loan.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 59, lives in Takeo province with her husband and three of her children. She has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about $3 in revenue each day. Her husband, Chan Nea, is a farmer who is able to earn $2 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chan Nea included. Heng S. is asking for a loan of $700 because her husband needs to purchase rice and take off the husks with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit.

loans.use: Sell rice

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda I.'s ambition in life is to be successful in her business. She currently engaged in hog raising. The pigs, which she raises for four months, are what constantly provide her family an income to buy an adequate supply of food and other basic needs. She has 12 children. Her eldest child is 36 years old and no longer lives with them. Now, she is doing the best she can to raise enough money to support her big family.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy feed and hog supplements to help grow her pigs bigger and bolder.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Twegate Nazili Judith Group

texts.en:
N. Judith is thirty-five years of age and married with one child schooling. She operates the business of pay phone and also selling air-time to the public. She is been in her business for over one year.

Judith is using the loan to purchase air-time for at least a big amount which was not the case previously. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to develop herself and grow her business too.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of air-time

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan A. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and peeled, dried cassava and is requesting a loan to stock beans and fish to sell. Juan is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock beans and fish to sell

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta. the 49-year-old wife of a commercial driver and mother of six children, sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demand for it is high. Since this is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits, Henrietta is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Dar West Group

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Protas Y., 25 years old and married with two daughters aged four years and 8 months.

Protas sells charcoal in the Tabata Mtemba area of Dar es Salaam. He has been in the "mkaa" ("charcoal" in Kiswahili) business for three years. He sells charcoal every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. making a monthly profit of about 100,000 Tanzanian shillings (approximately 75 USD).

This will be Protas' second loan from Tujijenge. The first he used to buy household items like cupboards and a radio with a CD player. He hopes to use this loan to increase his stock of charcoal.

In the photo, Protas is first on the right wearing a light blue shirt and is shown with the other members of the Dar West loan group. Five of the group members also sell charcoal, while the others run various businesses that include a cafe, a butcher shop, a tailoring shop, a clothing stand, a poultry farm, and a french-fry stand.

The members of Dar West are thankful for your support!

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime tiene como actividad el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para su familia, que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos y su esposa Sra. Ana quien tambien ayuda a su hogar vendiendo ropa por las tardes en el centro de la ciudad.n 

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, compra de llantas y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo.

El Sr. Jaime esta agradecido con Emprender y con Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Sr. Jaime provides urban transportation services by radio taxi. He works every day since this is the main source of income for his family, which consists of his wife and three children. His wife, Sra. Ana, helps with the household expenses by selling clothes during the afternoons in the central part of the city.

This loan will be used primarily to refurbish his vehicle. Jaime will purchase tires and make other minor repairs so that his vehicle will be in optimal condition for developing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & make repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Elena es soltera, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Elena se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en terrenos propios y alquilados, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Elena espera progresar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena, 60, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank, which is in Compañía. Elena is single and has three children. She farms vegetables on her own and on leased land. She sells her products to Ayacucho's wholesale food market. Elena needs a 900 sol loan to buy seed and natural fertilizer. Elena expects to progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. M. is forty years old, married, and has two children aged twenty and ten. Her husband is a driver and they hope to provide their children with a quality education. They also hope to build a beautiful house to live in some day. Monica's business is located at Makongeni, a busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

She has been selling cereals such as rice for five years to shopkeepers and individuals. She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Monica is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more cereals to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and supply her cereals to different parts of the country in the future. She is very patient, cheerful and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguitougou sont  des femmes mariées, ayant en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier pour l’assainissement. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers (alimentaires, habillements, artisanat etc.)
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont  à leur 9ème  prêt solidaire  après avoir remboursés les huit précédents.
 Elles comptent acheter, avec ce nouveau prêt,  20 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de pagnes brodés, deux  rouleaux de voiles, 10 couvres lits et 200kg de poissons frais qui seront transformés en poissons fumés. Parfois elles se ravitaillent en poisson fumé à Mopti pendant les périodes de soudure. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso, au grand marché et au marché Château de Ségou. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile, en ambulant et aux marchés de Médine et Château. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCA qui servira  dans le remboursement du prêt, à l’épargne et à l’achat de denrées de 1ère nécessité.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguitougou group are married women who have an average age of 41 years old, an average of three children and all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbors and relatives and also because they all belong to the same traditional women's sanitation association. This group of women are primarily trading a variety of articles (foods, clothes, crafts etc..). With a view to increasing their business they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, and they are on their ninth group loan, having repaid the eight previous loans. With this new loan they are planning on buying 20 pieces of "pagne-wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric), 15 sets of embroidered "pagnes", two rolls of netting, ten bedcovers and 200kg of fresh fish which will be transformed into smoked fish. Sometimes, during the lean season (in between harvests), they stock up on smoked fish in Mopti. They get their supplies at the large market in Burkina Faso and at the Château de Ségou market. They sell on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women, at home, walking around and at the markets in Médina and Château. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, as well as for savings and for the purchase of basic foods.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: La señora Maria José tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con nosotros, ya que se encuentra en una fecha de bastantes pedidos. La señora aduce que algo que le ha ayudado a mantener sus pagos en tiempo y forma, es la administración que ella le brinda a su negocio. Por lo que su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Para un futuro le gustaría mejorar las condiciones económicas de su vivienda. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de de calzado, ropa, pinturas, sabanas y adornos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria José has been working with us for a long time and has made several requests to date. She claims the discipline required to manage her business also helps her to keep her payments on time. Maria José sells general merchandise. In the future, she would like to improve her financial condition at home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, clothing, paintings, linens, and decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: God Power Group

texts.en:
Kuku W. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Power.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children who range from five months to eight years old.  She was only able to attend school through third grade due to the loss of her parents. For six years, Kuku has been selling frozen food such as spare ribs and chicken at the Old Road Joe Bar Market. She sells her frozen food in a friendly manner that keeps customers returning. 

Kuku started selling with 3,000 Liberian dollars as working capital and now has about 8,000 Liberian dollars as working capital. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more frozen chicken and spare ribs. Her goal is to grow her business to a larger size.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kuku is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chicken and spare ribs.

loans.name: 02 Hoang Hóa Group

texts.en:
"Hà P. Thị (111) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Hoàng Hóa Thanh Hóa. Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Hoàng Hóa (02 Hoàng Hóa).

Hà is married and has 2 young children. To making a living, Hà owns & operates a fishing business.  She earns her living by harvesting & selling wild-caught fish to the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a new loan of 4248000 VND which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Nghĩa (112) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Vân (113) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  T. Thị Thỏa (114) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Lê Thị Minh (115) is a 65 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà P. Thị (111) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoàng Hóa Thanh Hóa.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Hoàng Hóa (02 Hoàng Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hà đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Nghĩa (112) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Vân (113) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. Thị Thỏa (114) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Lê Thị Minh (115) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Henry K.

texts.en:
Henry is a thirty-year-old married gentleman with two children who are going to school.  He was introduced to Kadet by a friend whom he describes as someone whose life has been changed by Kadet loans. With this first loan he intends to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for planting. He also intends to buy an oxen to help with farm ploughing.

Apart from maize farming, Henry buys milk and sells at the nearby centre at a profit hence earning additional income. His future plan is to have his own dairy cows whose produce he will sell at the local centre and supply to big hotels in town. This will boost his income  and will enable his children to finish school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Víctor Alejandro

texts.es:
Víctor Alejandro F. G. tiene 52 años de edad  es casado y tiene una hija, Aina de 7 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes, en la provincia de Bolívar

Víctor es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios

Víctor es sargento primero de la comisión de transito de Guayas, y también tiene su propio negocio de viveres. Realiza las compras y las vendas en el cantón Bucay. Víctor solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio.

Por el momento, no encuentra desafíos mayores en la familia o el negocio
texts.en:
Víctor Alejandro F. G. is 52 years old and married; he has one daughter, Aina, who is 7 years old. They live in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. Víctor is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, located 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 15 group members, most of whome have their own small businesses. Víctor is a sergeant in the Guayas Transportation Commission, and also has his own grocery store. He buys and sells his products in Bucay Canton. He is requesting this loan to buy more grocery items. Víctor does not currently face any great challenges with his family or his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy more products for grocery store

loans.name: Mr. Nis Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 22 villagers from Ta Reap Doun Sar village in Kandal province. Mr. Nis M. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the other members. The members will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mr. Nis M. is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Vannara Yoeurn, is a fish seller at her local market. Presently, Mr. Nis M. has some problems because his fishing net and fishing boat are broken. To improve this situation, Mr. Nis M. is applying for a loan to buy a new fishing net and fix his fishing boat. He is a father of four children, two of whom attend the local public school, while the others are too small to work or study.
On the day of the loan disbursement, Mr. Nis M. was busy working. His wife, Mrs. Vannara Yoeurn, received the loan for him, and the photo above shows Mr. Nis M.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing net and fix his fishing boat

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannary N. is 40 years old and is the leader of this group  loan, having been selected by its four members, all located in Prey Phdau Tboung village in Takeo province. The members of this group loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Vannary N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  She also is a silk weaver who is able to earn a little income to support her family. She requests a loan to buy more silk and silk supplies to support her silk weaving business. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Ok, is a teacher in the local school where he receives a small salary to help support his family. The couple has one child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk and silk supplies

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
Doris tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa variada actividad que aprendió de su mama, además viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana en donde vende también ropa, también a fiestas patronales en donde se queda el tiempo que dure la fiesta, porque en estas ocasiones vende mas. Doris solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas.
Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en Quechua, Doris es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4, 2 años, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Doris has a stall in the "12 de Abril" market in the city of Ayacucho where she sells a variety of clothing, a trade she learned from her mother. In addition, she travels to the markets in the region 3 times each week where she sells clothing. She also sells at festivals, where she stays for the length of the festival, because on these occasions she sells more. Doris requests a loan of 1,050 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of pants and coats. Doris belongs to the communal bank "Ayllu" which means "Family" in Quechua. Doris is single and has 3 children aged 6, 4, and 2 years. Her main wish is that her children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pants and coats

loans.name: Gladys Narcisa

texts.es:
Gladys Narcisa O. F. tiene 33 años.  Es casada y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos de 14 a 4 anos. 

Gladys es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Gladys se dedica a trabajar en una cacaotera. 

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos y semillas y para sembrar independemente eventualmente. Su sueño es comprar terreno, apoyar a sus hijos y darles a sus estudios. 

No tiene tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Gladys Narcisa O. F. is 33 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. She has 5 children, ranging from 4 to 14 years old. Gladys is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, located three hours from Chillanes. It has a total of 19 members, most of whom are involved in growing corn and cacao [cocoa]. This is their first loan through the San José Cooperative. Gladys works on a cacao plantation. She is requesting the loan to plant corn and buy fertilizer and seeds, so that she can eventually become an independent producer. Her dream is to buy land, support her children and provide them with a university education. She has no free time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting corn

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy M.  is currently in the business of selling dried green vegetables such as okra, water Mellon and fish at the marke. She is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell.  Joy is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her family.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: San Rafaél Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Rafael D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, con la cantidad necesarias D. señoras dispuestas a progresar  decidierón a participar del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, son 17(diez y siete) mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras.
 Las mismas con  mucho entusiasmo se reunierón con el fín  D. formar un grupo solidario en donD. la responsabilidad era conjunta y  el trabajo D. equipo.
Ellas son independientes en sus labores como: vendedoras D. ropas,venta D. zapatos, venta D. comidas, tienen despensa, venta D. frutas y verduras etc.
La Sra. Ada Noelia se dedica a la venta D. perfumes, colonias, tiene buena clientela, gracias a la atención y a la variedad D. sus productos; tanto en fragancias, precios y calidad.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos abaratando el precio D. adquisición D. sus mercaderías mediante la compra al por mayor y, teniendo en cuenta la llegada D. la nueva temporada D. primaV., conseguir más variedad D. fragancias acordes a la estación para concretar esta idea solicita el prestamo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the San Rafael neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. Having the necessary number of women ready to move ahead, they decided to participate in the "Women Entrepreneurs' Committee" program. They are 17 (seventeen) humble and very hard-working women. The group met with great enthusiasm with the aim of forming a communal bank, where the responsibility is shared and the work is teamwork. They all have independent businesses, such as selling clothes, selling shoes, selling food, operating a neighborhood store, selling fruits and vegetables, etc. Ada Noelia's work is selling perfumes and colognes. She has a good clientele, thanks to her good service and the variety of her products in terms of price and quality as well as fragrance. She would like to increase her income by buying her merchandise wholesale and thus reducing the price she pays for it. Taking into account the arrival of the new [Southern Hemisphere] spring season, she will acquire a greater variety of fragrances suitable for the season. She is requesting the loan to carry out this plan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of perfumes and colognes wholesale

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino A. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old, married and has four grown children. For the last 10 years he has made a living by providing transportation services.  He earns about 3,500 PHP a month from his work.

In 2007, Avelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid six previous loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP,  to buy tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and other accessories

loans.name: Tundan - 2 Group

texts.en:
Analiza B. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga Mismais Occidental. She is 33 years old. Analiza is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan - 2.

Analiza is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a store selling fruit such as lanzones, marang, and bananas in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Analiza's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural products to sell

loans.name: El Almendrito Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Almendrito está conformado por cuatro féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas. Una de ellas es Mayra del Socorro E. Romero quien se dedica al comercio de verduras, actividad económica que aprendió de la señora Ángela Hernández, integrante del grupo quien le ayudo desinteresadamente.Ella a sus 39 años es soltera y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales los dos menores están a su cargo ellos están en la secundaria. E. con el crédito comprará ayote, quequisque, chiltoma, pipian etc. 

Las otras integrantes son Ángela del Socorro Hernández de 60 años quien en un inicio solamente vendía lo que cultivaba en unas pequeñas parcelas que ella alquilaba actualmente compra cosechas, ya que necesitaba más productos para comercializar en el mercado mayoreo, Managua; Patricia de los Ángeles C. vende frutas desde 1995, ella compra dichos productos en Masaya y las vende en Managua mientras Jenny del Rosario Valera hace 4 años aproximadamente tiene una pulpería la cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo.

Ellas han sido beneficiadas tanto por los servicios financieros y no financieros los cuales le ha sido de mucha ayuda, ya que por medio del crédito han podido invertir en sus negocios y con las capacitaciones han aprendió como administrarlo.
texts.en:
The “Almendrito” (Little Almond Tree) group has four female, hard working, enterprising, dedicated members.  

One of them is Mayra del Socorro E. Romero who is a vegetable merchant.  She learned this skill from Mrs. Ángela Hernández, another group member who unselfishly helped her.

She is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children.  The two youngest still depend on her.  They are in middle school. She will use the loan to buy chayote, peppers, “quequisque “(taro-like tuber), squash, etc.

The other group members are: 

Ángela del Socorro Hernández, 60. At the beginning she only sold what she grew on small plots that she rented.  Currently, she buys crops because she needed more products to sell at the Managua wholesale market.

Patricia de los Ángeles C. has sold fruit since 1995.  She buys the fruit in Masaya and sells it in Managua.

Jenny del Rosario Valera has had a grocery store for about four years that has gradually been growing.

They have all been benefitted both by financial and non-financial services that have been of great help to them because through the loans they have been able to invest in their businesses and the training sessions have taught them how to run them.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es: La señora Luz Idalia C. R. y su esposo preparan pasteles de todo tipo de evento como lo es fiestas infantiles, día de las madres, despedidas de soltera, bodas, quince años y otros eventos desde hace 15 años. El negocio es denominado Panadería Amistad al que desean que incrementen más su ventas para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para esto desea un préstamo para surtirlo.
texts.en: Mrs Luz Idalia C. R. and her husband bake cakes for all sorts of occasions such as children's birthdays, mother's day, bachelorette parties, weddings, girls' 15th birthday celebrations and other events.  They have been in this business for 15 years.  Their business is called “Panadería Amistad' ('Friendship Bakery').  They would like to increase their sales in order to offer their family a better standard of living.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to stock her business.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia, de 60 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, es separada de su esposo y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo. Todos los días de la semana Otilia, se dedica a la venta de helados, en la puerta del colegio que queda a 10 cuadras de su casa. Sus ventas las realizan con mucha amabilidad y carisma, como la refieren los alumnos. Es por ello que Otilia espera es su sitio habitual en las afueras del centro educativo en la entrada y salida de clases, para vender helados. Este trabajo le ha sido rentable, pese además la competencia que tiene, pero eso no la desanima, ella aún continua con la venta y trabaja con mucho esmero para salir adelante. Hace 30 años que trabaja, siendo su principal fuente de ingresos y que su trabajo sea más rentable, y para ello desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de otro tipo de helados, de la marca más reconocida en el mercado. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso es el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia my querida y respetada por lo que lidera este grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, va incrementar más helados para la temporada de verano que se acerca.
texts.en: 60 year old Otilia is a hardworking mother. She is separated from her husband and lives in her own house with her son. Every day of the week, Otilia sells ice cream at the entrance of the high school that is 10 blocks from her house. The students say that she does this work with great kindness and charisma. This is why Otilia waits in her habitual place outside the education center to sell her ice creams at the entrance and exit of the classes. This work has been profitable for her despite the competition, but the competition does not discourage her and she continues to work and sell her goods with a real commitment to succeeding. She has been doing this work for 30 years and it is her main source of income. She wants to grow her business and make it more profitable by selling other types of ice cream of the most recognized brand. This is her 16th loan from MFP and she assures us that this loan will be very beneficial to the development of her business. She is a loved and respected member of her community bank, and for these reasons she is the leader of the group. She is requesting this loan so that she can stock more ice cream for the coming summer season.

loans.use: To stock-up on ice cream.

loans.name: Albert Keror

texts.en:
Albert Keror L. is a 28-year-old farmer who grows vegetables and sells them to his customers at a profit. He is married to Sally Kipsoi, a housewife, and they have two children aged 2 and 1. Albert operates his farm in Kibigos Kapsowar in the town of Eldoret and he has been in this business for about six years.

Albert was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has no other history with any MFI. He is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD which he plans to use to lease a farm and buy seedlings.

Albert hopes to operate a large vegetable farm, whereby he would be able to supply vegetables to secondary schools, to the local market and, in the future, to the town of Eldoret.

loans.use: to lease a farm and buy seedlings

loans.name: Saidhamza

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in Saidhamza’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his six children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. Saidhamza works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates wheat, and potatoes and other vegetables depending on the season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their children. They would also like to open a small business some day but, until then, they will continue working in their fields. To do this, Saidhamza is requesting a loan of $2200 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and young cattle. Let’s support Saidhamza in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and young cattle.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 52, is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of US $2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Her husband is traditional doctor, earning an income of US  $4 per day. 

The family has to spend US $50 on food, $5 on electricity supply, and $16 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of US $400 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana Marina de 35 años de edad es casada, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 11 años como operador auxliar SISREC. Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de poner el piso a su casa, pues desea darles este regalo navideño  a sus hijas. Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado por la financiera, pues gracias a los creditos ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Marina is 35 years old and married.  She has worked for the City of Juigalpa for 11 years as an assistant SISREC operator.  She is requesting her fourth loan with the goal of putting down flooring in her home as she would like to provide this Christmas present to her daughters.  She says that she feels very grateful for the support offered to her by the finance company since, thanks to her loans, she has been able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To put down flooring

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with one child who has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbours and restaurant operators. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to increase the number of chicks to at least 1000 in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To  purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, 45, is a married mother of 8 children whose ages range between 7 and 20. Seven of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for the last twenty years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. She also owns two motorcycles that provide transport services to the locals.

Rita has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully repaid her third loan. She has requested this loan of 90,000Kes to expand her poultry project. The profits from this loan will assist her in meeting the basic needs of her family. Her biggest challenge has been the high cost of poultry feed. In future, she would like to practice poultry farming on a large scale and also venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Phoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeng S. is a widow living in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province.  She has three children --  one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending a local public school.
