Mrs. Phoeng S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  She is  also a Khmer cake maker.  At the present, she wants to start a new business but does not have the money.  To achieve this purpose, she is seeking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
For the past three years Mary M. has been smoking fish for sale at Takoradi. She is married to a commercial driver. The picture is showing Mary getting the fish ready  to be smoked. She has acquired junior high level of education. 

Mary wants to produce fish in a larger quantity and so is requesting a loan to expand her business.  She would like to see improvement in her business and so she will be reinvesting her profit.

loans.use: so is requesting for a loan to expand her business.

loans.name: Abd Al Ghene

texts.en:
Abd A. Ghene is a 68 year old married man living in Baalback with his wife and 4 children. 

Abd A. Ghene has baked Tannour bread (Khubz lubnani - also called Suri or Arabi) for 16 years. It is more widely known as pita bread and is baked stuck to a very hot pottery wall. He also works in selling oils as a second income. Abd A. Ghene is well known in his region especially for his tasty bread and good oil choice. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to increase his flour capitA. and to improve his oil business. Abd A. Ghene is an honest man. He is a hard worker and seeks secure & healthy living. He hopes to expand his business and open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary flour to improve his business.

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Eugenio, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es agricultor en pequeño, sembrando maíz y maicillo, vive con su familia, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, lo aprendió de sus padres. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas y preparación de terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar con anticipación lo necesario para la siembra.
El quiere aumentar su producción, tener una buena cosecha y generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Eugenio is 52 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with his family.  He has been in farming on a small scale for 12 years and grows corn and millet.  He learned his trade from his parents.

Currently, he is in need of a loan to buy farm supplies and prepare the land before the actual planting season arrives.

He wants to increase production and obtain a good harvest to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and prepare his land

loans.name: Poghos

texts.en:
Poghos L. lives in the village of Akhali Khulgamo, in Ninotsminda municipality. He is 55 years old and married. Poghos and his wife Memzar have one son who is married. Poghos has a five-year-old grandson and a four-year old granddaughter. 

The source of the income for the family is agriculture. They are busy with stock-breeding and farming. The family has nine milk cows and four calves. Poghos and Memzar produce cheese and sell it locally. The calves are grown and sold locally. The family also owns 1.25 ha of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold to the vegetable wholesalers. 

Poghos requested a loan to purchase additional calves. They will be raised and sold for a higher price. The gained profit will be reinvested in stock-breeding to expand the business and the family income.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 24 years old and single.  He runs a milk bar to earn a living.  He has been in the business for four years.  His hard work has helped him to sustain his business in a very competitive business environment.  Paul appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to save his money.   He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He needs 70,000 KES to buy a refrigerator and to renovate his business premise.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and to renovate his business premise

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 68  años de edad, casada.  Cuenta con casa  propia ubicada en una zona rural llamado caserío Cruceta a unos 25 kilómetros del distrito de Chiclayo.

Tomasa cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside, contando con 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola de las cuales 3 hectáreas son de mango y 2 de arroz, ella trabaja en sus tierras y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de apoyar en la economía de su familia. Ella cuenta con varios años de experiencia dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Tomasa está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de mango y arroz esto le permitirá   cultivo  garantizar una buena cosecha que le permitirá seguir creciendo y lograr una mejor calidad de vida.

Tomasa es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad, pues bien conocida por ser una persona tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 68 years old and married. She has her own home in a rural area called Cruceta, about 25 kilometers from the district of Chiclayo. 

Tomasa has farm land in the area where she lives. She has 5 hectares of land and uses 3 of them to grow mango and 2 of them to grow rice. Tomasa works the land and with the her earnings she helps support her family. She has been doing this kind of work for many years and as a result knows a great deal about crop management. 

Tomasa is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa $550 in order to buy fertilizer for her mango and rice crops. This will help guarantee a good crop and will allow her to continue growing and to achieve a better quality of life.  

Tomasa is a homebody and is known among the people in her community for being peaceful and hard-working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 37 years old, married and has one daughter. For the past 9 years, he has been operating Josken Fashions, selling clothes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Geoffrey has learned new skills for running his business.  He hopes to expand his business and start importing clothes from other countries. Geoffrey has requested a 40,000 KES loan to buy jeans, ladies' belts and ladies' suits.

loans.use: to buy jeans, ladies' belts and ladies' suits.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is 45 years old. She has five children who are ages 7-22 years old. They are all in school. Her husband is a driver.

Victoire is a tailor. She has been a tailor for the past 28 years and her business is going on well. She also sells fabrics known as "ibitenge". Usually people buy these fabrics, explain to her which design they would like to have, then she makes them. She is very experienced and knows how to make different styles.

This business has always enabled her to provide for her family's need with the help of her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics, expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her older son, age 11, goes to a secondary school while her younger son, age 4, is in kindergarten. She manages a hair salon at a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. She started her business in 2006 and has gained much experience. Now she has many regular customers. She is a kind woman who says, "I want to have my own apartment for my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction equipment to repair and expand her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment to repair her salon

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells maize and gari at Elmina. To prepare the gari, she gets raw fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas and then sends them to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process, she stir fries the gari in a pan on the fire. The gari is then left to cool and bagged into small bags for sale. 

Gari is a starchy food in Ghana that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak the gari mix with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines.

Families also eat gari for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that are mostly accompanied by gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can also be used to eat gari such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, and tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with gari depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces. Gari is a Ghanaian staple – a type of flour made from cassava. 

She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her spouse to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy cassava. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Kurusumu

texts.en:
Kurusumu is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Kurusumu has a beauty salon, which she has had for two years. She does farming as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Kurusumu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Kurusumu hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Kurusumu hopes to expand her business. Kurusumu is a member of BRAC small enterprise program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and married with two children in school.  He runs a laundry business to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business for five years and has employed one person.  Previously, he used to sell newspapers for a living.  

Through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He needs 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dry-cleaning machine.

loans.use: To buy a dry-cleaning machine

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.en:
Fatouma is a 42 year old single woman. She opened a grocery store in 1995. She has her customers' trust and loyalty.
Fatouma is a hard working woman. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her shop's merchandise. This is Fatouma's sixth cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. She has a good  paying back history.
Fatouma is working hard to get this loan to improve Ramadan and summer requests as soon as possible, and to get ready for the schools that are going to open in mid September, to meet the students' needs.
Fatouma hopes to expand her business and to do necessary decorations to her shop to compete with others.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Lusvard

texts.en: Lusvard works as a teacher at the local school.  She is also engaged in agriculture. Nonetheless her main income comes from agriculture. Lusvard grows different sorts of fruits and sells them at the city market. In season, fresh fruit is in big demand. So Lusvard would like to buy fruits in bulk to sell in the winter. Lusvard will increase her income and develop her business further. Additional income will help Lusvard to improve her family's living conditions. She lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for fruits.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONA”; Situado a 10 minutos del mismo poblado de Urubamba, perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.
La socia cristina; tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de el menor es de 18 años; La socia se dedica  a la agricultura, la socia se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de papa, maíz, y la socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz blanco y papa para sembrar y en el tractoreo para preparar la tierra, también comprara el abono para poner luego de sembrar. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y el pago al tractor.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera disciplinada el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Las Flores de Yanacona" (The Flowers of Yanacona), located 10 minutes from the town of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old and is married. She has two children, of whom the younger is 18. She works in agriculture. She plants and harvests potatoes and corn. Now she wants a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for white corn and potatoes to plant and in the tractor to prepare the land. She will also buy fertilizer to put down, then she will plant. She is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer and the payment for the tractor.

She is thankful for and appreciates the loan that is offered to her, and she promises to continue making her monthly payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer and make the tractor payment.

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire  qui vit avec ses deux parents, ses 4 frères et une soeur.Il gère une mercerie qui lui assure des revenus assez consistants pour aider sa famille à prendre en charge ses besoins quotidiens.Il sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter quatres caises de lait de beauté et trois caisses de parfum et d'autres produits divers.
texts.en:
Serigne is unmarried and lives with his parents, his four brothers and one sister. He runs a notion store which provides him with an income consistent enough  to help his family take care of its daily needs.

He's seeking a loan of XOF 300'000 in order to buy 4 boxes of beauty milk, 3 boxes of perfume, and other various products.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of beauty milk, 3 boxes of perfume, and other various products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer and drives a tricycle for transportating passengers. Ruth runs a fruit and vegetable business. She sells spices, red eggs, cabbage, and beans. She successfully sent her three children to school and is happy to share that they are now all professionals through the profits she earned from the business.

Ruth wants to expand her business by adding products to sell in her village. Even though her children support her financially, she wants to stand on her own because someday her children will have their own family. Ruth is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bitter gourd, cabbage, spices, eggs, and beans. She hopes for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy bitter gourd, cabbage, spices, eggs and beans.

loans.name: Diamond Grace Group

texts.en:
Iyus is 39 years old and married with one child. His child is two years old but lives in the village away from Jakarta with his extended family. 

Iyus and his wife have been producing and selling krupuk (Indonesian chips) for five years. His favorite part of the business is that he gets to work with his wife. The business has been going well and enables him to send money to the village where his child lives. 

He now wants to expand the business and open another kiosk to sell krupuk out of. His long-term goal for his business is to someday have his own krupuk factory. He hopes that with the income from his expanded business he and his wife can eventually save enough money to live together with their child. 

Some of the other members of the group will use their loans to buy and resell electronics on credit and for their rice and food stalls.

loans.use: to pay for more ingrediants and have enough capital to open another kiosk to sell krupuk (Indonesian chips)

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 10 years, she has been a farmer who produces corn to earn a living. Liza has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Liza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to maintain her corn production. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain her crop

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende compra la semilla e insumos para la asistencia de la siembra. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de cultivo por lo cual lo sembrara. El cuenta con la experiencia de varios años de edad en el cuido y manejo de esta plantación. El con la siembra de este cultivo pretende generar el máximo de ganancias con la explotación del terreno para así mejorar su nivel de vida y su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
65-year old Saúl is married and lives with his wife and their five children. His family is the focus of his life. With the loan he plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to spread on his crops.

Saúl owns land which is very suitable for growing crops. He has several years of experience looking after and managing his farm. He expects to get a good profit from the harvest and will use the money to improve the standard of living and wellbeing of his family.

This is Saúl’s first loan from FUDECOSUR and he has not had any others with state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided him with better credit terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow maize

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: El socio Giovanni;  el socio a incursionado en la artesanía, el junto a su conyugue han puesto un stand en el centro de la ciudad junto a su hermana y han invertido parte de sus ahorros en la compra de mercaderia y ahora le esta yendo muy bien, es por esta razon que el socio desea invertir el prestanmo en la compra de artesania, el socio desea comprar tejidos, ceramios, adornos, mantas. El socio sin dejar su anterior trabajo esta comprartiendo este nuevo proyecto en su vida, el socio desea crecer y ampliar su negocio segun las ventas. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tejidos para la venta en su stand.
texts.en: Giovanni has started to learn about handicrafts. Together with his spouse and his sister, he has set up a stand in the center of the city. He has invested some of his savings by purchasing goods, and now everything is going very well for him. For this reason, he wishes to invest the loan by purchasing handicrafts such as fabric, ceramics, ornaments, and blankets. Without sacrificing his previous work, Giovanni is sharing this new project in his life. He wishes to grow and increase his business depending on his sales. He is requesting the loan to invest by purchasing fabric to sell at his stand.

loans.use: to invest by purchasing fabric to sell at his stand.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 46-year-old married man and father of three children. He is known by his hard work in providing his family with a secure and healthy living.

Hassan owns a bakery specializing in Saj bread, a traditional Lebanese bread similar to pita bread. It’s a hard job for a man his age, but despite this he is still an ambitious man looking to expand and develop his business.   That’s why he decided to renovate his shop and buy a new modern and updated machine, in addition to making decorations to attract new customers.  These changes will be done through the requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Hassan is well-known in the region for his tasty specialty bread, in addition to his low prices and neat production. He aspires to expand his business with the help of the applied for loan, and he’s sure that it will improve his social and economic life.

loans.use: make improvements to his bakery

loans.name: Dut

texts.en: Dut is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is single. He runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 2 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more items like milk, biscuits, cigarettes and many others. He has no other source of income in addition to this business. His major challenges include competitors only. He says that he is appreciating Finance Sudan for considering low income earners by giving them loans to support their business. In 5 years time, he would like to hope for a better future, like having a good house.

loans.use: to purchase more items like milk, biscuits, cigarettes etc.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 35 years old and is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 17 years old. Ma. Teresa's husband is a farmer.

Ma. Teresa sells food items like rice cakes and banana cue (a snack made from bananas) to her community. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to buy flour, sticky rice, bananas and fertilizer for the farm. Ma. Teresa hopes to have a stable business. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sticky rice, bananas and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos ellos mayores  de edad, con ella vive una hija que aun es soltera. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo invierta en su negocio, el se dedica fabrican  todo tipo de figuras en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, ellos entregan sus productos a comerciantes de su localidad y de otras ciudades que llegan hasta su taller, nos cuenta que esta es una labor muy bonita porque sus obras son muy apreciadas en muchos lugares del país y fuera de él. Llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta linda labor y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arcilla y otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se financian sin tener que pagar tantos intereses.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” (For the Future of Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.  This place is very well known in the province and in the country because of its rich traditional culture.  In this place one can find a great variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following traditional methods.

We met Juana, 60, here.  She’s married and has six children who are all adults.  She lives with a daughter who is single.  Her husband’s a craftsman.

She is a very good mother and wife and to help her husband she’s taking out the loan to invest in his business.  He makes all sorts of clay or ceramic figurines.  He works every day since demand for his products is high.  They deliver their goods to local merchants and merchants from other cities that come to their workshop.  She tells us that this is a very beautiful work because the items are very much appreciated in many parts of the country and abroad.  They have been doing this beautiful work for more than 10 years and they have done very well.

This loan is to buy clay and other supplies to make the products.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because the loans are financed without having to pay so much interest.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy clay and other supplies.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme marié de 26 ans et sans enfant.  Il vit avec sa femme  dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la réparation des motos pendant des années. 
Dans le souci de diversifier ses activités il décide d’ajouter à cette réparation de motos, l’achat vente de pièces détachées. Avec une expérience de 2 années, il maîtrise cette activité de vente de pièces détachées. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il décide de collaborer avec le  programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Après avoir correctement remboursé son premier prêt il est à son deuxième qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pneus, 15 batteries, 3 trousseaux de clé,  30 chambres à air, 1 carton de piston, à Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes à une clientèle diverse et variées.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 61 500 FCFA. 
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Yaya is 26 years old and married. He has no children. He lives with his wife in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni.

He did not attend modern school, but rather began pursuing income-generating activities from a very young age. For years, he worked repairing motorcycles. Wanting to diversify his business, he decided that in addition to repairing motorcycles, he would buy and sell spare parts as well. With two years of experience, he has a thorough knowledge of the business of selling spare parts.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to become involved in Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. After having properly paid back his first loan, he is now asking for a second loan which he will use to buy 20 tires, 15 batteries, 3 sets of keys, 30 inner tubes, and 1 box of pistons. He will buy all of these supplies in Bamako. He sells his products to a wide array of customers.

With this loan, Yaya expects to earn monthly profits of 61,500 FCFA. With the profits, he plans to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Aluel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.en:
My name is Carlos F., I drive(taxi) people to different places in the city of Tegucigalpa. I have had my business for 3 years. My clients are numerous since I am positioned at a taxi stop. My business generates earnings that allows me to support my wife, my children and to cover home expenses. My goal is to repair my car to give better service to my customers, and with the earnings, buy another vehicle, to support my family and to finance the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase spare auto parts and tires.

Mi nombre es Carlos F., me dedico al negocio de transportar personas a diferentes lugares de la ciudad de tegucigalpa, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo estoy en un punto de taxis, mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder mantener a mi esposa y mis hijos y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar, mi meta es poder arreglar mi automovil para poder dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganacias comprarme otro vehiculo, mantener a mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos automotrices y llantas

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.She has had her business for 3 years and it allows  her to support her family.
Ulker is 38,an IDP Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Khirdalan settlement.  She is married and has 3 children.
Having borrowed $500 she bought an oven and manufactured products; flour, sugar and hazelnuts. 
She bakes our national sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura, shorkogal etc. 
She has had her business at home.
Her effort and enthusiasm have led her to achieve what she has today and each day she works harder to grow. 
Now Ulker needs a loan of $1000 to buy a big oven.
She is optimistic that her business will succeed as she will be able to supply different types of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a big oven

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif H. owns and operates a refrigerator and washing machine repair shop in the town of Devechi, which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Arif is looking for funding so that he can purchase modern tools to work with. He knows that if he can get the tools necessary to do the job properly, he will save much time and increase the efficiency of his business. This will allow him to complete more jobs per day which will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase new and more advanced tools

texts.en: Mrs. L. is a 44 year old widow.  She has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 14, of whom 3 are at school and one is married.  Besides her 1 ha of rice paddies and the chickens she raises, she also grows and sells ornamental trees - a kind of Bonzai tree.  She lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximateL. 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  Her financial status improved a lot after joining TYM.  Now she's able to send her children to school and build a better house.  Her profit nowadays is $125 per month.  She is requesting a loan to buy more young trees, which will be sold after they've grown.

loans.use: She wants to buy more small, young trees for her business

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn married in 1990 and has one daughter. She started her fishing business in 1995. Her husband grows rice.

Soeurn has already repaid two loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She plans to use this loan to repair her house. Soeurn is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 34-year-old mother of four and a resident of Tandika in Dar es Salaam. She has got a restaurant in Tandika area. She would like to expand her business into a bigger one ,buy more chairs and tables for her restaurant. Amina needs a loan of USD 300  to help her boost her business.

loans.use: expand her restaurant

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat has been selling a variety of groceries, such as cookies, candies, and pasta, for 15 years. She works at Spitamen food market. She is married and has 3 children.

She is an experienced salesperson, and quickly sells her goods. Today she has many repeat customers, who are very satisfied with the high quality of the goods that Saodat sells.

Saodat is requesting a loan from Kiva so she can purchase several new items to sell to attract new clients.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety of products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
In the private bus station that runs lines between San Román and Juliaca, Mrs. Elena has a small stand where she sells sweets. Due to the strategic location of her business, she also decided to sell cheeses to her neighbors and to the large number of travelers that pass through daily. Additionally, early each morning, Mrs. Elena prepares her hot vegetable teas, emolientes, and takes to the streets to sell her delicious and curative drinks. They are very popular among the people, especially on freezing cold mornings. These jobs allow her to bring her children higher educational opportunities. They support her in her work, and are very proud of her, and content with the results that she has earned. This exemplary mother’s wish is to have greater capital to invest in her business of buying and selling cheeses, the business that has rapidly become her most profitable. At this time Elena needs our support; let’s make her request possible.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

En el terminal terrestre privado de la empresa de transportes San Román- Juliaca, tiene su pequeño puesto de golosinas la señora Elena, por el lugar estratégico de su negocio también decidió vender quesos a sus vecinos y gran cantidad de viajeros que hay diariamente.Adicionalmente todas las madrugadas, doña Elena, después de preparar sus calientes emolientes, se lanza a la calle en su pequeña carretita para ofrecer sus deliciosas y curativas bebidas muy consumidas por la población, principalmente en las madrugadas frígidas.Estos oficios le están permitiendo brindar estudios superiores a sus cuatro hijos, quienes también la apoyan en su labor, sintiéndose muy orgullosa y contenta por los resultados que va obteniendo.El deseo de esta ejemplar madre es contar con mayor capital para invertirlos en su negocio de compra y venta de quesos, negocio que en poco tiempo se ha convertido en el más rentable.Elena en estos momentos requiere de nuestro apoyo, posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity and variety of cheeses to sell at her sales stand.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 48 years old. She has six children, the youngest of whom still lives with her. She was a founding member of the community bank “Amaqella”, and has remained an associate for 13 years. During those years, she has learned to be punctual, save, and help others. With the help of the community bank she has been able to buy a house, a car and see four of her children become professionals.

Juana’s business is selling construction materials such as bricks, wood, and glass. This business was started by her parents and she has been a part of it her entire life. In addition, Juana has a field in the country where she grows corn and vegetables to sell in the market.

Juana needs a loan of 3,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in preparing for the rainy season by buying roofing supplies and bricks.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Juana is saving to buy a second car that her husband would use as a taxi. Her dream is to have a nice house and see her youngest daughter become a professional.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in preparing for the rainy season by buying roofing supplies and bricks.

loans.name: Ocheng E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mastula N.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Mastula is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a taxi driver for work. She has 3 children who go to school. Each week, Mastula makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her children. Mastula has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more chicken feed and chicks and the loan was paid back on time.

Mastula is joined in her small group by Janet N., Ruth N., Mariam N., and Eva N.. Janet N. has a business in hardware sales and wants to increase stock in the hardware shop. Ruth N. is currently operating a business selling fresh foods and wants a loan to add to the business. Mariam N. operates a business selling fresh food and wants to expand business. Eva N. is currently in the business of selling hair braids and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To add to poultry farming business and expand it

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
My name is Khadija S.. I was married 25 years ago and reside with my family in Lahore, Pakistan, where I am the mother of seven: six boys and one girl. My husband is a turner and I sew pants, for which I receive $1 for every twelve pants I stitch. I would now like to get more orders for stitching and require a loan to buy some items for this purpose.

My group members are: Parween B., who sews clothes; Shaheen B., whose husband operates a snacks stall; Shahida, who knits wool items, and Balqees B., who will use her share of the loan to expand the family’s grocery store. All these women are hardworking entrepreneurs, and I want them to prosper in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase some items for the stitching business.

loans.name: Chieng Kem Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chieng K. is 45 and lives in Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is group leader of four women, and is a soup pot seller in the local village. She is single with two children; both of them are pot makers and make the pots their mother sells to make an income. This business is very profitable and can help them to improve their living conditions.

Last year, Mrs. Chieng K. had access to a loan to buy land for building a house. At that time, she did not have enough money to both buy the land and build the house. Through her business activity, she managed to save some money to build her house. Unfortunately, this is still not enough to finish the house, thus she asks for a new loan to finish it.

loans.use: To build her house.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a young professional who makes a living by sharing her knowledge of marketing at a college through lectures. She also offers beauty products where she works and to the public in general. Thanks to her effort and perseverance, this second job has become an important source of satisfaction for her beloved family. She hopes to increase her working capital to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Betty, es una joven profesional que se dedica a impartir sus conocimientos de mercadotecnia en un instituto superior y de manera paralela también oferta productos de belleza en su centro de trabajo y al público en general.Gracias a su empeño y constancia esta segunda ocupación se ha convertido en un proveedor importante de satisfacción para su amada familia. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para continuar su labor.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase the products that she offers

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean Y., 34, is married and resides with her four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. All the children are students. Sean and her husband have a business selling chickens in the local market, earning approximately seven dollars per day. The family's standard of living has improved since they started this business.

They want a loan to sell larger amounts of poultry. This will provide the family with more income and will allow the children to enroll in a higher class at school. (Mrs. Sean is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase more chicken.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. cooks rice to sell. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Angelina and her 5 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Mrs. Rita R. H. is 42 years old, married, has her own home an has a son that is in fifth grade . Her husband works as an independent legal advisor. She is a traveling salesperson who merchandises new clothes and cosmetics. She started this aactivity as an inheritance since her mother was also a traveling salesperson that sold clothes as well. She is the dedicated to this endeavor as another way to collaborate with the household expenses and as a form of self-employment. Her dream is to be able to have a shop and in this way be able to pass the business unto her children as an inheritance. The loans have helped her to get a little bit more of capital and move more merchandise. That's the reason that she hopes to count with our support for her proyects as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rita R. H., tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, habita en casa propia, tiene un hijo menor de edad que actualmente cursa el quinto grado de primaria, su esposo labora como asesor legal de forma independiente, la señora se dica al comercio de ropa nueva y cosmeticos de forma ambulante, actividad que da inicio como una herencia ya que la mama de ella era tambien comercnate de ropa de forma ambulante, dedicandose a esta actividad como una forma mas de colaborar con los gastos del hogar y una manera de autoempleo, teniendo como sueño instalar una tienda de esta manera tambien heredarle sus hijos dicho negocio, los creditos le han ayudado a tener un poco mas de capital y mover mas mercaderia razon por la cual espera contar con el apoyo nuestro en sus proyectos como comerciante.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Salohat

texts.ru:
Назарова Хайринисо 12 лет как занимается предпринимательской деятельности. Родилась она в 1964 году, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Она торгует исключительно женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных штанов из атласа и адраса с вышивкою и с тесьмой ручной работы. Это очень модно носить невестам. Она сама привозит свой товар с Коканда. Место ее деятельности оптовый рынок «Корвон» города Душанбе, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. 
Хайринисо хочет получить займ 2000 сомони и закупить новый товар.
texts.en:
A woman with a great deal of experience in entrepreneurial activities, Salohat was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. For eight years Salohat has sold wedding apparel. She carries unusually beautiful scarves and crystal and stone-encrusted stoles, as well as a variety of fabrics for traditional Muslim wedding dresses. She sells her wares in the Korvon wholesale marketplace, and purchases her goods in Tashkent and Samarkand. Salohat wishes to take out a loan in the amount of $600 (approximately 2000 Tajikistan somoni) for the purchase of fabric.


Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva. Julia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Julia viaja a la feria de Ceccelambras una vez por semana en donde compra cereales, quesos que luego los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Julia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida en donde vende repuestos para carro.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo. Julia sueña con educar a sus hijos y sean profesionales, Incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a partner in the "Agua Viva" Communal Bank. Julia is 43 years old and married, with four children. She buys cereal and cheese from the markets in Ceccelambras once each week and sells them in the city of Ayacucho. Julia and her husband have a store in a rented space on a busy avenue where they sell spare car parts. Julia needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she'll use to buy cord and wheat. Julia dreams of providing an education for her children so that they can become professionals, and of growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she'll use to buy corn and wheat.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs, bags, and second hand clothing. With Christmas and New Year's fast approaching, she expects a higher demand for her products. She hopes to purchase more items to sell during the holidays and is happy because her sales will increase.  She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 ($425) to purchase more sarongs, second hand shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, second hand bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 30 años, vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposo y sus  2 hijos. Desde muy joven le agradó el bordado y el arte que se pone para elaborar cada uno de los trabajos, es así que desde hace 8 años empezó a trabajar en mantas y  diversos tejidos que le permitieron apoyar en la canasta familiar.  Enedina se siente feliz de trabajar en lo que realmente le agrada y elaborar  mantas de todo tipo le apasiona, además, de la misma forma es muy gratificante porque la venta de cada manta cubre sus horas de trabajo y los materiales invertidos en cada una, aunque  estas horas sean largas noches sin dormir. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y no tiene problemas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita desea incrementar los materiales que requiere para seguir  trabajando.
texts.en:
Enedina is 30 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband and two children. She has enjoyed the art of embroidery since she was very young, which is how she got her start eight years ago, working on blankets and varied weaves, allowing her to contribute in supporting the household. Enedina is very happy to work at what she truly enjoys, and making all types of blankets is a joy, but it is also gratifying that the sale of each blanket covers her hours of work and the invested materials, even though the hours can stretch long into the night. This is her third loan with MFP and she has no problems with payments. With the requested money she wishes to invest in raw materials she needs to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Malaetele

texts.en: Malaetele A., 48, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in the Taro banana business. She sells to the village people and to the public one day per week. She is a new member, and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala.  SPBD loans are Malaetele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: Purchase Gromozone and sacks of fertilizer to maintain business growth

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Elena es casada, tiene 68 años y 4 hijos, Elena junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. ropa variada para todas las edades, pero en los últimos meses Elena no esta viajando porque L. operaron y tiene que descansar. Además Elena tiene 2 carros con el cual trabajan sus hijos.
Elena necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. chompas, faldas, mandiles, pantalones.
Elena sueña con tener una tienda D. ropa y vender al por mayor, mejorar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Community Bank Ollantay. Elena is married. She is 68 years old and has 4 children. She and her husband travel to different fairs of the area to sell clothes for all ages. However, some months ago she had surgery and hasn’t been able to work as she needed to rest. She also has 2 vehicles that are used by her children to work. Elena needs a 3000 soles loan, which she will use to purchase, jerseys, skirts, aprons and pants. Elena’s dream is to own a clothes’ shop and sell wholesale products. She also wants get better to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase, jerseys, skirts, aprons and pants.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo M. vive en Cantón Tierra Colorada, en el departamento de la paz junto a su esposa e hijos. Leonardo es un hombre trabajador que ha logrado montar su propio negocio, viendo las necesidades en los habitantes del cantón, Leonardo se anima a poner un molino en su casa luego de mucho esfuerzo y con una entusiasmo de superación expande su negocio montando otro molino pero en el centro de su pueblo, ahora Leonardo solicita un crédito para poder comprar un motor eléctrico para que su molino sea más eficiente y así poder atender una mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Leonardo M. lives in Tierra Colorada, in the department of La Paz with his wife and children. Leonardo is a hard-working man who has managed to open his own business, selling staple goods to the inhabitants of the district. Leonardo decided to open a mill in his home. After a great deal of effort and with enthusiasm to overcome all obstacles, he expanded his business and opened another mill. This second mill is located in the centre of his village. Now, Leonardo is asking for a loan to buy an electric motor so that his mill can work more efficiently so that he can serve a greater number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric motor for his mill

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. sells medicine. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of $825 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is 49 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a teacher. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. Mercy sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Bancomunal Las Palmeras.
Ana es conviviente tiene 55 años, cuatro hijos todos mayores que trabajan y estudian. 
Desde el año pasado Ana  enfermo de hernia  y tuvo que dejar su negocio de venta de menús y se dedico a la venta de productos por catálogos. 
Ana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza.
Desde que esta en Finca, le ha ayudado bastante, aprendió a organizar el dinero ha no gastarse todo el dinero y a juntar de las ganancias para los prestamos que saca en Finca. 
El sueño de Ana es arreglar su casa para  poner una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Las Palmeras” Community Bank. Ana is married, 55 years old, has 4 grown children who all work and study. Last year Ana was ill because of a hernia and she had to abandon her business selling meals and she switched to selling products via catalog. Ana needs a loan for 800 soles to buy beauty products. Since she has been with Finca, Finca has helped her a lot. She learned to organize the money and not spend it all and along with the earning for the loans that she gets from Finca. Ana dreams of improving her home in order to open a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions to make a living. Margaret is requesting a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more provisions to sell

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio C. M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Yolanda Chambi y sus cinco hijos.
Serapio es obrero, trabajando actualmente en alcantarillado publico, dependiente de la municipalidad de esta ciudad y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención que ayudara a la estabilización de su vivienda que se encuentra en pendiente.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Serapio C. M. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of the city of La Paz with his wife Yolanda Chambi and their five children. Serapio is a laborer, currently working in the public sewer system as an employee of the municipality of this city and his wife is a homemaker. The loan requested is for the construction of a retaining wall that will help to stabilize their home which is located on a slope. This is the fifth time that he has applied for a loan and the socio-economic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably to be able to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: David

texts.en: David M. runs a drugstore in his community. His store is by the roadside. He buys his medicines from Kumasi. David is 52 years old, married and has eleven children: six sons and five daughters. According to him, some of the children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. David has been in business for over 27 years and wants a loan to procure medicines in bulk to increase his stock. David is hoping to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 48 years old. Thelma is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Thelma raises pigs for sale. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 130,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group 2

texts.en:
Marcia M. D., pictured in the middle, is the coordinator of her five-member group. She resides in Carlo Alvares, a small town in the sector of Villa Mella, part of Santo Domingo Norte. Marcia is a single mother and lives with her two sons. The youngest is 16, and is a senior in high school and wants to study electronics. The eldest, 18, is a sophomore in college who wants to study informational engineering and is learning Japanese. Marcia has had six years of experience working as a massage therapist, going home to home.

With this loan she plans to buy two massage machines that would help her avoid unnecessary strain on her hands, so she can have more sessions per day. She would also invest in massage lotions and ointments to sell which boost her income. Through Esperanza, Marcia plans to take marketing courses in order to become a better businesswoman.

Through the additional income from her business as a result of this loan, Marcia hopes to be able to pay for her son's college without it being such a huge burden on her household. She also hopes to begin to save part of her income so her eldest son can study abroad in Japan in a year or two. One of her dreams is to open her own aesthetic center, where she would have others work for her, and only attend lifelong customers, while she manages the business.

Marcia will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: Massage machines, massage ointments and lotions

loans.name: Rult

texts.en:
Rult is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 33, married and the mother of three children. Her children are 13, 4 and 2 years old. 

Three years ago, Rult started her own shop business, selling commodities like sugar, rice and cooking oil. She works 11 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 92,000 Tanzania Shillings (about $70).

This is Rult’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities like soda, sugar and cooking oil. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rult hopes to make repairs, pay school fees, get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Peace Group (2)

texts.en: Ruth stopped her schooling at 3rd grade due to her parents' inability to help her through. She’s now 33 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her biggest challenge is financial shortfall. She’s dreaming of helping her children complete their education as well as giving them good medical attention.

loans.use: buying a bag of sugar, rice, etc

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 75 year old father to four, grandfather to 42 and great grandfather to five. He has been doing carpentry business for the last thirty five years. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add stock of timber (raw materials). He describes himself as social, friendly and determined.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber

loans.name: Siri

texts.en: Siri M. is currently in the business of selling fish both fresh and smoked ones and is requesting a loan to open up store for keeping smoked fish for strategy to sell.  Siri is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up store for keeping smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en: Nelita D. R. is from Pagadian City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Nelita owns and operates a clothing business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok A. is the group leader of five members who all live in Tboung Damrei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Teang Hoy, is a security guard. Now Mrs. Sok A. is applying for a loan to buy household assets for her family. She is 40 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

Three members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy household assets for her family.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. manages a rice farming business. She owns a 1-hectare rice field in Norala, South Cotabato.  She sustains her family through the income she receives from her farm.  She has four children; her eldest is 29 years old.

She is now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in the amount of 15,000 PHP.  It will be very helpful to finance her business with a low interest rate. She will be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
According to her children, Gina is a loving and a caring mother. Their family resides in the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, a rural area. She is married to Mr. Felix C. and they are blessed with two children named Althea and Elaisa.

Gina is engaged in vegetable vending in their village and sells house to house using her borrowed bicycle. According to her she usually earns Php 200 a day from her business, which is very beneficial to her family. Gina also shared that her vegetables sell immediately because village people really love eating such food.

Gina’s desire to purchase more vegetables motivated her to borrow Php 9,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes and prays that lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: H. Alice est née le 8 Juillet 1972 à Brazzaville au Congo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Alice est mariée à SINGBO Médard un infirmier. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C’est depuis 8 ans que Alice vit au quartier Sainte Anne à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Alice a été à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Après avoir arrêté les études, Alice a  appris la couture. Alice exerce ce métier depuis 17 ans. Alice vend également des produits de beauté et des tissus dans son atelier à Attakè à Porto-Novo. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo, que Alice s’approvisionne. Alice est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir davantage son activité que Alice sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Alice was born on the 8th of July, 1972 in Brazzaville in the Congo, the country next to Benin. Alice is married to Singbo Médard, a nurse. The couple has three children, all of whom are attending school. For the past 8 years, Alice has lived in the neighborhood of Sainte Anne in Porto-Novo, the government capital of Benin, with her children and husband. Together the couple pays for the family's expenses. Alice attended school just through secondary school. After finishing her studies, Alice studied dress/ clothes making. Alice has been in this business for 17 years. Alice sells beauty products and fabrics from her store in Attakè in Porto-Novo. Alice supplies herself in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in the market of Ouando in Porto-Novo. Alice is an old client of ALIDé and she fully repaid the two previous loans she obtained from ALIDé. In order to grow the funds for her business, and grow her business, Alice is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products (body cream, bath soaps, lip cream, moisturizer, perfumes, etc.)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a businesswoman who trades in Dumas (a brand name) clothes, linen and lace materials. She sells her goods mainly on credit to her loyal customers through hawking - that is, she uses a personal selling method; this, she said, makes her goods move very fast. She also sells fried yam with hot pepper to supplement her clothing and materials business.

Juliana is 35 years old and is a married mother with four children. All her children are in school. She is supportive of her family through the proceeds she makes from her business.

Juliana has fourteen years selling experience but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive her business and make a profit that is more viable so as to remain in business. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials, and yam, vegetables, etc., in bulk to increase her inventory.

It is Juliana’s desire to save more to give her children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Jose Dejesus

texts.es:
El  Sr. Jose Dejesus S.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Centro, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Gladys Graciela Armoa de S. con 36 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 4 hijos todos en  edad escolar.
Posee una Clínica Dental en el centro de la ciudad, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales El  señor es muy trabajador y muy conocido en esta zona. 
Actualmente  está  construyendo  un salón de material en su propia casa para  mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Dejesus S. is from the city of San Estanislao of the Central Neighborhood. He is 48 years old and married to Mrs. Glays Graciela Armoa de S. who is 36 years old. They have four children who are all in school. He has a Dental Clinic downtown with an established clientele, good income, and good commercial and personal references. He is very hardworking and very well-known in this area. He is currently building a storage room in his own house to improve his care for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y a sus dos hermanos menores de edad en la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su madre es separada y debido a las constantes necesidades por las que atraviesa su familia tuvo que empezar un negocio de venta de cerveza con la finalidad de colaborar en la economía del hogar. Ella vende cerveza en su domicilio a sus vecinos y clientes. Los dias en que su producto tiene mayor acogida son los fines de semana.

Gabriela desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de más cerveza, ya que este producto es muy consumido por sus vecinos en la época de verano, durante estos meses, la región Piura presenta elevadas temperaturas. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven juy responsable y trabajadora. Su más grande anhelo es llegar a convertirse en una distribuidora de cerveza.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 28 years old, single, and lives with her mother and her 2 minor siblings in the city of Piura, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Her mother is separated, and in order to meet her family's needs she had to start a business selling beer in order to contribute to the economic resources of the household. She sells beer from her home to her neighbors and customers. Her products are most in demand during the weekends. Gabriela wishes to expand her business with the sale of more beer. This product is most heavily consumed by her neighbors during the summer season; during these months (Dec. - March) the Piura region has very high temperatures. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the first time from EDPYME ALTERNATIVA for 1,500 Peruvian soles. Gabriela is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. Her greatest dream is to become a beer distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beer to expand her business during the summer season

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N. is 50 years old. She is duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs. Her husband, Mr. Run Song, is a farmer who owns 3-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family living. This couple has seven children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory, while the others are enrolled in local public school. This family lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. In this farming condition, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sam N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, rice seed, and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel to support their rice field to increase rice yield. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide, rice seed, and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel

loans.name: Gwenotwom B Achomo Christine Group

texts.en:
Christine A. is thirty years old, a single lady with two children who are in school. She owns a grocery business and she has been dealing in this business for over five years.

She is using the loan to purchase tomatoes for sale. At least the loan is increasing her capital as well as the stock of her business. She is an active business woman whose dream is to obtain poultry.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Felicidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Felicidad, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 25 socias. Las socias son D. la Asociación Covadonga.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. emoliente, comidas, abarrotes en general, condimentos, pollos, verduras, animales menores, mercería, bebidas y brindan servicios D. carpintería y cerrajería.

Como es el caso D. la señora Julia que es presidenta por tercera vez en su Banco Comunal, Julia es casada, tiene 59 años y 4 hijos que viven con ella, Julia junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. carpintería, sus productos los venD. en la feria dominical D. San Juan, Además Julia venD. comida en el mercado D. su barrio. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara madera.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 8,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, verduras, carnes, frutas, madera, leña, bebidas y animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Felicidad (Happiness) communal bank has 25 members and is in its fourth loan cycle; the members are all from Covadonga. The members are engaged in a variety of commercial activities like: herbal tea sales, grocery sales, spice sales, the sale of chickens, vegetables, small farm animals, general merchandise, beverages; some are carpenters and others are locksmiths. A typical case is Julia. She is president of the communal bank for the third time. Julia is married, 59 years old, and has 4 children that live with her. Together with her husband, she has a carpentry shop. She sells her products in San Juan’s Sunday market. In addition, Julia sells food in her neighborhood market. She will use the loan to buy lumber. The members need loans in various amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, totaling 8100 soles for the communal bank as a whole. The loans will be used to buy rice, vegetables, meats, fruits, lumber, firewood, beverages and small animals. The members’ dreams are to enlarge their businesses, that their children finish their schooling and to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es: La Sra. María  se dedica a la elaboración D. masas como Pan  pasteles tortas y variedad D. masitas, actividad con la que sustenta su hogar que esta conformado por tres integrantes el esposo y su hija la misma que  es niña especial ya que nació con retraso mental,  cuenta que fue difícil  la situación D. su hijita para ella y para su esposo ya que tiene que brindarle mas paciencia y amor y apoyarle toda la vida, pero la Sra. María es buena y muy trabajadora siempre pensando en mejorar la calidad D. su vida y brindar mejores oportunidades a su hijita  por lo que se decidió otorgarle la tasa preferencial, Con el dinero del credito comprara insumos po mayor para la elaboracion D. sus riquisimos productos, ella es muy conocida en el lugar por elaborar productos D. buena calidad y riquisimos tiene muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos para fiestas D. cumpleaños, ella esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
María makes baked goods like breads, cakes, and a variety of pastries. With her income from this activity she is able to maintain her household, which includes her husband and her daughter. Her daughter is a special little girl who was born with some mental retardation. María says this situation was hard for her and her husband, since they have to proviD. lots of patience and love and will have to take care of their daughter for the rest of their lives, but María is a good, hardworking person who's always looking to improve her quality of life and offer better opportunities to her little girl, which is why she was offered a preferential loan. She will use the money to buy supplies at wholesale for creating her delicious goods. She is well known locally for her delicious, high-quality baked goods and has a lot of clients who order from her for birthday parties. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they're placing in her by offering her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad M. is 26 years old, single, and currently living with his mother in Ramallah. Ahmad has been working as a butcher in his own meat store since the year 2000. With this loan, he would like to buy freezers for his meat store in order to keep the meat fresh. His future goal is to open a store in downtown Ramallah in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy freezers for his meat store

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Almost of Cambodian’s people have long been involved in farming businesses. Mrs. S. is the one of these people. She has been farming since she was single. She learned the skill of planting crops from her grandparents. 

At 40 years of age, she is blessed with six children. Half of them are now married and live independently, while the remaining three are single and work at various jobs. She is married to Kom Thon, age 43, who assists with her in the farming business. S. will be using this loan to purchase farm supplies, including fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds, to improve her crop yield. (Mrs. S.'s husband is in the photo here.)

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Domincah

texts.en:
63-year-old Domincah is a widow. She is a hardworking dairy farmer from Central Kenya in Murang'a town. She has been farming for the last 30 years with only one employee. Her main product is milk, which she sells to Kenya's Brookside company. She is also practicing small-scale cash crop farming and earns income from the sale of tea to the local market. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will reduce her dependency on cash crop farming which also has unstable market prices. She intends to improve on her dairy farming and is hoping that the market prices in the milk industry will stabilize.

She says that "there is hope for future development through Juhudi Kilimo micro-leasing projects."

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma A., vive con su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos que son adultos y todos habitan en un barrio de la capital,  su pareja trabaja como gestor de compras y apoya con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, así mismo todos sus hijos se responsabilizan de gastos en los que se incurre mensualmente en el hogar.

Ella se dedica desde hace 33 años a la venta de ropa, empezando su negocio con préstamos, y apoyo económico de su pareja, la casa donde moran actualmente necesita de unas reparaciones que le permitan un mejor habita, sobre todo porque estamos en las temporadas de invierno y las aguas amenazan todos los días con la inseguridad, incomodidad para todos los miembros de la familia, es por esta razón que solicitan el préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto. Ha sido gracias al apoyo de kiva que ha logrado la edificación de su hogar y agradece que se le ayude ha relizar la culminación a las reparaciones de su humilde morada, tras esto la satisfacción de los padres de familia de ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de un mejor porvenir a sus vidas.
texts.en:
Vilma A. lives with her life partner and their four adult children in one of the capital’s neighborhoods. Her partner works as a purchasing agent and contributes to household income; all the children also contribute to the household’s monthly expenses. For the last 33 years Vilma has sold clothes. She started her business with loans and financial help from her partner. The house they currently inhabit needs some repairs so that they may live a bit more comfortably especially because winter is here and every day the rains threaten their security and create discomfort for the whole family. For this reason she is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies for this project.
