It has been thanks to Kiva that she has managed to build her house and she is grateful for whatever help she can get now to make improvements to her humble abode because this provides her with much satisfaction as a parent for she knows that she is providing her children with the possibility of a better future for their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repairs.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam S. is 44 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeung Cheng, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Nam S. is also a pig breeder and a silk weaver at home who can earn a small income to help care for her family. In order to support her pig breeding and silk weaving businesses, Mrs. Nam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food and also to buy more silk for weaving. This couple has four children: one is a silk weaver, two are attending the local school, and the youngest one is 3 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S. is 41 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its eleven members. They are  located in Trapeang Kralanh village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different needs.

Mrs. Chea S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Ly Chin, is a construction worker. They are able to earn a enough income to support their family's lifestyle. In order to increase their income and improve the family living, Mrs. Chea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

This couple has five children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and three are attending the local school. The youngest child is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of material (sand, cement, rods)

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members who live in Preak Ta Hang village, Kandal province. Mrs. Phal H., aged 50, is the group leader who has been selected by the members. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support her business.
Mrs. Phal H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In addition to farming, she is also a pig breeder at home. In order to support her pig breeding business, she will use her loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Bunna Nov, is a construction worker. With their jobs, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple has five children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a teacher, one works in a casino club, while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for his stall

loans.name: Lorgia Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lorgia Lourdes tiene 36 años de edad.es una mujer casada y vive con su hijo de 2 años de edad.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues siempre se preocupa por proporcionar lo ingresos necesarios. Ella se dedica a una pulpería hace mas 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, empezó a vender golosinas a los niños que pasaban de la escuela por lo que ha luchado mucho para obtener este medio de vida. Este financiamiento es destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y otros productos.
texts.en:
Lorgia Lourdes, 36, is married and lives with her two year old son. This isn’t her first loan request for she is always watchful to provide the necessary income. She has had a grocery store for over 10 years. She started out selling sweets to children on their way to and from school. She has struggled much to secure this means of support. The funds will be used to buy stock items for the store like: sweets, natural beverages, bread and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.en: Valeriano V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 50 years old. Valeriano is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Valeriano plants and harvests rice for sale. Valeriano has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per crop. In managing the business, Valeriano has experienced many difficulties, especially when there is a typhoon, but it did not hinder him to succeed because he wants to give his family a better life. In 2010, Valeriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Valeriano is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Valeriano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector T. is from the village of Centro 2. He is 41 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Hector owns and operates a manufacturing business, making furniture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Hector has been engaged in his business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hector joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hector has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Hector is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Hector from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha,  es una mujer trabajadora de 46 años, que vive con Andrés de 60 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos menores; a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani. Desde niña se dedica al noble oficio de la agricultura, ya que depende mucho de su trabajo que la tierra de frutos para poder alimentar a la población. Hace 20 años que; gracias a su esfuerzo y ahorro pudo adquirir terrenos de cultivo en los cuales comenzó a sembrar café, plátano y palta, los que después de brindarle el cuidado necesario los comercializa a sus clientes que visitan en su localidad. Sin embargo la siembra de palta le da mayor ingreso a Bertha, ya que es la única en su localidad que siembra ese producto y los comercializa en grandes cantidades a los comercializadores de todo el país. La actividad que más le gusta a ella es rozar (quemar los terrenos de cultivo, para sembrar unos nuevos), ya que con ello vendrán nuevas cosechas. Más adelante está planeando abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles que mucha falta hace en su comunidad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está muy entusiasta con los resultados obtenidos, ya que con su apoyo y capacitación podrá lograr sus objetivos. Bertha, tiene pensado invertir con el crédito, en contratar operarios, que le ayuden a limpiar la maleza de sus plantaciones de café, que dentro de 3 meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 46, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with Andrés, age 60, and they have six minor children.  She is raising the children in her own house, which is in the indigenous community of Pumpuriani.

Since she was a girl she has been working in the noble agricultural trade.  Being able to feed the population is very dependent upon her work and the productivity of the land.  Twenty years ago, thanks to her effort and her savings, she was able to get land for crops.  She started growing coffee, bananas, and avocados.  After giving them the necessary care she sold them to her customers that visit her.

However, the avocado crop gives Bertha the greatest income.  She is the only one in her area that grows this crop.  She sells them in great quantities to merchants throughout the country.

What she likes the best is burning her fields after the harvest. (This removes the old growth to make way for new plantings.)  That way there will be new harvests.  Later, she is planning to open a small, much needed grocery store in her community.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is very enthusiastic about the results she has received.  With the support and the trainings she will be able to achieve her objectives.  Bertha plans to use the loan to hire workers to help her clear the weeds from her coffee crops.  The coffee will be harvested within three months.

loans.use: Hire workers to help clear the weeds

loans.name: Suleimen

texts.en:
Suleimen H. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. His four children, ranging in age from 7 to 15 years old, all attend local school while his wife, who is disabled, stays at home with their youngest child.

Suleimen operates a transportation service business between Bayan-Ulgiy and the neighbouring province of Hovd. He has been engaged in this business since 2006 and has gained much experience as a driver. He has been so successful in his business that he was able to buy a new mini bus for himself. Moreover, his earnings have enabled him to rebuild his house.  He plans on expanding his transportation business in order to further improve his family’s quality of life and to stabilize his earnings.

Suleimen is a very gentle, optimistic and open minded man and is requesting a 330,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts in order to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts

loans.name: Luz Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luz Karina; tiene 27 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende gaseosas y cervezas, ella atiende desde las 6:00 p.m hasta las 12:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”. The bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.


The member is Mrs. Luz Karina. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage and has 2 children. The member alternates her activities between her daily activities and the bar business. She sells soft drinks and beer. She serves from 6:00 p.m until 12:00 p.m. She wants to enlarge the business and is asking for the loan to buy soft drinks and beer wholesale.   

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy soft drinks and beer wholesale.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two room brick house with her family in the area named Anwerabad. She came here many years ago with her family. 

To financially assist her husband, she weaves carpets. She is very good in her art and her carpets sell for a very good price. Besides doing her business, she manages her household work very well. She completes a carpet in a three month time period and earns a very good price which allows her to manage the financial expenses without any difficulty.  

She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a tandoor (a kind of wood burning oven which is made with mud and used to make breads). The other son works in a motor cycle repair shop for a low income. Her daughter is very young and she is studying in a 5th level class. 

Her husband is also involved in the bread making business like his son. His tandoor is located in the market and his business makes him a good income every month. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy flour and firewood in bulk quantities that will enable him to make more bread to sell. She is hopeful that by investing loan money in his business, her husband will be able to improve his business condition and make more income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client and has maintained a good credit record in each of her loan years.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood for a bread making business

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “In God We Trust” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Alpha K.. Alpha was born in the village of Sanda Gbanti Kamaranka, near Makeni about forty-two years ago. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending schools.

Alpha sells used bags. He has had twenty-five years of experience in doing this business. He is requesting for this loan in order to buy more second-hand bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy more second-hand bags to add to his business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel I., 32, is from Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Liezel owns and operates a motor transportation services business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Liezel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better services. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better services.

loans.name: Casiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Casiana; ella tiene 62 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros productos, la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual se siente muy feliz ya que le brinda mucho tipo de satisfacciones ya que también es una forma de distracción para ella, y mediante este negocio la socia aun ayuda a sus hijos cuando lo necesitan. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Casiana belongs to the Mama Simona Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Poroy district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  She is 62 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with working in her business, a grocery store.  

She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, and milk, among other products.  She has had this business for years.  She is very happy because it satisfies her in many ways.  It is also entertaining for her.  Through this business she can still help her children when they need it.

She is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business.  That way she will be able to offer her customers more variety.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business in order to have a greater variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng N., 58, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

N. and her husband produce traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of US $2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $63 on food and $45 on the other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the family farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to expand the farming business

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 30 years old, married and has 2 children aged 3 and 5. Her husband is a businessman and Francoise owns a small store selling a variety of grocery items. She employs 2 people and is open from 6am until 10pm everyday.  

Francoise will use her loan to purchase more grocery products to sell and to buy a new place of business. She will use the profits she makes to first buy some land and then to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more products and buy a new store

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen S., 31, resides with his family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. raises chickens to sell, earning an income of USD 1 each per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Segundo Miguel

texts.es:
Segundo Miguel V. O. tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando formar una familia y ayudar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con los amigos del recinto.
texts.en:
Segundo Miguel V. O. is 23 years old and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He does not have children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Segundo is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Segundo is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of continuing his work so that he can start a family and help his future children.

Segundo enjoys playing soccer with his friends.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Suymbek

texts.en:
Suymbek  K.  is 46 years old, married, and has five children. He has been engaged in breeding cattle since 2002, and today he has a farm with sheep, lambs and milk cows. Also, he and his wife cultivate cotton and, with the revenues from this activity, they have been able to pay for the education of their children.  They dream of seeing their son become one of the famous doctors of the country. 

Suymbek started this business with his first loan of 30,000 KGS and now manages to earn about 15,000 KGS monthly.  Suymbek plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more sheep and cows. With the revenues, he wants to build a summer barn for his cattle. It will allow him to broaden his farm and make it more profitable.  In the future, Suymbek wants to buy a car and take his family for a vacation some day. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Iglesia lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Sadia de 28 años quien se dedica a la venta de frutas. Este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años junto con su hermana. 

Las otras integrantes Gilma de 52 años se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años y Juana de 32 años vende helados, confites y fresco.
texts.en:
The La Iglesia [The Church] group is made up of three hardworking, dedicated and enterprising women. One of them is Mrs. Sadia. She is 28 years old and sells fruit. She started this business 2 years ago with her sister. 

The other members are Gilma, who is 52 years old ans has sold food for 5 years, and Juana, who is 32 years old and sells ice cream, confit and fresh food.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit in season such as mangos, jocotes, watermelons, tangerines, oranges, granadilla, etc.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice K. is 35 years old and she is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use her loan to stock more vegetables to sell.  She is married to a policeman and they have six children, three of whom are in school. Her future goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business selling seafood products,  including fish like sardines & mackerel. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Madya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Gnima qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente d'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on the 19th of October, 2001. It is made up of nine women who all live in the same quarter and run small businesses. 

Madame Gnima - who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised - is the group's leader. She is 40 years old, married, and a mother of six children. 

She sells palm oil for a living, and has worked in this field for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and to develop her business further. 

The profits that she generates will enable her to see to her family's needs (health, food, clothing etc) andn to boost her savings.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 49 years old. She has three children who are 22 - 28 years old. She is a widow and she has not been able to educate her children; only the youngest completed primary school. She sells foodstuffs such as green bananas, beans and some fruits such as bananas. She has been doing this business for the past three years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to feed her family and sustain her business as well. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more foodstuffs and fruits and hence make more profits. She hopes to send at least one of her children back to school.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Natural  de Maputo, província de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 2 filhos de idades entre 3 e 10 anos. Fez a 12a classe e continua a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, trabalha como professor a mais de 11 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, tem um salário de 3.790.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para a construção da sua casa,os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.200.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt.
Tenciona ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e para tal vai solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joao is from the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 2 children, who are 3 and 10.  He finished studying through the 12th grade and continues taking classes.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He never left Maputo.  He has worked as a teacher for more than 11 years and works for the Ministry of Education.  He makes 3,790 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fifth loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His previous loans were for 9,200, 12,000, 12,000, and 13,000 meticals.

He plans to finish his home to provide better comfort to his family, and he is going to request more loans from Hluvuku to do so.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 37 years old. He is a committed and hard-working business man. He is married and blessed with 4 children of whom two are in school. Victor has been running a retail shop for the last 13 years. He supplements his income from the salary he gets from his employment. Victor wants to own a large outlet store in the next five years. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fats, maize flour etc. His association with Faulu Kenya has enabled his business to improve and grow. It is his dream to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fats, maize flour etc.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Robina has had a small hotel (restaurant) for three years.  She does handcrafts as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase warmers for warming her food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Robina hopes to own a poultry farm. Robina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her handle the installments.

loans.use: to purchase warmers for warming the food for resale.

loans.name: Ramona Celina

texts.es: Ramona Celina tiene 50 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lacteos, la mayoria de sus clientes saben los productos de buena calidad que ofrece. Ramona es una persona trabajadora, las ventas las realiza en su vivienda y tambien de manera ambulante ya que asi obtiene una buena cantidad de clientes. el buen carisma que brinda a sus clientes es lo que hace que Ramona proporciona diariamente. el credito que solicita es para la compra de leche, crema, cuajada y queso.
texts.en:
Ramona Celina is 50 years old.  Her business is selling dairy products, and her customers know about the good quality of the products that she offers.  Ramona is a hardworker, selling her goods from her home as well as on foot.  That is how she has obtained a good number of customers.  The charisma that she extends to her customers is what provides for Ramona daily.

The loan she requests is for the purchase of milk, cream, cuajada, and cheese.

loans.use: to buy milk, cream, cuajada, and cheese

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with four children.  Three attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business; his potential customers are passersby and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. His major dream is to own a matatu (motor vehicle) for transport business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for transport business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Ganima

texts.ru: Ganima zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Lachin, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ganima 57 let. Ona uje 9 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix soleniy. Seychas ona nudjayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit soleni dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Ganima is married and has four children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Lachin and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  Ganima is 57 years old.  She has been involved in selling various marinated goods for nine years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy marinated goods for sale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Majella ha sido presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Amigas Unidas” desde que forma parte de ella, y siente que sus compañeras la aprecian por la confianza que le han brindado.
Majella tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene un hijo varón de 20 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por menor almacenando en su casa la mercadería, no necesita colocar un letrero ni hacer publicidad, porque ya es conocida en su zona por su negocio. Los préstamos del grupo los utiliza para mantener su stock de cerveza que es aproximadamente de 10 a 20 cajas. Majella sueña con ser distribuidora local, los vecinos ya se lo piden, pero el capital que se requiere para la inversión es grande, así que tiene que esforzarse más para poder cumplirlo.
texts.en: Majella has been president of the "Amigas Unidas" ("Friends United") Community Bank since it was formed, and she feels her fellow members appreciate the confidence she provides. Majella is 50 years old, married and has a grown son who is 20. She makes a living selling beer and stores the beverages in her home. She doesn't need to have a sign or do advertising since her business is well known in her area. She plans to use the loan to maintain her stock of beer, which is approximately between 10 and 20 cases. Majella dreams of being a local distributor; her neighbors already ask her about it. But the capital required for that investment is large, so she has to work even harder to be able to fulfill it.

loans.use: to purchase cases of beer to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Victorino

texts.es:
Don Pedro de 64 años de dad, es originario de Quezalguaque municipio de León, es padre de tres hijos, es el agricultor, el siembra guayabas (fruta tropical), guanábanas y granos básicos. Anteriormente solo sembraba granos básicos pero desde hace 8 años decidió sembrar frutas tales como guayaba y guanábanas comenzó como un proyecto que inicio cuando tenia 56 años vio que era mas rentable trabajar con este tipo de siembras y puso en marcha el proyecto ahora ya es una parte de su plantación y negocio del cual sobrevive pero también vende leche y granos básicos para tener otros ingresos cuando la temporada de las cosechas son bajas.
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento, compra de insumos y fertilizantes de las plantaciones de guayaba ,pues al crédito le ayudaría a realizar un manejo agronómico de mejor calidad a sus cosechas. En sus planes futuros el quiere ser un productor de guayabas tipo jamaiquinas. Su meta próxima es duplicar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro, 64, is from Quezalguaque, León.  He’s the father of three children.  He’s a guava (tropical fruit), soursop and basic grains farmer.  He used to just farm basic grains but 8 years ago decided to plant fruit like guava and soursop.  He started this project when he was 56 years old and noted that it was more profitable to work in this type of crop so he launched the project and now it’s part of his plantation and business which is his source of support.  However, he also sells milk and basic grains in order to have other income when crop season is low.

He’s asking for the loan for crop maintenance, to buy supplies and fertilizer for the guava plants.  The loan will help him provide better agronomic management for improved crop quality.  His future plans are to become a producer of Jamaican-type guavas and his next goal is to double the size of his crops.

loans.use: to buy farmin supplies.

loans.name: Saher

texts.en:
Saher is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child.

Saher has owned his shop since 2004, selling mobiles phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more items for sale. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more items for sale

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is a married man with one child and also takes care of his sister. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a house and his goal is to educate his family members. He has been running a produce business for 5 years in which he mainly buys and sells at a margin. He has high hopes for the future and he believes his business is going to grow. He is requesting a loan to buy maize produce for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for sale

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin, a 51-year-old married father of four children, has worked as a farmer for 20 years, growing corn to generate an income to feed his family, earning P17,000 per cropping season. Despite hardships suffered in his field, Franklin devotes his time to planting and plowing the farmland to make it as productive as possible.

High interest rates on farm supplies are a major business expense, one that could be significantly reduced were he to purchase his supplies from other sellers offering low interest rates, but his funds are not sufficient to take advantage of the situation. Franklin is therefore requesting a loan of P27,000 to purchase farm supplies such as herbicides, insecticides, fertilizer and certified seed. He aspires to be a very a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as herbicides, insecticides, fertilizers and certified seed for his corn field.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor Hugo, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado y vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar cerdos para el engorde y los alimentos para su mantén. El cuenta con un local donde los tendrá para su posterior engorde y cuido. El quiere engordarlos para esta buena temporada que se aproxima de altas ventas para la carne de credo y a muy buenos precios. El tienen como meta generar el máximo de las ganancias para darles el sustento de cada día a sus hijos y poder ir mejorando su nivel económico y de bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo is 43 years old and married.  He lives with his five children and his wife, and they are his greatest priority.

He expects to use the loan to buy pigs to fatten and the food for their sustenance.  He has a place where he will fatten them and take care of them.  He wants to fatten them for the coming good season of high sales and very good prices for pork.

His goal is to generate the maximum earnings in order to give his children their daily sustenance and to be able to improve his standard of living and the well-being of his family.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other previous loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bags of rice, gallons of palm oil and tomato paste for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Hawa. She is divorced and has four children, age 27, 18, 7 and years. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she assists them with their schooling.  

In 1990, Hawa established her palm oil and gari business. (Gari is a couscous-like food made from cassava.)

She began her business because she was not educated and she needed a reliable source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about  1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more stock of palm oil and gari for her business. In the future, Hawa plans to build more houses and give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of palm oil and gari for her business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 31-year-old second-hand clothes hawker in Mombasa town. She is married and the mother of two children. She has been operating this business for the past ten years. She confesses that she is doing great as she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

Teresia was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more bales of clothes for her business and use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

She hopes to own a clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат умный и перспективный молодой человек. Он женат, ему 26 лет. На воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купля- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозкультур. Ему выгодно заниматься скотоводством, потому что он содержит их на отходы выращенных культур. Фуркат хочет расширить свой бизнес и просиь вас о помощи. Он хотел бы купить несколько голов крупного рогатого скота, 200 кг семена ячменя и 100 литров ГСМ для посева ячменя. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Furkat is a smart and promising young man.  He is 26 years old, married and is raising two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock and growing agricultural crops for over five years.  It is profitable for him to be involved in animal husbandry because he feeds livestock with leftovers from the grown crops.  Furkat wants to expand his business and asks you for help.  He wants to purchase several heads of cattle, 200 kilograms of barley seeds and 100 liters of fuel for planting barley.  He relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Evelyn has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 32-year-old married lady, who has two daughters and one son.

Nisreen has a hobby of making hair styles and doing make-up for others, and following her hobby she launched her business, a beauty salon, a year ago and managed it very well.

Now Nisreen wants to open new sections beside the make-up and hair styling room for massage and a big gymnastic room, so she has applied for a loan to buy the required equipment like a treadmill and massage tools so she can proceed with her expansion.

loans.use: to buy massage tools so she can proceed with her expansion.ز

loans.name: Dougoutiguila Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe Dougoutiguila Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec   KARIYA , 2 eme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group "Dougoutiguila Benkadi 4" are married women averaging 42 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with KARIYA, the second one standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.25 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and is the father of one child. Alae is the only provider in his family.

Alae is a mechanic who owns a small garage. He established his business in 2011, and now he has an employee. He has gained excellent experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Alae is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to purchase a machine specialized for balancing tires as well as to increase his inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a machine specialized for balancing tires as well as to increase his inventory

loans.name: Telma Josefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Thelma is married and her husband is a fisherman. She started her business two years ago in her house, in order to complement the family income, selling clothes to her friends and she got clients very fast. Now she rents a place in a local market and her merchandise is well accepted by people.

She is requesting a loan of $700 USD to stock up on merchandise for the upcoming Christmas season. When her selling increases, she thinks she be able to repay the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

La señora Thelma esta casada y su esposo es pescador, inicio su negocio hace dos años, en su casa, con el propósito de complementar el ingreso familiar, vendiendo ropa a sus amigos y muy rápido empezó a hacerse de clientela. Actualmente renta un local en un mercado y sus mercancías son muy bien aceptadas por la gente.

Esta solicitando un crédito por $ 700 USD para surtirse de mercancía para la próxima temporada navideña, época en que se incrementan sus ventas, piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is 56 year old IDP from Fizuli that is still under the control of armenian troops. After facing many hardships of being an IDP, in 2001 she rented a place in  the local market and started the business of selling women shoes. She borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first in 2001 amounting to $200 and last one in 2005 amounting $600. Now she is in need of $1000 to invest in her business and increase the variety of shoes to be sold.

loans.use: To increase the variety of shoes in her store

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya runs four little vending facilities where she sells a variety of spices and seasonings at the central food market in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Nadiya has been in business for 10 years. She has about $4,000 in inventory and presently her net profit amounts to around $1,000-$1,200 per month.

Nadiya is very friendly and cheery. Because of her cheerfulness and good service her total number of customers is consistently growing. Reasonable prices, hard-work and tenacity have helped her enterprise reach sustainability and success. The twenty loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” are another reason why her business has been so successful. While working with our organization, Nadiya was able to purchase her fourth vending facility and increase her sales volume.

Nadiya has requested a loan for $600 to purchase 10 kilograms of dried mushrooms and a variety of different spices and seasonings that she will sell in her kiosks. This loan will help her re-supply her inventory and encourage more customers to come and buy from her. Increased sales will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as to meet her family’s needs.

В Надії – чотири торгових точки, вона торгує різними спеціями та приправами на центральному продуктовому ринку в центрі Івано-Франківську. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Зараз в Надії в товар вкладено приблизно 4000 доларів. Щомісяця її чистий прибуток складає приблизно 1000-1200 доларів. Надія – привітна та життєрадісна. Завдяки її оптимістичному та гарному обслуговуванню кількість її покупців постійно зростає. Помірні ціни, наполеглива праця та цілеспрямованість допомогли Надії досягти стабільності та успіху. Двадцять позик, які вона отримала від „Надії України” також сприяли розвитку її бізнесу. Співпраця за нашою організацією надала їй можливість придбати четверту торгову точку та збільшити обсяги продажу. Надія просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб закупити 10 кілограмів сухих грибів, різні спеції та приправи для роздрібної торгівлі. Позика допоможе Надії поповнити асортимент товарів та привабити більше покупців. Збільшення обсягів продажу допоможе Надії отримати необхідні кошти для подальшого розвитку бізнесу та потреб, які мають її рідні.

loans.use: To purchase 10 kg of dried mushrooms and an assortment of spices/seasonings

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: Muslum A. has five children. He is 57 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has raised cattle for 20 years. Now he requests a loan of $725 to buy two cows in order to improve his cattle breeding and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin has been an internally displaced person since 1993. He is married and has four children. He opened his business in 1993. He has already received three loans, for $400, $500 and $600 to  open and eventually expand his shop. Currently, he wants to borrow $800 to further expand his business in order to improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo lives on Carmen Street in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He works as a wage-earning driver in the city. His wife works weaving blankets at their house. They live together with their young daughter. The credit will be used to pay for the manual labor for the connection of a sewer system at his house. Even though they live in an urban neighborhood, they cannot expect this basic service. This connection will signify an improvement in the sanitary level at his house.

This is the second credit he is seeking at IMPRO. The first credit was given in 2006 and has repaid the entire loan. He is qualified for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Narcizo vive en la calle Carmen, de la zona Villa Cooperativa, de La ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como chofer asalariado en la ciudad, su esposa trabaja tejiendo mantas artesanalmente en su domicilio. Viven junto a su hija menor. El crédito será invertido en la contratación de mano de obra para la conexión de alcantarillado a su domicilio, ya que por ser una zona peri urbana no cuentan aun con este servicio básico. Dicha conexión significa un mejoramiento en el nivel de sanidad con el que debería contar su casa. Es el segundo crédito con Impro. El primer crédito fue concedido el año 2006 y a la fecha está pagado en su totalidad. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Install a sewer system.

loans.name: Nelly Josefa Altagra

texts.en:
Nelly sells shoes for men and children. She is 39 and has one 16-year-old daughter that is finishing secondary school. Nelly has been separated from her husband for three years; shortly after her separation, she started the business in order to make a living and take care of her daughter.

Nelly has great dreams for her business. She hopes that someday she could have a location where she can run the sales activity and not have to sell in the streets and public places. She says she will continue working hard to achieve that goal.

With her loan, Nelly will purchase shoes in bulk to sell in her community. She likes to sell off her products at once and go back to the capital to buy more goods to supply her business.

loans.use: Acquire shoes to sell in her community.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula prepares and sells local dishes such as tortillas, beans, and other favorites. She has been doing this for 15 years, working very hard and making sacrifices to support her two children and maintain her simple home. To give some idea of how this business developed, it's important to note that Paula learned how to prepare these dishes when she was very young, and she used to sell them in the streets of Chinandega. However, she always dreamed of having her own establishment, and then her father gave her money to secure her own stall in the central market of Chinandega.

Paula now has three years with Ceprodel. The loans she's received have provided great benefits. She has been able to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are getting ready to attend high school in Chinandega.

El negocio a que se dedica la señora Paula es a la comercialización de productos alimenticios como lo son tortillas, frijoles, pozol y tiste. Actualmente lleva 15 años en este negocio por lo que con mucho esfuerzo y gran sacrificio ha estado logrando mantener a sus dos hijos de edad escolar y además ha podido llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Para relatar un poco su desarrollo en este negocio es importante destacar que desde muy joven aprendió a elaborar tortillas y las vendía ambulante en las calles de Chinandega sin embargo siempre tuvo el sueño de tener su propio establecimiento hasta que su padre con los ahorros que él tenia le obsequio C$ 500 con los que comenzó a utilizarlos para obtener su propio local en el mercado Central de Chinandega. Actualmente tiene tres años de obtener prestamos en Ceprodel (13 créditos hasta hoy) los cuales le han servido de mucho beneficio por el simple hecho de que ya obtuvo el local en el mercado central de Chinandega y además ha podido brindarle a sus 2 hijos mejores condiciones de vida por lo que los esta preparando en el colegio de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS FOR THE LOCAL DISHES SHE PREPARES AND SELLS IN THE CENTRAL MARKET OF CHINANDEGA.  THIS BUSINESS ENABLES HER TO SUPPORT HER TWO CHILDREN AND GIVE THEM A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa lives in the San Sebastian neighborhood in Managua. She was born in the city of León on October 11, 1963, but came to Managua to look for a better life. She's 44 years old and has a 15 year old daughter in school.

She works selling general merchandise, but specializes in selling silver and gold jewelry. She began her business 20 years ago and it's been successful, so much so that now the business depends on having much more merchandise.

She has salespeople that deliver the merchandise and for this they earn commission. She thinks that she has aquired a lot of experience in this business, she likes what she does and feels very proud to have grown this business. She needs money to buy more jewelry and continue investing in more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Luisa habita en el barrio San Sebastian. Nació en la ciudad de león el 11 de Octubre de 1963, pero emigró a Managua en busca de una mejor vida. Tiene 44 años de edad y una hija de 15 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, en especial a la venta de prendas de oro y plata. Empezó su negocio hace 20 años y ha ido prosperando, tanto que ahora cuenta con mucha más existencia de su mercadería. Tiene vendedores a quienes les entrega la mercadería y éstos ganan por comisión. Ella piensa que ha adquirido mucha experiencia en este negocio por que le gusta lo que hace y se siente muy orgullosa de haber hecho crecer este negocio. Necesita el dinero para comprar más prendas y seguir colocando su mercadería .

loans.use: Purchase of  jewelry for her business

loans.name: Bweyogerere C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Dorothy N.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beers. Dorothy is 36 years old and is married. Her husband has a butchery business. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 22 and four of them go to school. Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Dorothy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Dorothy is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Proscovia N., Lazira N., and Christine N.. Hadijah N. has a business selling matooke and wants to increase capital stock. Proscovia N. is currently operating a canteen business and wants a loan to stock more commodities. Lazira N. operates a business selling clothes and wants to expand business. Christine N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To add to bar business

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is 22 years and married with a child. Amadu is a new husband and father who needs additional business capital to begin building their family business. He sells African cotton clothes in Kabala market.

With his previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Amadu increased his stock and has involved his wife to manage the business in the homestead. The couple would like to build a stable family life and Amadu is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand his clothing business

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 38 year old woman. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Fayza sells used clothes. This is the first time she has requested a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda is a diligent and hard-working person. Her constant motivation to improve has allowed her to sell food for many years. Recently she began to sell daily breakfast from a rented space to the people who frequent the area. The warmth and quality of her service have allowed her to increase sales and this has made Teodolinda very happy. She is able to support her 11-year old son and another child that is on the way, and always makes her greatest efforts. She is requesting a loan to repair some chairs and purchase more tables for her restaurant. Support Teodolinda so she can continue successfully in her enterprising business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Teodolinda, es una persona muy trabajadora y diligente su motivación constante de mejorar la ha llevado a dedicarse durante muchos años a la venta de comida, pero recientemente se ha instalado en un local alquilado en el que oferta diariamente desayunos a las personas que transitan por esa zona, la calidez de su atención y el buen servicio ha hecho que mejoren sus ventas y eso alegra bastante a Teodolinda ya que puede sostener a su hijo de 11 años y uno que esta en camino, no escatima sus esfuerzos por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo para reparar algunas de las sillas y comprar más mesas para su local. Apoya a Teodolinda a que continúe exitosamente en su negocio emprendedor.

loans.use: Repair chairs and purchase tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Adjérétou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjérétou A., 39, was born in Sotouboua. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. She has built up a little store selling staple foodstuffs in the Attiégou district of Lomé. In her store, “ETS AICHA” certain products are missing, especially rice and vegetable oil and, in fact, this is what people in her neighborhood especially want to buy.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 20 sacks of rice and 6 tins of vegetable oil so as to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 39 ans, madame A. Adjérétou est née à Sotouboua. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle a crée un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Dans son magasin « ETS AICHA », il manque certains produits surtout le riz et l’huile végétale ; or c’est ce qui est plus acheté dans le quartier.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de riz et 6 bidons d’huile végétale afin de pouvoir mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 sacks of rice and 6 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 20 sacs de riz et de 6 bidons d'huile végétale

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Pa Lucas T. is 68 years old, and has been a farmer all his life. He is married, and the father of seven children. Pa Lucas joined GHAPE in 2002 so he could expand and diversify his farming activities, and overcome the problems he has faced all his life: poverty, sickness and death. With his first four loans, Pa Lucas has moved beyond his main crop, coffee, by adding pigs, goats, additional farmland, and palm trees, which will soon start to produce palm nuts.

Now, Pa Lucas requests a loan that he will divide equally between three small farms where he grows coffee, palm nuts, and cassava. Asked why he thinks his business will succeed, he gives the best answer first: “It is a business that I like.” He has also been trained in good farming methods and has a lifetime of experience. With the profits from his business, Pa Lucas hopes to provide a better future for his children, who are mostly grown. “I will send my children for higher education, and I will buy them plots of land so they can begin their own farms.”

Pa plans to repay his loan in 18 months, with the first installment due the fourth month after disbursement, a GHAPE procedure to accommodate the agricultural season.

loans.use: Farming coffee, cassava and palm trees

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Ms. Rocio D. is 18 years old has been married for three years with Mr. Artemio Rolon, 27 years old. The have a 2 year-old son.

Since she married, Ms. D. has been running the business that her husband set up for her. Her husband works cutting wood and with some available money they set up this business with the goal of increasing the family’s income. It’s important to mention that currently she has a client base that she has been able to form thanks to the great attention and prices offered, she provides many furniture stores in the city with wooden bed frames, dinning room sets, carved bed frames and others. She always has the support of her husband for good business management.

She is applying for a loan to buy raw materials (wood) in order to be able to fill all orders from different furniture stores.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Rocio Denís de 18 años de edad está casado hace 3 años con el señor Artemio Rolón de 27 años, la pareja cuenta con un hijo de 2 años.

La señora desde que se casó está administrando el negocio que su esposo había formado para ella, el señor se dedica al corte de madera, con el capital que dispone formaron este negocio, con el fin de aumentar el ingreso de la unidad familiar. Es importante mencionar que a la fecha cuenta con clientela formada gracias a la buena atención y precios que ofrece, le provee a varias mueblerías de la ciudad camas torneadas, juego de comedor, cama tallada y otros, recibiendo siempre el apoyo de su esposo para la buena administración del negocio.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (madera) y así cumplir con todos los pedidos que cuenta de las diferentes mueblerías.

loans.use: To purchase wood, nails and glues.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice A. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Rejoice sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman. Rejoice uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands. With the new profits, Rejoice plans to reinvest in the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles es socia del BC “Manos Unidas” y vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanes y arroz chaufa. Desarrolla su negocio en las afueras de su casa, situado en el Jr. 1º de mayo Nº 439. Hace dos años decide iniciar esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos y contribuir a la economía de su hogar y actualmente le va muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo, también comprará cecina y chorizo, los cuales que le permitirán variar los platos a ofertar y atender la petición de sus clientes.
 
Maria de los Ángeles es una mujer entusiasta de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas quienes aún son pequeñas y que además son la razón para seguir luchando y de esa manera poder darles una buena calidad de vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y su meta es retomar los estudios que tuvo que dejar por que tiene una bebé y le es necesario dedicarse bastante tiempo a ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is a member of the communal bank "Manos Unidas" (United Hands) and lives in the San Martin region and province, Tarapoto district. She sells beef and chicken kebabs, grilled meat, jaunes (a tamale-like dish) and arroz chaufa (traditional dish similar to fried rice). She develops her business around her house, located at May 1st Street, Number 439. Two years ago she decided to start this activity based on the need to generate income and contribute to the finances of her home and actually it is going very well.

With this 1,500 Soles loan, which will be paid off in a period of 6 months, she will purchase consumables for the preparation of food, such as rice, sugar, beef, chicken and pork. She will also buy cured meat and sausage, which will allow her to vary her dishes on offer and attend to the requests of her clients.

Maria de los Angeles is an enthusiastic woman of 25 years old. She lives with her husband and their 2 daughters, who are still little. They are also her reason to continue fighting and in that way be able to give them a good quality of life. She is a hardworking woman and her goal is to again start up her studies, which she had to quit because she had a baby and it was necessary to spend a lot of time with her.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, beef, chicken and pork, cured meat and sausage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to produce 'pica pollo'.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in clothing and footwear to keep running a small business.

loans.name: Dik

texts.en:
Dik N., age 43, is married with two children, ages 15 and 17. She sells fish at Phsar Pa Av market, Kampong Cham province. Dik N. purchases fish from the brokers who bought from fisherman and delivers some to the vendors at a market and keeps some for her own stand. She can typically make about $2.50 a day of net income.

Her husband works growing yams, earning around $2 a day. The revenue she and her husband make has to cover the family’s expenses, such as $40 per month on food and $15 per month on her children's tuition. Dik N. and her husband request a loan from KIVA to buy insecticide for their yam crops and to buy more seeds to increase the output.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and seeds to increase their crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Victoria es casada, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, su esposo se encarga de la atención.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Victoria son pagar todas sus deudas, darse unas vacaciones con su esposo, irse de viaje.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Village Bank “Ollantay”. Victoria is 65 years old, married and has four children. Victoria has a stall in the market “12 de Abril” where she sells potatoes and other root crops, an activity which she does every day. Additionally, Victoria has a small store in her home which her husband supervises. Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, rice and sugar. Victoria’s dream is to pay off all her debts, giving her a vacation with her husband, and time to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. sells used clothing and food supplies at Abura. Esther has received senior high school education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Esther has been selling used clothing and food supplies for about 5 years now. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses and other family expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest for the expansion of her businesses.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and food supplies

loans.name: Mr. Sambok Yung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people living in Phnum Lonteach village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sambok Y. is the 29 year old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Nouy Kim Chhroeun, is a duck breeder who owns a poultry business. Now she wants to start breeding pigs; thus, Mr. Sambok Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs and pig feed for his wife’s business. He has two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

Ten members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Arme Du Christ Group

texts.en:
The “Arme du ChriS.” or “Army of ChriS.” Group is a made of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1S. loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 2nd loan.

Though small, the group has a wide range of businesses from food sales and used clothing, to live animals. Nelly M. is one of three representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two children.

The hardworking mom sells a variety of items based on the needs of her clients. She mostly sells food items including sugar, flour, oils, rice, spices, and some vegetables. Her business and family were both able to benefit from the loan because prior to the loan, she says, her children’s meals were not as regular as they should be whereas now, the entire family is able to eat three meals a day.  She hopes to continually grow her business and increase her savings so that she may finish school, go to college and eventually get married.

On behalf of Nelly, Arme du ChriS., and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, rice, oils, and vegetables

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda E. Narváez tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Aleyda tiene 3 hijos todos estudian. La actividad económica de Aleyda es la venta de gaseosas y brinda el servicio de billares. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Aleyda inicio este negocio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Este negocio de Aleyda esta ubicado en su vivienda porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma comarca, Aleyda dice que tiene que trabajar muy duro para obtener el pan de cada día. Los propósitos de Aleyda son de ampliar su negocio y obtener más productos. El financiamiento que solicita es especialmente para capital de trabajo y con este dinero podrá comprar gaseosas, golosinas, pollo y además proporcionarle mejoras a las mesas de billar. Los sueños de Aleyda  son de mejorar cada día con el servicio ofrecido y además con el paso del tiempo convertir su negocio en restaurante.
texts.en:
Aleyda E. Narvárez, 45, is married and has three children who go to school. Aleyda sells soft drinks. She also has billiards tables. She has been working at this for over eight years. Aleyda started the business because she needed a source of family income. Her business is located in her home because the majority of her customers are from her area. Aleyda has to work very hard to earn her daily bread. Aleyda plans to expand her business and get more products. The loan she is asking for is especially for working capital. With this money she will be able to buy soft drinks, sweets, chicken, and also make improvements on her billiard tables. Aleyda’s dreams are to get better every day with the service she offers. In the future she also wants to convert her business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El sr Tomas L. esta casado con la Sra Manuela Figueredo.  Ellos tienen 1 hijo menor. 
Don Tomas se dedica a la fabricacion de menajes de aluminos como vasos, cacerolas, bandejas, champañeras etc.

El sr Tomas tiene su propia fabrica en su domicilio y la venta lo realiza en los comercios de San Lorenzo, Ita, Capiata, y Asuncion.  Esta profesion lo aprendio de su anterior trabajo donde se desarrollaba como empleado y luego decidio independizarse, luego de muchos años de trabajo.
En el futuro sueña con un local mas amplio donde pueda dar mas trabajo y seguir educando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Tomás L. is married to Señora Manuela Figueredo. They have one young son.
