She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy materials thus offering a variety for her customers to choose from. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 38-year-old woman, married with three children aged between 3 and 18 years old. She is a hard-working farmer. She lives in Hoima in Western Uganda in her own house built out of her hard work as a farmer. For 10 years now, Daisy has been involved in farming both at subsistence and commercial levels. She started the agriculture business with one acre of land but now has 5 acres of farmland. She has high hopes for the future since she believes her farm will continue to improve. She is requesting for a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and also pay costs for labor working on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy improved seeds for planting, fertilizers, and pay for labor costs for her farmland.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a single woman, aged 43. She is blessed with one child, who is in school. For the last four years, she has been running a printing business to make a living. She is also employed elsewhere. Martha has employed one person to assist in her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy stationery. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stationery.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad, Marcelina tiene una hija de 6 años. Convive hace 7 años con Raydo, quien por trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima. Marcelina y Leidy (su hija) viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. Marcelina, a pesar de su edad se dedica a la agricultura. Actividad que le inculcaron sus padres. Por su parte, ella cuenta con 3 cuadras de terrenos en los que siembra café y plátanos. “El café es rentable, pero su cosecha es una sola vez por año, en cambio, el plátano produce cada 15 días y en esos días gano de 300 a 400 soles”, cuenta. El problema más recurrente que enfrenta, es la falta de capital para abonar sus tierras. Cada 4 meses esparce el fertilizante invirtiendo no menos de 700 soles. Situación que ha sabido sobrellevar. Raydo, su pareja, no descuida a su familia, ya que cada fin de mes viaja a Chanchamayo con capital obtenido de su trabajo en un taller mecánico. Más adelante, Marcelina abrirá una pequeña bodega en su comunidad, en donde expenderá productos de primera necesidad. De esa manera podrá tener el dinero necesario para brindarle a su hija una calidad de vida que ella y su pareja no tuvieron. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Por otra parte muestra alegría por el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, por los incentivos y la oportunidad de desarrollo que el brinda. La temporada de siembra y cosecha para los meses de diciembre y enero serán prometedoras, así que, Marcelina invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de bolsas de abonos. Calcula que gastará 1400 en promedio.
texts.en: Twenty-one-year-old Marcelina has a 6-year-old daughter. She has been in a domestic partnership for the last 7 years with Raydo, who is currently living in the city of Lima because of his job. Marcelina and Leidy (her daughter) live in the house that Marcelina owns in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, Chanchamayo. Despite her young age, Marcelina works in agriculture, which she learned from her parents. She has 3 blocks of crop fields on which she cultivates coffee and bananas. "Coffee is lucrative, but it is harvested only once a year. Banana trees, on the other hand, produce every 15 days, and on those days I make 300 to 400 PEN," she states. The most frequent problem she faces is the lack of capital to fertilize her crops. She fertilizes her fields every 4 months, investing no less than 700 PEN, which is something that she has managed to bear. Raydo, her partner, does not neglect his family since he travels to Chanchamayo at the end of each month with the money that he makes at an auto shop. In the future, Marcelina will open a small general store in her community in which she will sell basic need items. Thus, she will be able to have the money she needs to give her daughter a quality of life that neither she nor her partner ever had.  This will be her fifth loan from MFP, which is why she is committed to being punctual in making her monthly repayments. Additionally, she demonstrates joy working with her communal bank because of the incentives and the business opportunities that it gives her. The planting and harvesting season during the months of December and January seem promising, so Marcelina will invest the loan in purchasing bags of fertilizer. She calculates that she will spend an average of about 1,400.00 PEN.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam, 36, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Nam is a housewife, and her husband is a construction worker. Nam is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, 35, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling chapati (flat bread) door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking-fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking-fat oil.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis has been practicing farming for the last 15 years. She is 48 years old and married to Bethwell, with whom she has four children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by another client. She paid her previous loan well and without any difficulties. She has currently applied for another loan that she plans to use to prepare land and buy seeds for planting.

She hopes to use the profits from her farm to buy an extra piece of land for farming as she is hoping to be involved in large-scale farming.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.ru: Тулганой 53 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж пенсионер, также как и она.  Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 года. Опыт в откорме скота более 20 лет. Её сыновья и дочь находятся  в Казахстане на заработках. Раньше ее муж работал  на заводе их кишлака, и мог прокармливать всю семью. После распада СССР ни осталось ни одного действующего предприятия , который бы мог обеспечивать их небольшое населения в горном регионе. И основным их источником  доходом  является купля продажа скота и денежные переводы с России или Казахстана. Не надеясь на помощь детей Тулганой  с мужем упорно разводят скот, что бы иметь постоянный доход. На новый кредит Тулганой собирается купить коз и овец.
texts.en: Tulganoi is 53 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is a retiree just as she is.  She has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009.  Tulganoi has 20 years of experience in fattening up livestock.  Her sons and daughter are in Kazakhstan for work.  Previously, her husband worked at their village factory and was able to provide for the family.  After the breakup of the USSR, no functioning factory that could support their small population in the mountainous region remained open.  Their primary source of income is buying and selling livestock and monetary transfers from Russia or Kazakhstan.  Not relying on the children's help, Tulganoi and her husband breed livestock in order to have a regular income.  Tulganoi plans to use this loan to purchase goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Lorena has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married and has 3 children.
4 years ago she started her business. She enjoys cooking our national tasty dishes such as dolma, ash, khingal, kabab  etc.
All in her region praise her dishes.In addition to our national dishes, she cooks the dishes of other nationalities.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy kitchen appliances.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Adolphine Yeze

texts.en: Adolphine is 53 years old and married. She has been involved since 1995 in selling women’s clothing and soft drinks. Between 2004 and 2007 she borrowed seven loans from IMF Hope (a Microfinance Institution in DRCongo) for business expansion. Now she applies for $1,000 to buy more women’s clothing and crates of beverages to meet the clients’ high demand in her community. Adolphine wants to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothing and crates of beverages in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Business Description

Agripina started her business using a little money she had been able to save, and she dedicated herself to the sale of fast food and fruit. On the weekends her daughters help her attend to the business. She has been able to maintain her clientele thanks to the high quality of the products she offers.

Loan Use

Agripina wants this loan to buy accessories and improve her location, in order to offer better service to her customers.

Personal Information

Agripina is 50 years old, and her husband is a clothing vendor. They have 4 daughters who live on their own. Her home is of mixed construction (part concrete, part cane). She only completed the first grade in school, so she has not been able to have the best work opportunites. That's why she started her own business. Due to insufficient capital, she has not been able to make these improvements in her location.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Agripina Inicio su negocio con un poco de dinero que pudo ahorrarse dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y frutas. En los fines de semana sus hijas le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Su clientela se ha logrado mantener gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que Agripina ofrece en su negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Agripina desea el crédito para comprar accesorios y adecuar el local para brindar una mejor atención a los clientes de su negocio

Información Personal

Agripina tiene50 años su esposo es vendedor de ropa. Tienen 4 hijas que viven de manera independiente. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta .Por contar solo con el nivel primario de educación. No ha podido tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo .Razón por la cual se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio. Por no contar con suficiente capital no ha pedido hacer mejoras en su local.

loans.use: To buy accessories and improve her location

loans.name: Lucía

texts.en:
Lucia holds the office of association secretary with Pro Mujer. She has been with this organization for 10 years. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she also sells accessories, such as purses and backpacks, which she makes herself. She has had this business for 5 years. Initially she made these items in small quantities, but even after investing in more materials and supplies, her sales still didn't generate enough income.

Lucia is requesting this loan to allow her to continue expanding her business and add a book shop at the same location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia P. Quispe Ella es secretaria de actas de la asociación Escuelitas 2 de Pro Mujer, además cuenta una antigüedad de 10 años en la organización. A la fecha es dueña de una tienda de víveres, donde también vende accesorios de vestir, como ser carteras mochilas y otros que ella misma confecciona, ambas actividades las desarrolla hace mas de 5 años. En principio Lucia confeccionaba en poca cantidad, lo que la llevó a invertir en material e insumos, pero aún esto no generaba los ingresos suficientes. En la actualidad Lucia ya es dueña de un almacén y precisa de mayor capital para poder ampliar su negocio y lograr la apertura de una librería.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas works as a salaried chauffeur for a private family: he also works as a waiter. He lives with his younger sixteen-year old brother: their house is located in the Villa Ingenio Zone in the town of El Alto.

The loan is needed to purchase a kiosk which will be use to sell street-food (french-fries, hamburgers and hot dogs). This is a new activity that Nicholas wants to embark on and thus be able to gain independence and begin his own business. Thanks to El Alto’s characteristics, street-food businesses offer good results: given the rising population in El Alto, the town now has close to a million inhabitants.

This is his second loan with Impro: the first loan was arranged in February of this year and has been completely paid back, the last payment being received in September. This prompt payment allowed the approval of this second loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nicolás trabaja como chofer asalariado para una familia particular, también trabaja como garzón, vive con su hermano menor de 16 años; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un kiosco que será utilizado para la venta de comida al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas y hot dogs). Esta es una nueva actividad que Nicolas desea emprender y así poder independizarse y comenzar su propio negocio. Dadas las características de la ciudad de El Alto, los negocios de comida al paso dan buenos resultados debido al ritmo de crecimiento demográfico de El Alto, la ciudad cuenta con casi un millón de habitantes.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Febrero de este año y fue pagado en su totalidad siendo su último pago en el mes de Septiembre. El buen comportamiento de pago permite que se apruebe este segundo préstamo.

loans.use: Kiosk purchase

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón is 36 years old and married to Mirta Pereira, 29, and together they have two children, who go to school and also help the family business by preparing and selling salted sandwiches and desserts for parties.

Ramón runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like milk, sugar, noodles, fruits and vegetables. He's been doing this for a little more than a year. Previously he worked at a shoe store, but he wasn't earning enough income so he decided to open his convenience store.

Ramón says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings, and now he's planning on selling larger quantities of all kinds of drinks like soft drinks, juices and beer, since summer is approaching and demand for cold drinks will rise considerably. The loan he's requesting well help him meet this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ramón F., tiene 36 años, es casado, su señora se llama Mirta Pereira de 29 años de edad, tienen 2 hijas, van al colegio y además ayudan con los ingresos familiares preparando y vendiendo bocaditos salados y dulces para fiestas.

El Sr. Ramón, administra el negocio familiar, que es una despensa, donde comercializan todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, fideos, frutas, verduras, etc. de esto hace un poco más de un año, ya que antes se dedicaba a la zapatería, pero como no dejaba buenas ganancias decidieron abrir una despensa.

Ramón nos cuenta que les va muy bien, el negocio genera buenas ganancias, y ahora tiene pensado adquirir en grandes cantidades bebidas de todo tipo como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, etc. ya que estamos en temporada de mucho calor y la demanda de bebidas frías aumenta considerablemente. El préstamo solicitado será utilizado para dicho fin.

loans.use: Purchase drinks like soft drinks, juices, mineral water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana is a happy woman in spite of suffering through her husband’s abandonment. With her small son in her arms, she found a way to move forward, thanks to the support of her friends and family, who knew how to help her in that difficult period of her life. She began a business making the fruit crates that farmers use to protect their goods. Her high-spirited happiness was contagious, and her neighbors quickly became her most constant customers; she serves them tirelessly, and knows she’ll always be able to count on them. Even with these innumerable excellent people, she wishes to expand her business and become a fruit producer herself, selling the fruit for herself. She is counting on you participating in her dreams through this loan, and is sure of receiving your support to get this project started so that she can forge a promising future for her little one, being sure above all that he gets a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Juana, es una alegre mujer que a pesar del abandono que sufrió por parte de su esposo y después de haberse quedado con su hijo pequeño en brazos tuvo que salir adelante; gracias al apoyo de sus amigos y familiares, quienes supieron ayudarla en esta dura etapa de su vida. Empezó un negocio de producción de cajones de frutas que los agricultores utilizan para guardar sus productos, su animosidad y alegría han contagiado a sus vecinos los cuales se volvieron en sus más asiduos clientes con los cuales puede contar siempre y trata de servir incansablemente.A pesar de contar con un sin número de buenas personas desea incrementar su negocio, siendo ella misma una productora de frutas y así comercializarlos por su propia cuenta; confía en que usted será participe de sus anhelos a través de un préstamo y está segura de recibir vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha su proyecto a fin de forjar un futuro prometedor para su pequeño y sobretodo ayudarlo a tener una muy buena educación.

loans.use: To quickly become an excellent fruit seller, using her existing fruit crate business.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis is married and has a 19 year old daughter in his care. Luis is a tailor and his wife is a dressmaker. They have a small tailor shop located in their home in the 14 de Septiembre area in Managua. Luis and his wife do work for their neighbors and also they visit businesses to offer their services for contractual work.

Luis has been in this business for many years and thanks to his good service and fine tailoring, he has earned many clients. The loan will help him aquire an electric sewing machine to be able to offer more and better products to his clients. Thanks to this business, Luis can continue to get ahead and support his family with everything that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis es casado, y tiene una hija a su cargo de 19 años. Don Luis es sastre y su esposa es modista, y los dos tienen un pequeño taller de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación en la 14 de Septiembre. Trabajan para los vecinos cercanos a la zona donde habitan, y tambien ellos mismas visitan algunas empresas para ofertar sus servicios y hacer contratos. Desde varios años atrás tiene este negocio y gracias a su servicio y costura fina ha ganado muchos clientes. El préstamo le ayudará para adquirir una máquina de coser eléctrica para poder ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes. Gracias a este negocio don Luis puede salir adelante y apoyar a su familia en todo lo que necesiten.

loans.use: Purchase electric sewing machine

loans.name: Irene Adakou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Irène Adakou A. was born in Lomé on February 7, 1965. She is single but is the breadwinner for 4 other persons. Her business is selling fried yams. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to stock a bigger quantity of yams and oil so that she can better satisfy the need of her customers and increase her income. Her dynamic personality and cleverness make her very likely to succeed in this business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Adakou Irène est née à Lomé, le 07 Février 1965. Célibataire, elle a en charge quatre (4) personnes. Son activité est basée sur la vente de frite d’igname. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui servir de s’approvisionner en grande quantité d’ignames et d’huile pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus. Le dynamise et habileté de cette dame constituent autant d’atouts pour le succès de ce projet.

loans.use:
Stocking yams and cooking oil

Stockage d'ignames et d'huile

loans.name: Kudzovi Agbessi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kudzovi Agbessi A. was born on May 28, 1979 in Agou Gadjagan a village located 110km from Lomé. He is married and has three children. His main activities are publishing and the sale of books. Meanwhile, he also provides photocopies and word processing. His business, named NETO Sarl, is located in the neighborhood of Bè-Kpéhénou in Lomé. This first loan in the amount of 300.000FCFA should allow him to acquire a new copying machine in order to replace the old one that broke down 2 weeks ago.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kudzovi Agbessi est née le 28 mai 1979 à Agou Gadjagan localité située à 110 km de Lomé. Il est marié et a trois enfants. Son activité principale est l’édition et la vente des livres. Cependant, il fait également la photocopie, le traitement de texte. Il a dénommé son entreprise NETO Sarl située au quartier Bè-Kpéhénou à Lomé. Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA devait lui permettre d’acquérir un nouveau copieur pour remplacer l’ancien qui est tombé en panne depuis deux semaines.

loans.use: Purchase of a new copying machine

loans.name: Teddy's Chapakazi A Group

texts.en:
Teddy, age 29, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 4). She has a shop where she sells clothes, which she began 1 year ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $99 from this business.

Teddy has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothing for her shop. Teddy will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell general items, fruits, and vegetables.

In the picture, Teddy is standing second from the left.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products for her small beauty salon

loans.name: Mablé

texts.fr:
Ms. Mablé D. was born in Lomé on September 12, 1973. Married to Mr. Afantchao AGBOSSON, she has three children who go to school. Since 1998, her commerce has been in pagne (traditional print cloth), shoes, and bags in the Agoè district in the north of Lomé. Sometimes she sells her merchandise from district to district as a traveling saleswoman. She is a good entrepreneur who is on her sixth loan and who makes good on her payments. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 20 bolts of pagnes, 2 boxes of shoes, and 15 tote bags.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Mablé est née à Lomé le 12 septembre 1973. Mariée à monsieur AGBOSSON Afantchao elle à 03 enfants qui vont à l’école. Depuis 1998, elle exerce le commerce de pagne, de chaussures et de sac dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Parfois elle vend ses marchandises de quartier en quartier et donc ambulante. Elle est un bon entrepreneur qui est à son 6ème prêt et rembourse bien. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 pièces de pagne, 2 cartons d chaussures et 15 sacs de sortie.

loans.use: To buy pagnes, shoes, and tote bags

loans.name: Mamso Sheiko's Group

texts.en:
This group of soldiers is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000. Their names are: Mamso T., Mamu S., Ibrahim B. M., Abdul Karim K. and Michael S.. They want a loan to give to their wives to add to their current businesses. This is a great help to the soldiers as many of them had wanted to expand their wives' businesses but lacked the required amount of money to enable them do so. They will repay their loans out of their monthly salaries.

Mamso is the group leader. He is 36 and was born in Kambiya, a town bordering neighboring Guinea. He is married with 4 children. Manso will give his loan to his wife who currently sells rice, cassava, and potatoes. She has been in this business for 3 years.

loans.use: Give to their wives to expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase spare parts for an automobile repair shop.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary level four. Christiana sells cassava dough, maize, and other food items at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Christiana uses her income to pay for feeding the family and utility bills. Christiana will use the loan to add to her capital to buy more cassava to use to make the dough and more maize for sale. With the new profits, Christiana plans to save towards the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize for re-sale
